- Wrecker: Get back. [Proceeding to lift up the ship]

- Kix: This is ridiculous! He's gonna need help to get Cody out of there!

- Crosshair: (Chuckles) He's going to get the gunship out of there, not Cody.

- Wrecker: Boom. [Picking up Cody, before the gunship explodes]

- Kix: He has internal damage. I can cut the pain. But he needs help fast.

- Crosshair: We all need help [Noticing the marching droids on the horizon]. That blast gave away our position.

- Hunter: Huh, I thought getting shot down gave away our position.

- Rex: Everyone, find cover! We'll hold this position, and let them come to us!

- Hunter: I don't think so, Captain. That's not our style. We prefer going to them. Bad Batch, Plan 82: Shockwave.

- Hunter: Let's get to work. [As the Bad Batch proceed to charge at the droids]

- B1 Battle Droid Commander: Blast them! [Opening fire on the clones]

- Tech: 45, mark 151. [Calculating the trajectory of the droid poppers]

- Hunter: 45, mark 151. [Throwing a droid popper, detonating in mid-air as Crosshair shoots it, disabling several droids]

- Tech: 75, mark 357.

- Hunter: 75, mark 357. [Throwing a droid popper at the platoon of droids]

- B1 Battle Droid: What the--! [Catching the droid popper before being blasted along with most of the platoon by Crosshair]

- Hunter: Spider droids! Fan out! [Noticing the spider droids at the rear of the platoon]

- Wrecker: Anymore? Come on! [After he and the squad defeat the remaining droids]

- Rex (to Hunter): That was some show you put on just now.

- Hunter: Just doing our job, Captain.

- Wrecker (to Crosshair): Hey look Crosshair, this little clanker likes you! (Laughs)

- Crosshair: (Scoffs) Grow up Wrecker.

- Rex: We should move out before reinforcements arrive. Our position has been compromised.


[Some time has passed, when a Separatist Landing Ship arrives at the crash scene, with Commando Droids investigating the area]

- Commando Droid (to Admiral Trench): We wanted to speak to you directly, sir. This infiltration is irregular.

- Admiral Trench (hologram): Were there Jedi with this squad?

- Commando Droid: Just clones. But using tactics like we've never seen before.

- Admiral Trench (hologram): Interesting. They're on foot now, in the middle of nowhere. Sweep the area, locate these clones, and notify me if the incursion escalates. [The Commando Droids proceed to sweep the area, as the Tactical Droid holding the holoprojector returns to the ship]


[-Later that night-]

- Jesse (to Kix): So, I get what makes the other batches unique, but what's so special about Hunter?

- Kix: He can put up with the other three.

- Tech: He was engineered with heightened senses. A place like the Cybercenter, Hunter can feel the electromagnetic frequencies from anywhere on the planet. - Jesse: And here I thought we were smart just using our holomap.

- Tech: Well, maps can be wrong. Hunter never is.

- Rex (to Cody): Hang in there Cody. [Reassuring Cody as he groans in pain]

- Rex (to everyone else): Listen up, we have to move out.

- Crosshair: Commander Cody is in no position to move.

- Rex: Already called in evac. Kix will stay with Cody until it arrives, I'm in charge now. And I've got a plan to get into that Cybercenter.

- Crosshair: If you plan's are so good, why did Commander Cody have to call us in?

- Jesse (to Crosshair): You can't talk to Captain Rex like that!

- Wrecker: Says who!? [Grabbing Jesse by the throat, and lifting him in the air]

- Jesse: Whoa! [Struggling to free himself from Wrecker's grasp]

- Rex: Put him down!

- Crosshair (to Kix): Stay out of it.

- Kix: Hey, watch it! [Confronting Crosshair]

- Tech: Uh, guys, come on!

- Hunter: Wrecker! Drop him, now.

- Wrecker: Aww! [Before dropping Jesse]

- Hunter: Fellas, come on! We're all fighting for the same thing, right? (Sighs) Alright then, let's cut the chatter, and finish what we started. We'll do it your way Captain. For Commander Cody.

- Rex: Okay. Let's gear up and move out.


[-The squad make their way to the Cybercenter-]

- Hunter (to Rex): Not our primary target. It's an outpost, should we take it? [Noticing a Separatist outpost]

- Rex: Probably easier than going around.

- Hunter: Alright, what are your orders? We pick 'em off from the tree line one-by-one?

- Rex: Actually, I was thinking we take a page from your book: Rush them head on.

- Hunter: Hah, I like your style.

- B1 Battle Droid: What the-- Clones! Get them! [Noticing the squad of clones opening fire on them]

- B1 Battle Droid (In the outpost): Hey, you're not on the right-- [Before being shot by the clones as they clear the outpost of droids]

- Wrecker: Is it over already? Aw man! [Noticing the destroyed Battle Droids as he enters the outpost]

- Hunter (to Rex): Not bad, for a reg.

- Rex: Alright, there it is: the Cybercenter.

- Tech: It looks like the Cybercenter itself has minimal guards, about 30 droids. Oh, Wait, wait, I've got a massive signal coming in. A whole platoon of droids is heading this way. [While he's operating on the outpost's computers]

- Hunter: Someone's noticed our handiwork back at the crash site.

- Rex: Yeah. Make sure you keep an eye on those incoming Separatist forces. I wanna know when they reach this outpost.

- Tech: You got it Cap.

- Rex: We've gotta move swiftly.

- Hunter: We'll grab some speeder bikes, and flank them from the back.


[-At the Cybercenter-]

- B1 Battle Droid #1 (to another Battle Droid): Do you know what's going on?

- B1 Battle Droid #2: Maybe it's another-- Hey!-- [Before being stealth killed by Rex and Jesse]

- Rex (to the Bad Batch): Is everyone in position? [Speaking into his comm link]

- Hunter: Affirmative.

- Crosshair: Affirmative.

- Tech (to Rex): Cap, you want to know when those Separatist forces breach the outpost? They're getting their just about now. [Looking at his tracking device]


[-Inside the outpost-]

- Tactical Droid (to Admiral Trench): Sir, we tracked the clone strike team here. They seem to have captured this location and deserted it. I cannot calculate the logic of this assault. [As it and a few Commando Droids investigate the attack on the outpost]

- Admiral Trench (hologram): There is no tactical advantage to taking the outpost. Their target will be the nearby Cybercenter. They must know about the algorithm. Get me in contact with the Cybercenter, at once!

- Admiral Trench ([hologram] to B1 Battle Droid Commander): Put all droids on "alert," an attack is coming!

- B1 Battle Droid Commander: An attack is coming? When? [Before its head is shot off seconds later, as the clones invade the Cybercenter]

- B1 Battle Droid (to other Battle Droids): All units to the front door! [As the clones draw closer to the Cybercenter]

- Tech: Hmm, this is a delicate operation [While hacking the Cybercenter's main door]

- Wrecker: Boom! Hah, you take to long! [As he busts the door open before Tech can unlock it]

- Tech: We're in. [After gaining access to the Cybercenter's main computer room]

- Hunter: Tech, get to work on these computers. We'll go get the regs. [Before he and Wrecker head out to get Rex and Jesse]

- B1 Battle Droid #1: What the--! [Before being killed by Hunter]

- B1 Battle Droid #2 (to Hunter): Hey, where did you come from--?! [Before being knifed by Hunter's vibroblade]

- Rex (to Wrecker): What took you so long Wrecker?

- Wrecker: Hey, this is a "delicate operation."

- Wrecker: Better get in there Cap. [Noticing an MTT coming towards the Cybercenter]


[-Rex makes his way to the computer room-]

- Tech (to Rex): Okay, I'm in. What am I looking for?

- Rex: Here's the algorithm. You're looking for a program using this sequence. [Handing Tech an encryption of the algorithm]

- Tech: Found it! This is strange [As he decrypts the algorithm]. It's not a program, it's a live signal from another planet - Skako Minor.

- Rex: A live signal?


[-Outside of Cybercenter-]

- Hunter (to Crosshair): Crosshair, we're gonna need a lift! [Speaking into his comm link, as he, Wrecker, and Jesse are fending off the incoming Super Battle Droids]

- Crosshair (to Hunter): Not gonna be a problem. [Spotting a Separatist craft in the distance through his scope]


[-Meanwhile at the computer room-]

- Tech: This is audible. [After decrypting the live signal]

- Rex: Patch me in. I wanna hear it. - Tech: What is that? [Upon hearing a garbled voice from the signal]

- Tech: It sounds almost, almost human.

- Rex: It can't be...


[-Meanwhile outside the Cybercenter-]

- B1 Battle Droid: Uh oh-- [Noticing a Battle Droid being shot, before being killed by Crosshair]

- Wrecker (to Hunter and Jesse): We gotta go, now! [Urging the them to fall back inside the Cybercenter]


[-Back in the computer room-]

- Rex: Tech, find out who is sending that signal. Ask who that is.

- *Transmission*: CT-1409. CT-1409.

- Rex: I-I don't believe it! [Perplexed by the voice coming from transmission]

- *Transmission*: CT-1409. CT-1409.

- Hunter (to Rex): We're going. Rex, let's go. Rex, now! [Urging Rex to join them as they're making their way out of the Cybercenter]

- *Transmission*: CT-1409. CT-1409.


[-Back at the outpost, some time later-]

- Tactical Droid (to Admiral Trench): Sir, we have chased the clones out of the center sir. They are retreating back toward Republic lines.

- Admiral Trench (hologram): Did they download anything from the central computer?

- Tactical Droid: There seems to be no intel missing, but there appears to have been a connection made with Skako Minor.

- Admiral Trench (hologram): What??

- Tech (to Rex): That number, Cap? What did it mean? [As the squad make their way back to their shuttle]

- Rex: CT-1409, that was Echo's number. He's alive.



Ep 11 - Shattered

332nd Clone: Watch it! (pointing his blaster at an angry Gar Saxon)
Bo-Katan: You actually captured him, I'm impressed.
Ahsoka Tano: It is what the Council wanted.
Bo-Katan: Still, you succeeded where many have failed.
Ahsoka Tano: I've learned from the best, including you.
Bo-Katan: I wish I was good at something other than war.
Ahsoka Tano: Your people need a new kind of leader.
Bo-Katan: My sister tried that. I never understood her idealism.
Commander Rex: Commander, I have the Council waiting.
Ahsoka Tano: And Master Skywalker, where you able to contact him?
Commander Rex: He was at the meeting when I left to get you.
Bo-Katan: Go on, I can handle this.
Mace Windu (hologram): I sense a plot to destroy the Jedi. The dark side of the force surrounds the Chancellor.
Ki-Adi Mundi (hologram): If he does not give up his emergency powers after the destruction of Grievous, then he should be removed from office.
Mace Windu (hologram): The Jedi Council will have to take control of the Senate in order to secure a peaceful transition.
Yoda (hologram): To a dark place, this line of thought will carry us. Hmm, great care, we must take.
Mace Windu (hologram): I understand you mission was a success.
Ahsoka Tano: Yes, I have Maul in custody. I will escort Commander Rex when he delivers him to Coruscant.
Yoda (hologram): A great service to the Republic, you have done.
Ahsoka Tano: I did my duty as a citizen.
Yoda (hologram): Not as a Jedi.
Ahsoka Tano: No, not yet. Actually, I has hoping to speak with General Skywalker.
Mace Windu (hologram): I sent him to inform the Chancellor that General Grievous has indeed been located on Utapau.
Ahsoka Tano: Master Kenobi?
Yoda (hologram): Engaged the enemy, he has.
Ahsoka Tano: Then the war could be over soon.
Mace Windu (hologram): That depends on the Chancellor.
Ahsoka Tano: What do you mean?
Mace Windu (hologram): I'm sorry citizen. These matters are for the Council to discuss.
Ahsoka Tano: I understand.
Yoda (hologram): Ahsoka, more to say, have you? A message for Skywalker, perhaps?
Ahsoka Tano: No, Master, thank you. I'll tell him myself when I see him.
Yoda (hologram): May the force be with you, Padawan.
Commander Rex: You didn't tell them what Maul said about General Skywalker.
Ahsoka Tano: No, I didn't.
Ahsoka Tano: Impressive. I suspect even Maul couldn't get out of there.
Bo-Katan: A relic of a bygone era, we Mandalorians had reason to imprison you force-wielding maniacs.
Ahsoka Tano: I thought your sister outlawed such devices.
Bo-Katan: She did. This is the last one. Goodbye, Ahsoka Tano.
Ahsoka and Rex proceed to escort Maul to a nearby Venator-class Star Destroyer

Commander Rex: Something on your mind?
Ahsoka Tano: As a Jedi, we were trained to be keepers of the peace, not soldiers. But all I've been since I was a Padawan, is a soldier.
Commander Rex: Well, I've known no other way. Gives us clones all a mixed feeling about the war. Many people, we should never happen. But without it, we clones, wouldn't exist.
Ahsoka Tano: Well, then perhaps some good has come from all of it. The Republic couldn't have asked for better soldiers, nor I, a better friend.
Clone Officer: Commander Rex, the latest briefing has come in.
Commander Rex: Want to have a look? It might have an update on General Kenobi's efforts.
Ahsoka Tano: You go, I'm sure it's more good news.

Force Vision:

Darth Sidious: You must choose! don't listen to him Anakin!
Anakin Skywalker: That's not the Jedi way, he must live!
Mace Windu: He's too dangerous to be kept alive!
Anakin Skywalker: I need him!
Darth Sidious: Unlimited power!
Anakin Skywalker: What have I done?

Ahsoka Tano: Anakin! (after sensing Anakin's fall to the Dark Side)
Darth Sidious (hologram): Execute Order 66.
Commander Rex: Yes, Lord Sidious.
Ahsoka Tano: Rex! It's Anakin. I feel like something terrible has happened.
Ahsoka Tano: Rex?
Commander Rex: No! I'll do it. (to two 332nd clones holding Ahsoka at gunpoint)
Ahsoka Tano: Rex, what's happening?
Commander Rex: Stay back! Find him. find him, Fives. Find him, Fives!
Ahsoka Tano: Rex!
Clones: Get down, get down! Hold your fire, we got her!
Shocktrooper: Sir, are you alright?
Commander Rex: Fine, I'm just tired, is all. I want you to go to the detention level, execute Maul.
Shocktrooper: Yes sir. Alright men!
Commander Rex: Alright, we know Ahsoka Tano's onboard. She's been marked for termination by Order 66. Under this directive, any and all Jedi leadership must be executed for treason against the Republic. Any soldier that does not comply with the order will also be executed for treason. Understood?
Clones: Yes sir!
Commander Rex: There are only so many places to hide on this ship. Gather up search parties, we'll fan out and move section by section. Come on, let's get moving!
Shocktrooper: Look out! (before being force pushed by Ahsoka)
Ahsoka Tano: Don't make me regret this. (after freeing Maul from his cell)
Maul: Ah, you? You survived!
Ahsoka Tano: Is this your doing? Choose your words carefully!
Maul: No, no, it was not my doing. I do not know what has occured, but surely, you have felt it. The voices crying out, the death.
Ahsoka Tano: The clones turned against me, even Rex. I don't know why, they suddenly weren't themselves.
Maul: Oh, brilliant, brilliant! I was not privy to my master's plan, but now, now I see it. He turned the Jedi's own army against them. Well, you've done the right thing by coming to me, only together can we survive this. Now if you will follow my lead-
Ahsoka Tano: You don't understand, I'm not here to team up with you. I need a diversion, and you're it. Now go cause some chaos, it's what you're good at.
Maul: Eh, care to give me a fighting chance?
Ahsoka Tano: I'm not rooting for you. Now get going.
332nd Clone: Sir, we've finished our sweep in the detention level. The prisoner has escaped. There's no sign of Tano or Maul.
Commander Rex: Destroy the escape pods, increase security on the hangar decks.
332nd Clone: Right away sir!
R7-A7 expresses surprise after being activated by Ahsoka

Ahsoka Tano: Shh! R7, I need your help.
R7 expresses concern & confusion regarding the recent turn of events

Ahsoka Tano: I know, I know! Shh! Quiet!
CH-33P and G-G are activated too, R7 continues to express concern about what has happened

Ahsoka Tano: I don't know, I-I don't know why the clones are doing this, but we might be able to do something about it.
The droids respond in agreement

Ahsoka Tano: Are you sure you want to help? It could be dangerous.
The droids respond in excitement

Ahsoka Tano: Okay! Let's get started. R7, patch in to the central computer. Bring up every secure file on Clone Trooper CT-5555.
R7 displays the files to Ahsoka

Ahsoka Tano: Okay Rex, what am I looking for?
Nala Se (hologram): An independent investigation confirms that the Clone Trooper CT-5555 experienced a malfunction with his inhibitor chip. Both the Senate Committee and the Jedi Council have accepted these findings. However, a grievance report was filed by CT-7567.
Ahsoka Tano: R7, bring up that report.
R7 shakes his head, responding that the report is sealed

Ahsoka Tano: It's sealed? Try Anakin's passcode: 8108.
Captain Rex (hologram: I already know this report's gonna fall on deaf ears, but I owe it to Fives to record what I saw. I'm not sure I believe it myself, but, there's a possibility that the inhibitor chips the Kaminoans put inside of us, have a purpose we don't yet fully understand.
332nd Clone: Fall back! Fall back! (retreating from Maul as he advances)
332nd Clone: Ridge is down! Maul is advancing towards the main hangar!
Lieutenant Jesse (via comlink): You must seal the blast doors, stop his advance!
332nd Clone: Seal the blast doors! Now!
Lieutenant Jesse (via comlink): Trooper, did you seal the doors? Trooper, if you read this, seal the doors! We want to redirect his approach! Over.
R7 communicates with CH-33P, then proceeds to intentionally bump into Rex

Commander Rex: Hey! Hey! Out of the way!
CH-33P then seals the blast doors, preventing Rex from reaching the other clones

Commander Rex: Are you crosswired??
R7 and CH-33P respond in content R7 displays a hologram of Ahsoka's message to Rex

Ahsoka Tano (hologram): Rex, I think I know what's happening. I saw your report on Fives, it isn't your fault! You were programmed. Your mind was altered to do this when you were very young. I can help you.
Commander Rex: Where is she?
R7 expresses fear when being held at gunpoint by Rex

Ahsoka Tano: I'm right here.
R7 proceeds to tase Rex, knocking him unconscious

Ahsoka Tano: Careful! We're trying not to hurt him.
Unnamed Clone behind the blast door: We lost the commander! Bring the charges!
Ahsoka Tano: Cheep, are all the doors sealed so the way is clear?
CH-33P responds in affirmation

Ahsoka Tano: Okay, let's get him to the medical bay.
The droids follow Ahsoka while carrying an unconscious Rex with them

Clones: Move it! Move it!
332nd Clone: Start working on these doors!
Ahsoka Tano: R7, run a scan, see if you can find the inhibitor chip the report talked about.
R7 responds, saying that the chip cannot be located

Ahsoka Tano: But the chip has to be there. Check again!
CH-33P warns Ahsoka about the incoming clones

Ahsoka Tano: How close are they?
CH-33P responds nervously, that the clones are very near

Ahsoka Tano: G-G, if they override the door controls, you have to reseal it fast.
G-G agrees, going to the blast door in preparation

Ahsoka Tano: R7, anything?
R7 shakes his head, saying that the chip still hasn't been found

Ahsoka Tano: (begins her incantation) I am one with the force, and the force is with me. I am one with the force, and the force is with me.
Ahsoka Tano & Rex: I am one with the force, and the force is with me. I am one with the force, and the force is with me. I am one with the force, and the force is with me.
Ahsoka Tano: You found it?
R7 confirms that the inhibitor chip is located

Ahsoka Tano: R7, get him under and remove that thing.
R7 asks if their plan will succeed

Ahsoka Tano: I don't know if it will work. But if it doesn't, we're dead anyway.
332nd Clone: Go! Go! (hurrying a fellow 332nd trooper to unseal the blast door)
Ahsoka Tano: Get ready on the door!
G-G goes over to the door controls in response

Ahsoka Tano: The door! G-G, the door! (as she's overwhelmed with blaster bolts)
Ahsoka Tano: Rex? Are you okay? (turning around to see a conscious Rex, anguished)
Commander Rex: Yeah. Yeah kid, I'm okay. Sorry for what happened earlier. I almost killed you.
Ahsoka Tano: How widespread is this?
Commander Rex: Ahsoka, it's all of us. The entire Grand Army of the Republic has been ordered to hunt down, and destroy the Jedi Knights.
Ahsoka, Rex, and the droids turn to the blast door as the clones begin cutting through

Ep 1 - The Mandalorian

[ The Mandalorian is seen walking toward a building, holding a beeping tracking fob. ]

[ Inside a cantina, two trawlers hold a Mythrol. ]

Alpha Trawler: (subtitle) Look at his glands! // (subtitle) I bet we could sell them at the port!

Mythrol: Please! Please! I have credits! Take them!

Alpha Trawler: (subtitle) He's young. The must will be sweet. // (subtitle) And now for the real prize...

[ The Mandalorian enters. ]

Alpha Trawler: (not subtitled) // (subtitle) You spilled my drink... // (subtitle) Hey, Mando! // (subtitle) I said, you spilled, my drink...

Bartender: He says you spilled his drink. // That's fine! It's on me.

Alpha Trawler: (subtitle) Is that real Beskar Steel?

Bartender: Here.

[ Fighting. ]

Mythrol: Thank you. Thank you very much. You got my heartfelt gratitude. // You know what... here, you take my credits. Buy yourself a drink.

[ The Mandalorian places a hologram puck on the table. ]

Mythrol: Uh... Is that a bounty puck? // Is that me? // Look... uh... there must be some mistake. I can get you more credits.

Din Djarin: I can bring you in warm... // or I can bring you in cold.

Title Screen

[ The Mandalorian and the handcuffed Mythrol are walking away from the cantina to a speeder stop. ]

Din Djarin: I need passage to the yards.

[ The ferryman calls a speeder which arrives with an R2 unit as pilot. ]

Din Djarin: No droids.

Ferryman: (subtitle) I assure you, this speeder is brand new. It's the latest model...

[ The Mandalorian tosses the ferryman a coin. ]

Ferryman: (subtitle) At your pleasure.

[ The ferryman calls another speeder, which arrives, in rough shape but with a human pilot. ]

Speeder Pilot: Where to?

[ The speeder flies across the icy plains. ]

Mythrol: You know what he's looking for... // You're looking for Ravinaks, right?

Speeder Pilot: It's clear right now. But be careful near the port. Everyone dumps their gray holds out. They think the whole entire planet is their own personal stink pit.

[ The speeder arrives at the Razor Crest. ]

Speeder Pilot: Here you are.

Mythrol: You're kidding me, right?

Din Djarin: Get out.

[ They get out of the speeder. ]

Mythrol: I'll hire us a Livery Cruiser. No big deal. It won't come out of your end. I'll pay for it. // I'm just trying to make it pleasant.

Speeder Pilot: Hey, it's time to go, so let's settle up.

[ The Mandalorian pays the pilot. ]

Speeder Pilot: I'd stay off the ice if I were you.

[ The speeder takes off. The Mandalorian and the Mythrol get ready to board the Razor Crest. ]

Mythrol: You think there's really something to worry about?

[ He watches the speeder – get eaten by a beast out on the ice. ]

Mythrol: Oh! Oh! Open the hatch! Open the hatch!

[ The Ravinak breaks through the ice toward the Razor Crest. The Mandalorian grabs the Mythrol and drags him into the ship. They get into the cockpit while the Ravinak grabs the Razor Crest's leg. ]

Mythrol: Dank farrik, that was close! Oh, my God. // Oh, my God. // "Stay off the ice." That's the understatement of the millennium.

[ They attempt to take off but the Ravinak holds on to the Razor Crest's leg. ]

Mythrol: It's taking us down. What're you doing? // It's got us! It's gonna take us under!

[ The Mandalorian leaves the cockpit. ]

Mythrol: Where you going? You gotta do something! We gotta get out of here!

[ The Mandalorian electrocutes the Ravinak and it lets go. ]

Mythrol: Let's go. Let's go. Let's go. Let's go. Let's go. Let's go. Let's go. Yes. All right. Whew.

[ The Razor Crest takes off and leaves the planet. ]

[ Cut to the cockpit. ]

Mythrol: I like your ship. She's a classic. // Razor Crest, am I right? Pre-Empire? // I have a lot of credits, by the way. That's why I offered to hail a Cruiser.

[ No response. ]

Mythrol: How much are they paying you?

[ No response. ]

Mythrol: Is it true that you guys never take off your helmets?

[ No response. ]

Mythrol: Oh... Boy.

[ No response. ]

Mythrol: I think I have to use the vacc tube. // I mean I can do it here, but if you've never seen a Fledgling Mythrol evacuate their thorax, you're a lucky guy, trust me.

[ No response. The Mythrol gets up. ]

Mythrol: Clearly, there's nowhere for me to go. So, uh... I'm gonna look for that vacc tube if it's all the same to you?

[ No response. ]

Mythrol: Great.

[ The Mythrol leaves the cockpit and gets down into the belly of the ship. ]

Mythrol: Found it! Thanks. // It might take a while. I'm molting.

[ The Mythrol looks around, opens the weapons hold, and quickly closes it again. ]

Mythrol: Oh, this feels a lot better. // I haven't evacuated since the solstice. // Yeah. // I was hoping to be free for...uh... Life Day. // Maybe even, uh...

[ The Mythrol discovers the bounty hold with several carbon-frozen bounties. ]

Mythrol: Get home to the... family. // But I guess that's not gonna happen this year.

[ The Mandalorian suddenly appears behind the Mythrol. ]

Din Djarin: Probably not.

[ The Mandalorian grabs the Mythrol and shoves him in the on-board carbon-freezing chamber, then adds him to the line of carbon-frozen bounties. ]

[ Cut to the arrival on Nevarro. The Mandalorian walks into a cantina to meet Greef Karga of the Bounty Hunter Guild. ]

Greef Karga: Ah, that was fast. Did you catch them all?

[ The Mandalorian places the tracking fobs on the table. ]

Greef Karga: Good. I'll begin the off-load. // (not subtitled)

[ The Mandalorian sits. Greef Karga places credits on the table. ]

Din Djarin: These are Imperial Credits.

Greef Karga: They still spend.

Din Djarin: I don't know if you heard, but the Empire is gone.

Greef Karga: It's all I've got.

[ The Mandalorian grabs the tracking fobs back. Greef Karga stops him. ]

Greef Karga: Save the theatrics. Fine, I'll...

[ He places different credits on the table. ]

Greef Karga: I can do Calamari Flan But I can only pay half.

Din Djarin: Fine.

[ The Mandalorian places the tracker fobs back on the table and grabs the credits. ]

[ Cut to the crabon-frozen bounties being unloaded from the Razor Crest. ]

[ Cut back to the cantina. ]

Greef Karga: Hmm. I have a bail jumper, a bail jumper, another bail jumper, a wanted smuggler.

Din Djarin: I'll take them all.

Greef Karga: Nah, hold on. // There are other members of the Guild, and this is all I have.

Din Djarin: Why so slow?

Greef Karga: It's not slow at all. Actually, very busy. They just don't want to pay Guild rates. They don't mind if things get sloppy.

Din Djarin: What's your highest bounty?

Greef Karga: Not much. Five thousand.

Din Djarin: That won't even cover fuel these days.

Greef Karga: Hmm. // There is one job.

Din Djarin: Let's see the puck.

Greef Karga: No puck. Face to face. Direct commission. Deep pocket.

Din Djarin: Underworld?

Greef Karga: All I know is no chain code.

[ He pulls out a chit card. ]

Greef Karga: Do you want the chit or not?

[ The Mandalorian grabs the chit card and leaves. He walks through town to a building. He knocks. A sensor eye appears asking for identification in an un-subtitled foreign language. The Mandalorian shows the chit card which the sensor reads, saying something again in an un-subtitled foreign language. The door opens and the Mandalorian enters the building. ]

Client: Greef Karga said you were coming.

[ The Mandalorian walks into the room to stand before the client. ]

Din Djarin: What else did he say?

Client: He said you were the best in the parsec.

[ A door suddenly opens, and before the person even enters, the Mandalorian draws his weapons, as do the stormtroopers. ]

Stormtrooper: Freeze!

Dr. Pershing: No!

Stormtrooper: Drop your weapons!

Dr. Pershing: No, no, no, no. Pardon. Uh, sorry. I... didn't... mean to alarm.

[ The client gets up and walks around the table to stand in front of the Mandalorian. ]

Client: This is Doctor Pershing. // Please excuse his lack of decorum. // His enthusiasm outweighs his discretion. // Please lower your blaster.

Din Djarin: Have them lower theirs first.

Stormtrooper: We have you four to one.

Din Djarin: I like those odds.

[ The client steps closer. ]

Client: He also said you were expensive. Very expensive. Please sit.

[ On a sign from the client the stormtroopers lower their weapons, as does the Mandalorian. He and the client sit. The client unpacks a cloth package. ]

Din Djarin: Beskar?

Client: Go ahead. It's real.

[ The Mandalorian inspects the ingot. ]

Client: This is only a down payment. I have a camtono of Beskar waiting for you upon delivery of the asset.

Dr. Pershing: Alive.

Client: Yes. Alive. Although, I acknowledge that bounty hunting is a complicated profession. This being the case, proof of termination is also acceptable for a lower fee.

Dr. Pershing: That is not what we agreed upon.

Client: I'm simply being pragmatic.

Din Djarin: Let's see the puck.

Client: I'm afraid discretion dictates a less traditional agreement. We can only offer you a tracking fob.

[ Dr. Pershing hands the Mandalorian a tracking fob. ]

Din Djarin: What's the chain code?

Client: We can only provide the last four digits.

Din Djarin: Their age? That's all you can give me?

Client: Yes. They're 50 years old. We can also give you last reported positional data. Between that and the fob, a man of your skill should make short work of this.

[ The Mandalorian gets up and moves to leave. ]

Client: The Beskar belongs back into the hands of a Mandalorian. It is good to restore the natural order of things after a period of such disarray, don't you agree?

[ The Mandalorian leaves. He walks through town and covertly enters an underground facility, sitting down with a Mandalorian armorer. He places credits and the beskar ingot on the table. ]

Armorer: (Inspecting the ingot.) This was gathered in the Great Purge. It is good it is back with the Tribe.

Din Djarin: Yes.

Armorer: A pauldron would be in order. // Has your signet been revealed?

Din Djarin: Not yet.

Armorer: Soon.

[ The armorer prepares to forge the pauldron. ]

Armorer: This is extremely generous. The excess will sponsor many Foundlings.

Din Djarin: That's good. // I was once a Foundling.

Armorer: I know.

[ While the armorer forges the pauldron, the Mandalorian has flashbacks to a moment of his childhood. He is seen carried by his father, accompanied by his mother, making their way through flighting and explosions until he is hidden away. Then the armorer places the pauldron on his shoulder. ]

[ Cut to the Razor Crest approaching, then landing on Arvala-7. The Mandalorian scans the landscape – until suddenly attacked by a blurrg, a second one joining. They fight until the blurrgs are tranquilized by Kuiil. ]

Din Djarin: Thank you.

Kuiil: You are a bounty hunter.

Din Djarin: Yes.

Kuiil: I will help you. // I have spoken.

[ Cut to Kuiil's residence. ]

Kuiil: Many have passed through. // They seek the same one as you.

Din Djarin: Did you help them?

Kuiil: Yes. // They died.

Din Djarin: Well, then I don't know if I want your help.

Kuiil: You do. I can show you to the encampment.

Din Djarin: What's your cut?

Kuiil: Half.

Din Djarin: Half the bounty to guide? Seems steep.

Kuiil: No. Half of the blurrg you helped capture.

Din Djarin: The blurrg? You can keep them both.

Kuiil: No, you will need one. To ride. The way is impossible to pass without a blurrg mount.

Din Djarin: I don't know how to ride blurrg.

Kuiil: I have spoken.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian being thrown by a blurrg. ]

Kuiil: Perhaps if you removed your helmet.

Din Djarin: Perhaps he remembers I tried to roast him.

Kuiil: This is a female. The males are all eaten during mating.

[ The Mandalorian tries again, and gets thrown again. ]

Din Djarin: I don't have time for this. Do you have a Landspeeder or Speeder bike that I could hire?

Kuiil: You are Mandalorian! Your ancestors rode the great Mythosaur. Surely you can ride this young foal.

[ The Mandalorian approaches the blurrg again. ]

Din Djarin: Easy. Easy. Now, all right. Settle down. Whoa! Settle. Settle. That's good. That's good. Easy. Okay. That's good. All right.

[ He finally mounts the blurrg – and it doesn't throw him. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian and Kuiil riding across the landscape on blurrg. ]

Kuiil: That is where you'll find your quarry.

[ The Mandalorian hands Kuiil a bag of credits, but Kuiil waves off. ]

Din Djarin: Please. You deserve this.

Kuiil: Since these ones arrived, this territory has been an endless stream of mercenaries seeking reward and bringing destruction.

Din Djarin: Then why did you guide me?

Kuiil: They do not belong here. Those that live here come to seek peace. There will be no peace until they're gone.

Din Djarin: Then why do you help?

Kuiil: I have never met a Mandalorian. I've only read the stories. If they are true, you will make quick work of it. Then there will again be peace. I have spoken.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian reconning the encampment from a far off cliff edge. ]

Din Djarin: Oh, no. Bounty Droid.

[ Cut to the encampment. ]

IG-11: Subparagraph 16 of the Bondsman Guild protocol waiver compels you to immediately produce said asset.

[ Fighting. The droids shoots all in sight, the rest hole up. ]

Din Djarin: (exasperated) Droids.

IG-11: Subparagraph 16 of the Bondsman Guild protocol waiver compels you to immediately produce said asset.

[ The Mandalorian appears from behind a pillar. ]

Din Djarin: IG Unit! Stand down.

[ A shot from IG-11 throws the Mandalorian backward. ]

Din Djarin: I'm in the Guild!

IG-11: You are a Guild member? I thought I was the only one on assignment.

Din Djarin: That makes two of us. So much for the element of surprise.

IG-11: Sadly, I must ask for your fob. I have already issued the writ of seizure. The bounty is mine.

Din Djarin: Unless I'm mistaken, you are, as of yet, empty-handed.

IG-11: This is true.

Din Djarin: I have a suggestion.

IG-11: Proceed.

Din Djarin: We split the reward.

IG-11: This is acceptable.

Din Djarin: Great. Now let's regroup, out of harm's way, and form a plan.

IG-11: I will of course receive the reputation merits associated with the mission.

Din Djarin: Can we talk about this later?

IG-11: I require an answer if I am to proceed-- Oh, no. Alert. Alert. Alert.

[ Gunfighting. ]

Din Djarin: Let's go!

[ Gunfighting. The Mandalorian pulls out the fob and points to a steel door. ]

Din Djarin: He's in there!

IG-11: Affirmative.

[ Gunfighting. ]

Din Djarin: Up top!

[ They take cover behind pillars while the enemies are surrounding them. ]

IG-11: It appears we are trapped. I will initiate self-destruct sequencing.

Din Djarin: Whoa! You're what?

IG-11: Manufacturers Protocol dictates I cannot be captured. I must self-destruct.

Din Djarin: Do not self-destruct. // Cover me!

[ The Mandalorian attempts to open the door, to no avail. ]

Din Djarin: Go! Go! Go! There's too many!

[ Gunfighting. ]

Din Djarin: They got us pinned.

[ The enemies bring out a heavy gun. ]

IG-11: I will initiate self-destruct.

Din Djarin: Do not self-destruct! We're shooting our way out.

[ They come out of hiding, facing the heavy gun. ]

Din Djarin: Okay...

[ They take cover again. ]

Din Djarin: New plan!

IG-11: Beginning self-destruct countdown.

Din Djarin: No! Stop it! // Draw their fire, I'll take it out.

IG-11: Acceptable.

Din Djarin: Go!

[ The IG unit runs out to draw the fire while the Mandalorian grapples the heavy gun and shoots all remaining enemies. ]

IG-11: Well done. // I will disengage self-destruct initiative.

[ The Mandalorian helps the IG unit up. ]

Din Djarin: You know, you're not so bad. For a droid.

IG-11: Agreed.

Din Djarin: That blaster hit looks nasty. You okay?

IG-11: Running a quick diagnostic. // It has missed my central wiring harness.

Din Djarin: Is that good?

IG-11: Yes.

Din Djarin: Well, now we just need to get the door open.

[ They shoot the door open with the heavy gun. Inside, a lone enemy jumps out – and is shot down. ]

Din Djarin: Anyone else?

IG-11: The tracking fob is still active. My sensors indicate that there is a life form present.

[ The Mandalorian scans the room. The tracking fob leads them to an egg shaped container. He opens it. ]

Din Djarin: Wait. They said 50 years old.

IG-11: Species age differently. // Perhaps it could live many centuries.

[ The Child slowly emerges from a blanket. ]

IG-11: Sadly, we'll never know.

[ The IG unit starts to raise its gun but the Mandalorian stops it. ]

Din Djarin: No. We'll bring it in alive.

IG-11: The commission was quite specific. The asset was to be terminated.

[ A shot is fired. The IG unit drops to the ground, shot down by the Mandalorian. ]




Ep 2 - The Child

[ The Mandalorian is seen walking through a canyon, the egg shaped crib with the Child floating alongside him. Suddenly he is attacked. One of them drops a tracking fob after he is disintegrated. ]

Title Screen

[ Cut to a campfire scene where the Mandalorian is tending to his wound. The Child attempts to help him. He puts it back in the crib. Twice. ]

[ Next morning has the Mandalorian finding his ship being dismantled by Jawas. He disintegrates a few of them and sends them fleeing in their sandcrawler. He follows the sandcrawler and attempts to board it. In the end he falls off to lie in the dirt. He returns to his ship, finding all his weapons gone. An attempt to start the ship is to no avail, so he leaves and returns to Kuiil's residence. ]

Kuiil: I thought you were dead.

[ Kuiil watches the Child. ]

Kuiil: This is what was causing all the fuss?

Din Djarin: I think it's a child.

Kuiil: It is better to deliver it alive then.

Din Djarin: My ship has been destroyed. I'm trapped here.

Kuiil: Stripped. Not destroyed. The Jawas steal. They don't destroy.

Din Djarin: Stolen or destroyed – makes no difference to me.

[ He watches the Child chase a frog. ]

Din Djarin: They're protected by their crawling fortress. There is no way to recover the parts.

Kuiil: You can trade.

Din Djarin: With Jawas? Are you out of your mind?

Kuiil: I will take you to them. I have spoken.

[ The Mandalorian sees the Child devour the frog. ]

Din Djarin: Hey! Spit that out.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian and Kuiil trecking through a rainy night, coming upon the sandcrawler in daylight. ]

Kuiil: (waving) (subtitled) Greetings! // They really don't like you for some reason.

Din Djarin: Well, I did disintegrate a few of them.

Kuiil: You need to drop your rifle.

Din Djarin: I'm a Mandalorian. Weapons are part of my religion.

Kuiil: Then you're not getting your parts back.

Din Djarin: (sighs) Fine.

[ He puts the rifle down. Kuiil dismounts the blurrg, the Mandalorian gets off the sled. ]

Kuiil: And the blaster.

[ The Mandalorian puts the blaster away, and they all sit down. ]

Kuiil: They will trade all the parts for the beskar.

Din Djarin: I'm not gonna trade anything. These are my parts. They stole them from me. // (subtitled) They, they... belong... to me!

Jawa: (subtitled) You speak terrible Jawa. // (subtitled) You sound like a Wookiee.

Din Djarin: You understand this?!

[ He blasts a stream of fire from his vambrace flamethrower at them. ]

Kuiil: No! Whoa, easy, easy. (subtitled) He is Mandalorian. He cannot give you his beskar armor. What else may he trade?

[ The Jawa says something not subtitled and points to the sled. Two Jawas are inspecting the Child. ]

Din Djarin: Get away from it!

[ The Jawas scatter. ]

Kuiil: There must be something else.

[ The Jawa turn to discuss amongst themselves, then turn back around. ]

Jawa: (subtitled) We will require The Egg. Bring us The Egg.

[ Kuiil groans and facepalms. ]

Din Djarin: The Egg? What Egg?

Jawas: (subtitled) The Egg! The Egg! The Egg! The Egg!

[ Everybody travels in the sandcrawler to where The Egg is to be found. The Mandalorian goes to enter the lair of the mudhorn. Once he finds the creature, he proceeds to get trashed by the beast in a mudfight – until the Child uses mind force to stop the mudhorn long enough for the Mandalorian to kill it. Then he retrieves The Egg from the lair. ]

[ Cut to the sandcrawler where the Jawas prepare to leave. ]

Kuiil: Just a little while longer. // Fine. Go without me. // (sighs) [ The Mandalorian appears over the edge. ]

Kuiil: Mando!

Din Djarin: I have it. // I've got The Egg.

[ The Jawas take The Egg, proceed to cut it open and eat its contents. The Mandalorian just shakes his head and meets up with Kuiil. ]

Din Djarin: I'm surprised you waited.

Kuiil: I'm surprised you took so long.

[ Cut to Kuiil and the Mandalorian returning with the sled full of parts, the Child fast asleep in its crib. ]

Kuiil: I it still sleeping?

Din Djarin: Yes.

Kuiil: Was it injured?

Din Djarin: I don't think so. Not physically.

Kuiil: Explain it to me again. I still don't understand what happened.

Din Djarin: Neither do I.

[ At night time they arrive at the ship. ]

Din Djarin: There is no way we're gonna get this to work without a full maintenance facility. This is gonna take days to fix.

Kuiil: If you care to help it might go faster. There is much work to do.

[ Kuiil and the Mandalorian work together to fix the ship while the Child sleeps. ]

Din Djarin: I can't thank you enough. Please allow me to give you a portion of the reward.

Kuiil: I cannot accept. You are my guest, and I am therefore in your service.

Din Djarin: I could use a crew member of your ability. And I can pay handsomely.

Kuiil: I am honoured. But I have worked a lifetime to finally be free of servitude.

Din Djarin: I understand. Then... all I can offer is my thanks.

Kuiil: And I offer mine. Thank you for bringing peace to my valley.

[ Kuiil leaves the ship and mounts his blurrg. ]

Kuiil: And good luck with the Child. May it survive and bring you a handsome reward. I have spoken.

[ The Mandalorian leaves the planet. ]

End.



Ep 3 - The Sin

[ The Mandalorian is seen in the cockpit of the Razor Crest, flying through space. In the background, the Child can be seen climbing out of its crib. A hologram message from Greef Karga pops up. ]

Greef Karga: Mando! I received your transmission. Wonderful news. Upon your return, deliver the quarry directly to the client. I have no idea if he wants to eat it or hang it on his wall but he's very antsy. Safe passage. You know where to find me.

[ In the meantime, the Child has unscrewed the knob of a lever and is chewing on it. Carefully, the Mandalorian takes the knob away. ]

Din Djarin: It's not a toy.

[ He places the Child back in its crib. ]

[ Cut to landing on Nevarro. The Mandalorian exits the Razor Crest, the crib with the Child floating beside him, and walks through town to the building of the client. He knocks and the entry sensor appears. Then the door opens and two stormtroopers appear. They all enter the building. One of the stormtroopers grabs on to the crib. ]

Din Djarin: Easy with that.

Stormtrooper: You take it easy.

[ They enter the room where the client gets up from behind the table with a tracking fob, approaching the floating crib. ]

Client: Yes. Yes, yes, yes.

[ The client and Dr. Pershing inspect the Child. ]

Dr. Pershing: Yes...

[ Dr. Pershing scans the Child. ]

Dr. Pershing: Very healthy. Yes.

Client: Your reputation was not unwarranted.

Din Djarin: How many fobs did you give out?

Client: This asset was of extreme importance to me. I had to ensure its delivery. But to the winner...

[ The client lifts a camtono and places it on the table. ]

Client: ...go the spoils.

[ The client opens the camtono, revealing two large stacks of Beskar ingots (20 altogether). The Mandalorian approaches and takes a couple of ingots to inspect them. ]

Client: Such a large bounty for such a small package.

[ The Mandalorian watches as the floating crib with the Child disappears into the next room with Dr. Pershing. ]

Din Djarin: What are your plans for it?

Client: How uncharacteristic of one of your reputation. You have taken both, commission and payment.

[ More Stormtroopers slowy enter the room. ]

Client: Is it not the code of the guild that these events are now forgotten? That Beskar is enough to make a handsome replacement for your armor. Unfortunately, finding a Mandalorian in these trying times is more difficult than finding the steel.

[ The Mandalorian places the two Beskar ingots back and closes the camtono. ]

Title Screen

[ The Mandalorian walks through town with the camtono, entering the underground tunnels to meet with the armorer. She takes out the Beskar ingots while other Mandalorians approach in the background. ]

Armorer: This amount can be shaped in many ways.

Din Djarin: My armor has lost its integrity. I may need to begin again.

Armorer: Indeed. I can form a full cuirass. This would be in order for your station.

Din Djarin: That would be a great honour.

Armorer: I must warn you, it will draw many eyes.

[ Paz Vizsla walks in and grabs one of the Beskar ingots. ]

Paz Vizsla: (derisive snort) These were cast in an Imperial smelter. These are the spoils of the Great Purge. The reason we live hidden like sandrats.

[ He tosses the ingot back on the table. ]

Armorer: Our secrecy is our survival. Our survival is our strength.

Paz Vizsla: Our strength was once in our numbers. Now we live in the shadows and only come above ground one at a time. Our world was shattered by the Empire with whom this coward shares tables.

[ He steps forward and grabs onto Din Djarin's helmet in an attempt to pull it off. Djarin fights back. They fight until they have each other at knifepoint and the armorer gets up. ]

Armorer: The Empire is no longer, and the Beskar has returned. When one chooses to walk the way of the Mandalore you are both hunter and prey. How can one be a coward if one chooses this way of life? Have you ever removed your helmet?

Din Djarin: No.

Armorer: Has it ever been removed by others?

Din Djarin: Never.

Armorer: This is the way.

Mandalorians: This is the way.

[ Vizsla and Djarin let off each other. ]

Paz Vizsla: This is the way.

Armorer: What caused this damage?

Din Djarin: A mudhon.

Armorer: Then you have earned the mudhorn as your signet. I shall craft it.

[ The Mandalorian and the armorer sit back down. ]

Din Djarin: I can't accept. It... wasn't a noble kill. I was... helped by an enemy.

Armorer: Why would an enemy help you in battle?

Din Djarin: It... did not know it was my enemy.

Armorer: Since you forego a signet I shall use the excess to forge whistling birds.

Din Djarin: Whistling birds will do well. Reserve some for the foundlings.

Armorer: As it should always be. The foundlings are the future. This is the way.

Mandalorians: This is the way.

Din Djarin: This is the way.

[ The armorer turns to forging. ]

Armorer: Whistling birds are a powerful defense against multiple enemies. Use them sparingly for they are rare.

[ While the armorer forges, the Mandalorian experiences flashbacks again. ]

[ Cut to the common house. ]

Greef Karga: Look, I told you I'm not interested in your excuses.

[ Un-subtitled response from the bounty hunter. ]

Greef Karga: You had your shot, dust breather [confirmation needed], but you failed. No pucks for you. Now get outta here.

[ The Mandalorian enters in his new full Beskar armor. Greef Karga discovers him walking towards him. ]

Greef Karga: Ah! Mando! (laughs) They all hate you, Mando. Because you're a legend!

Din Djarin: How many of them had tracking fobs?

Greef Karga: (scoffs) All of them. ALL of them! But not one of them closed the deal. Only you, Mando. Only you. And with it, the richest reward this parsec has ever seen. Please, sit my friend.

[ The Mandalorian takes the rifle off his back and sits. ]

Greef Karga: They're all weighing the Beskar in their minds but not me. No. I, for one, I celebrate your success. Because it is my success as well. Hell... (he partially pulls two Beskar ingots out of this jacket) even I'm rich. Now, how can I show my gratitude to my most valuable partner?

Din Djarin: I want my next job.

Greef Karga: Next job? Take some time off. Enjoy yourself. I'll take you to the Twi'lek healing baths.

Din Djarin: I want my next job.

Greef Karga: Sure. Fine. You hunters like to keep busy, right? Well, these (he places bounty pucks on the table) are all far away.

Din Djarin: The further, the better.

Greef Karga: Well, take your pick. You've earned it.

[ The Mandalorian places one of the pucks on the table and turns on the hologram. ]

Greef Karga: Ah... that's the best of the lot. A nobleman's son. Skipped bail. Looks like you're headed to the ocean dunes of Karnac.

[ The Mandalorian grabs the puck and gets up to leave, then halts. ]

Din Djarin: Any idea what they're gonna do with it?

Greef Karga: With what?

Din Djarin: The kid.

Greef Karga: I didn't ask. It's against the Guild Code.

Din Djarin: They work for the Empire. What are they doing here?

Greef Karga: The Empire is gone, Mando. All that are left are mercenaries and warlords. But if it bothers you, just go back to the Core and report them to the New Republic.

Din Djarin: That's a joke.

Greef Karga: Mando, enjoy your rewards. Buy a camtono of spice. By the time you come out of hyperdrive you will have forgotten all about it.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian entering the Razor Crest. He turns on the controls in the ship, halting when reaching to grab the lever without its knob on the top. He slowly screws the knob on and proceeds to power up the ship. Then halts again. He powers everything down again and leaves the cockpit to march through town. ]

[ Cut to the client's building. The Mandalorian recons the surroundings and finds the discarded crib of the Child. From a rooftop, the Mandalorian listens in on a conversation. ]

Client: I don't care. I order you to extract the necessary material and be done with it.

Dr. Pershing: (intelligble) He has explicitly ordered us to bring it back alive.

Client: Finish your business quickly, as I no longer can guarantee your safety.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian knocking on the front door. The entry sensor appears, which the Mandalorian breaks off to flush out the guard. ]

Stormtrooper: Check the perimeter.

[ The Mandalorian enters the building by blowing out a wall and proceeds to clear the building room by room. He enters the room that holds the Child. ]

Dr. Pershing: No, no, no, no, please. Please. No. No, no.

[ The Mandalorian shoots a hovering IT-O Interrogation Unit, then approaches. ]

Dr. Pershing: No, please. Please, don't hurt him. It's just a child. Please. No. No!

[ The Mandalorian grabs Dr. Pershing and tosses him to the side, then trains his blaster on him. ]

Dr. Pershing: Please. No. No, no!

Din Djarin: What did you do to it?

Dr. Pershing: I....

Din Djarin: What did you do to it?!

Dr. Pershing: I... I protected him! I protected him! If it wasn't for me, he would already be dead! (whimpering) Please... please... please, please...

[ Dr. Pershing looks up from cowering in fear to find the Mandalorian and the Child gone. With the Child in his arms, the Mandalorian proceeds through the building. ]

Stormtrooper: Look, there!

Stormtrooper: Split up. We'll flush him out.

Stormtrooper: Give it up! There's no--

[ He is taken down by the Mandalorian before he can finish. ]

Stormtrooper: Hey!

[ The Mandalorian enters the room where he had met the client. Stormtroopers enter from the otherside. ]

Stormtrooper: Freeze!

Stormtrooper: Don't move!

Stormtrooper: Hands up!

Stormtrooper: Drop the blaster!

Din Djarin: Wait. What I'm holding is very valuable. Here...

[ Slowly, the Mandalorian lowers his blaster and the Child to the ground. ]

Stormtrooper: Now turn and face me!

[ The Mandalorian engages the whistling birds. ]

Stormtrooper: Stand up!

[ The whistling birds fly out and kill the Stormtroopers. The Mandalorian gathers up the Child and his blaster and exits the building. ]

[ Cut to the common house where all the tracking fobs reactivate. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian walking through the town streets. Tracking fobs activate and bounty hunters start following him. He is finally stopped on the main street. ]

Greef Karga: Welcome back, Mando. Now put the package down.

Din Djarin: Step aside. I'm going to my ship.

Greef Karga: Hm. You put the bounty down and perhaps I'll let you pass.

Din Djarin: The kid's coming with me.

Greef Karga: If you truly care about the kid, then you put it on the speeder and we'll discuss terms.

Din Djarin: How do I know I can trust you?

Greef Karga: Because I'm your only hope.

[ The Mandalorian moves towards the speeder, surrounded by bounty hunters with their weapons trained on him. Suddenly he starts shooting and jumps on the speeder, hiding between the cargo. ]

Din Djarin: Drive! (pointing the blaster at the reluctant droid) Drive!

[ The speeder starts moving down the street, a blaster fight all around it. Finally the speeder is stopped by Greef Karga shooting out the droid pilot. From his hiding spot between the cargo, the Mandalorian disintegrates a few bounty hunters, and they take cover. ]

Greef Karga: That's one impressive weapon.

Din Djarin: Here's what I'm gonna do: I'm gonna walk to my ship with the kid and you're gonna let it happen.

Greef Karga: (while waving bounty hunters to surround the speeder) Nah... How about this: WE take the kid, and if you try to stop us we kill you and we strip your body for parts.

[ Meanwhile the Mandalorian has noticed someone creeping up behind him. He kicks him back and electrocutes him. Eventually he gets pinned down though. ]

Greef Karga: Don't hit the target!

[ Just as Mando seems to think about giving up, Mandalorinas appear to fight for him. Greef Karga looks on and then flees. ]

Paz Vizsla: Get outta here. We'll hold them off.

Din Djarin: You're going to have to relocate the covert.

Paz Vizsla: This is the way.

Din Djarin: This is the way.

[ The Mandalorian gathers up the Child and flees toward his ship. Upon entering the ship, someone comes out of the shadows behind him. ]

Greef Karga: Hold it, Mando.

[ The Mandalorian turns to see Greef Karga pointing a blaster at him. ]

Greef Karga: I didn't want it to come to this. But then you broke the Code.

[ The Mandalorian shoots his grappling hook into a pipe which sprays out fumes, in which he disappears. Greef Karga shoots into the mist but eventually gets thrown back by a blast into his chest which the Mandalorian shot through the mist. The Razor Crest takes off, leaving Greef Karga's body behind, as well as the fight between the bounty hunters and the Mandalorians. Greef Karga though is not dead – the Beskar steel ingots saved his life. ]

[ Cut to the Razor Crest cockpit. A Mandalorian with a jetpack appears beside the ship, saluting Djarin before dropping away again. ]

Din Djarin: I gotta get one of those...

[ The Child comes up to the dashboard, reaching for the knob on the lever. The Mandalorian unscrews it and gives it to the Child. ]

[ Cut to the Razor Crest flying away from Nevarro and disappearing into hyperspace. ]

End.




Ep 4 - Sanctuary

[ In a quiet farming village, people are harvesting blue krill. The children are playing. A young girl chases after a frog. ]

Winta: I'm gonna get you!

[ Suddenly, loud noises from the forest. Then all hell breaks loose as bandits move in to raid the village. ]

Stoke: Go, go, go!

Caben: They're back!

Winta: Mama! Mama! Mama!

Omera: Winta!

Winta: Mama!

[ Omera grabs Winta and jumps into a krill pond, waiting out the raid under a basket in the water. ]

Title screen.

[ Cut to the Razor Crest flying through space, then into the cockpit. The Child is seen pushing buttons. ]

Din Djarin: Stop touching things.

[ The Child looks at the Mandalorian innocently and provocatively moves to push another button. The Mandalorian grabs the Child and puts it on his lap. ]

Din Djarin: Let's see... Sorgan. Looks like there is no star port, no industrial centers, no population density. A real backwater skug hole. Which means it's perfect for us. Ready to lay low and stretch your legs for a couple of months, you little womp rat? Nobody's gonna find us here.

[ Cut to the village where Omera and the villagers watch the Razor Crest fly by. ]

Din Djarin: Now listen, I'm gonna go out there and I'm gonna look around. It shouldn't take too long.

[ He gets up and puts the Child on his seat. ]

Din Djarin: Now...don't touch anything! I'll find us some lodging, then I'll come back for you. (firmly) You stay right here. You stay. Don't move. You understand? Great.

[ He leaves the cockpit and opens the ramp, just to find the Child standing right next to him looking up at him with googly eyes. He sighs.]

Din Djarin: Oh, what the hell... Come on.

[ He leaves the ship, the Child following him through the woods. ]

[ Cut to a common house which the Mandalorian and the Child enter. People are looking and pointing as the Child looks around. One woman, looking like a warrior, seems particularly interested in their arrival. The Child is startled by a tooka-cat. They sit at a table. ]

Proprietor: Welcome travellers. Can I interest you in anything?

Din Djarin: Bone broth, for the little one.

Proprietor: Oh, well, you're in luck. I just took down a grinjer, so there's plenty. Can I interest you in a porringer of broth as well?

Din Djarin: (shaking his head) Just the one.

Proprietor: Very well--

Din Djarin: That one over there, when did she arrive?

Proprietor: Uh...I've seen her here for the last week or so.

Din Djarin: What's her business here?

Proprietor: Business? Oh well...there's not much business in Sorgan so I can't say...

[ He tosses some coin on the table. The common house proprietor looks down at it. ]

Proprietor: She doesn't strike me as a log runner...well... (taking the coin) thank you, sir. I will get that broth to you as soon as possible, and I will throw in a flagon of spotchka, just for good measure. I'll be right back with that.

[ The common house proprietor leaves, and the Mandalorian notices that the warrior woman is gone. He gets up and moves to leave, leaving the Child behind at the table. He tosses another coin at the proprietor. ]

Din Djarin: Keep and eye on the kid.

Proprietor: (catching the coin with surprise) Yes, sir.

[ He exits the common house, looking around, then using his HUD to find recent footprints leading between the huts - which suddenly end. He is jumped by the warrior woman and they fight hard and heavy until they have each other at blaster point - at which point they notice a slurping sound. It is the Child, watching them, sipping its broth. ]

Din Djarin: You want some soup?

[ Cut into the common house where the Mandalorian sits with the woman and the Child at a table. ]

Cara Dune: Saw most of my action mopping up after Endor [confirmation needed], mostly ex-Imperial warlords. They wanted it fast and quiet. They'd send us in on the drop ships. No support, just us. Then when the Imps were gone, the politics started. We were peacekeepers, protecting delegates, suppressing riots. Not what I signed up for.

Din Djarin: How'd you end up here?

Cara Dune: Let's just call it an early retirement. (sips) Look, I knew you were Guild. I figured you had a fob on me. That's why I came at you so hard.

Din Djarin: Yeah, that's what I figured.

Cara Dune: Well, this has been a real treat. (she gets up) But unless you wanna go another round, one of us is gonna have to move on, and I was here first.

[ She finishes her soup, sets the cup down and walks away. The Mandalorian turns to the Child. ]

Din Djarin: Well, looks like this planet's taken.

[ Cut to two men riding on a cargo sled through the woods at night until they come upon the Razor Crest where the Mandalorian is working on some repairs. The men approach the Mandalorian. ]

Stoke: Excuse me.

Caben: Excuse me, sir.

Din Djarin: (dismissively) There something I can help you with? (he keeps working)

Caben: Uh...yeah... Raiders.

Stoke: We have money.

Din Djarin: So you think I'm some kind of mercenary?

Stoke: You are a Mandalorian, right?

Caben: Or at least wearing Mandalorian armour... That is Mandalorian armour, right?

Din Djarin: It is.

Caben: See?! I told him. Sir, I've read a lot about your people...er...tri-- tribe... If half of what I read is true--

Stoke: We have money.

Din Djarin: How much?

Caben: It's everything we have, sir. Our whole harvest was stolen.

Stoke: Krill... We're...krill farmers.

Caben: We brew spotchka. Our whole village chipped in.

[ The Mandalorian turns to look at them. Stoke holds up a coin purse. ]

Din Djarin: It's not enough.

[ He walks away. The men follow him. ]

Caben: Are you sure? You don't even know what the job is.

Din Djarin: I know it's not enough. Good luck.

Stoke: This is everything we have. We'll give you more after the next harvest.

[ The Mandalorian opens the hatch in their faces and they stumble back, startled. Then they start to move away, disappointed, as the Mandalorian walks up the ramp. ]

Caben: Come on. Let's head back.

Stoke: Took us the whole day to get here. Now we have to ride back with no protection to the middle of nowhere.

[ The Mandalorian halts and turns. ]

Din Djarin: Where do you live?

[ The two men turn back around. ]

Stoke: At a farm. (dejectedly) Weren't you listening? We're farmers.

Din Djarin: In the middle of nowhere.

Stoke: (confused) Yes.

Din Djarin: You have lodging?

Caben: (hopeful) Yeah. Absolutely.

Din Djarin: Good. Come up and help.

[ The men follow the Mandalorian into his ship. Together they load cargo onto the sled. ]

Din Djarin: I'm gonna need one more thing. Give me those credits.

[ Cut to Cara Dune sitting at a campfire. A coin purse drops beside her and she draws her gun, looking up. The Mandalorian is standing there. ]

Din Djarin: Ready for round two?

[ Cut to the Mandalorian, Cara Dune, and the two farmers on the cargo sled, riding through the woods at night. ]

Cara Dune: So we're basically running off a band of raiders for lunch money?

Din Djarin: They're quartering us is in the middle of nowhere. Last I checked that's a pretty square deal for somebody in your position. Worst case scenario, you tune up your blaster. Best case, we're a deterrent. I can't imagine there's anything living in these trees that an ex-shock trooper couldn't handle.

[ He leans back, as does the Child, watching the stars through the treetops overhead. ]

[ Cut to them arriving in daylight. Cara Dune is asleep on the sled. She is startled awake as the sled comes to a stop, as is the Mandalorian. They look over to see a farming village, children running towards them, laughing. ]

Kid: They're here!

Kid: Come on!

[ The children right away ooh and aah at the Child. ]

Din Djarin: Well, looks like they are happy to see us.

Cara Dune: (smiling) Looks like.

Winta: (to the Child) Hi.

[ Pan from Cara Dune and the Mandalorian getting off the sled, farmers starting to unload the cargo, and the children gathered around the Child to a view of the entire village. ]

[ Cut to Omera pulling up blinds in a hut. The Mandalorian enters. Omera looks at him...with hesitation or apprehension is not clear. ]

Omera: Please come in. (as the Mandalorian walks in with some cargo) I hope this is comfortable for you. Sorry that all we have is the barn.

Din Djarin: This will do fine.

Omera: I stacked some blankets over here.

Din Djarin: Thank you. That's...very kind.

[ Winta appears in the doorway, the Mandalorian rounds on her, and she starts back to hide outside the doorframe. Omera goes to pull her into sight again, holding her tight to her side. ]

Omera: This is my daughter Winta. We don't get a lot of visitors around here. She's not used to strangers. (to Winta) This nice man is going to help protect us from the bad ones.

Winta: Thank you.

[ The Mandalorian just nods near imperceptibly. ]

Omera: Come on, Winta. Let's give our guests some room.

[ She takes Winta's hand, and they leave, while the Mandalorian just stands there, looking on. ]

[ Cut to aerial view of the village, then inside the barn with the Child in a crib and the Mandalorian checking his rifle. ]

Omera: Knock, knock.

Din Djarin: Come in.

[ Omera enters with a tray of food, Winta right behind her. ]

Winta: Can I feed him?

Dina Jarin: (turning around) Sure.

[ Winta kneels by the crib, holding up food. ]

Winta: Are you hungry? (giggles) Can I play with him?

Din Djarin: (sighs) Sure.

[ He takes the Child out of the crib and sets it on the floor. ]

Winta: Come on!

[ Winta leaves the barn with the Child in tow, the Mandalorian set to rush after them, worried. ]

Din Djarin: I don't think--

Omera: (holding him back) They'll be fine.

Din Djarin: I don't--

Omera: (firmly yet softly) They'll be fine. (he backs off) I brought you some food. I noticed you didn't eat out there. I'll leave it here for when I go.

Din Djarin: That's very thoughtful of you. (he turns away)

Omera: Do you mind if I ask you something?

Din Djarin: Go ahead.

Omera: How long has it been since you've taken that off?

Din Djarin: Yesterday.

Omera: I mean in front of someone else.

[ He turns around, then looks and points out the window to where the village children are playing with the Child. ]

Din Djarin: I wasn't much older than they are.

Omera: You haven't shown your face to anyone since you were a kid?

Din Djarin: No. I was...happy that they took me in. My parents were killed, and the Mandalorians took care of me.

Omera: I'm sorry.

Din Djarin: This is the way.

Omera: Let us know if there's anything you need.

Din Djarin: Thank you.

[ Omera leaves. The Mandalorian stands by the window, a cup of drink and the plate of food on the sill, then placing his helmet beside it. ]

[ Cut to Cara Dune and the Mandalorian patrolling in the forest. The forest floor is seen through the Mandalorian's HUD, showing recent footprints. ]

Din Djarin: About 15 or 20 of them came through here on foot.

[ Looking around through the Mandalorian's HUD reveals a lot of recent damage higher up in the trees. ]

Din Djarin: And something big sheared off those branches.

[ They move on, the crouch down next to a gigantic footprint. ]

Cara Dune: AT-ST.

Din Djarin: Imperial Walker. What's it doing here?

Cara Dune: I don't know. But this is more than I signed up for.

[ Cut back to the village. Din Jarin and Cara Dune stand on the porch of the barn addressing the villagers. ]

Din Djarin: Bad news. Y'can't live here anymore.

Stoke: What?

Caben: Why?

Cara Dune: (to the Mandalorian only) Nice bedside manner...

Din Djarin: You think you can do better?

Cara Dune: Can't do much worse. (to the villagers) I know this is not the news you wanted to hear but there are no other options.

Stoke: You took the job!

Caben: Yeah!

Cara Dune: That was before we knew about the AT-ST.

Stoke: What is that?

Cara Dune: The armoured walker with two enormous guns that you knew about and didn't tell us.

Villagers: Help us! // Please!! // You're supposed to help us! // But we hired you! // Please!

Omera: We have nowhere to go.

Cara Dune: Sure you do. This is a big planet. I mean, I've seen a lot smaller.

Caben: My grandparents seeded these pods.

Stoke: It took generations.

Cara Dune: I understand. I do. But there are only two of us.

Stoke: No there's not! There's at least twenty here!

Caben: Yeah!

Cara Dune: I mean fighters. Be realistic.

Caben: We can learn!

Stoke: We can!

Caben: Give us a chance!

Stoke: Please!

Cara Dune: I've seen that thing take out entire companies of soldiers in a matter of minutes.

Omera: We're not leaving.

Cara Dune: You cannot fight that thing.

Din Djarin: Unless we show them how.

Villagers: Show us! // Yeah, we can do this!

[ Cut to the villagers standing around the Mandalorian and Cara Dune. ]

Din Djarin: You got two problems here. You got the bandits, and you got the mech. We'll handle the AT-ST, but you gotta protect us when they come outta the woods. And I don't have to tell you how dangerous they are. Cara Dune here was a veteran. She was a drop soldier for the Rebellion, and she's gonna lay out a plan for you. So listen. Carefully.

Cara Dune: Now, there's nothing on this planet that can damage the legs on this thing. So we're gonna build a trap. We're gonna need to dig real deep, (she points to the edge of the outermost krill pool) right here, so that when it steps in, it drops. (flash forward to the villagers digging with Cara Dune and the Mandalorian watching on the bank and discussing strategics) The two of us will hit their camp, provoke them. That'll bring the fight out of the woods and down here to us.

Din Djarin: I'm gonna need you to cut down trees and build barricades along these edges. (flash forward to the villagers cutting wood and erecting barricades) I need it high enough so that they can't get over, and strong enough so that it can't break through. Okay. Who knows how to shoot?

[ Reluctantly, Omera raises her hand. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian unpacking his arsenal, he and Cara Dune handing out the weapons. ]

[ Cut to Cara Dune working with half of the villagers on melee training, correcting their stance, etc. ]

Cara Dune: Ready, one. Move your leg out. Get ready. One.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian working with the other half on shooting practice. ]

[ Cut back to Cara Dune and her group. ]

Cara Dune: One! (showing Stoke how to do it) One. Get into it. One.

[ Cut back to the Mandalorian and his group. ]

Din Djarin: Fire!

[ The villagers shoot haphazardly, missing more than they're hitting - except for Omera, who shoot true and steady. The Mandalorian nods. ]

[ Cut back to Cara Dune, whose group is making progress. ]

Cara Dune: One! Two! Three! Four! Reset! Louder! (as the view cuts away to an aerial) One! Two!

[ Cut to the Mandalorian in the doorway of a hut. Omera walks out ]

Din Djarin: The sun is about to set and we'll be leaving soon. When we return, we're coming in hot.

Omera: We'll be ready.

[ Cara Dune walks up and nods 'ready' at them. The Mandalorian walks away. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian and Cara Dune running through a night-time forest, sneaking up to the bandit camp. We see two Klatooinians at a small campfire, drinking a blue glowing liquid. Both of them are taken out from behind by the Mandalorian and Cara Dune. They sneak to one of the tents. More Klatooinians sit around a larger campfire, drinking. Cara Dune and the Mandalorian draw their blasters and enter the tent. They find no enemies, just several large vats with the glowing blue liquid. The Mandalorian sets a charge on the main tent post. Cara Dune makes him aware of incoming enemies, which they fight as soon as they enter the tent and take down together. More enemies flood the tent. They fight them off until more enemies come in shooting. The Mandalorian softens up a wall with shots, and the two of them escape just before the charge blows the tent up. ]

Cara Dune: I hope the plan worked.

[ They watch the AT-ST come to live. ]

Din Djarin: Go! (and they turn to run) GO!!!

[ They run, followed and shot at by the AT-ST. ]

[ Cut to the villagers lying in wait, weapons at the ready, children hiding in the huts. ]

Winta: (whispering) It's okay.

[ Cut to the village egde, where Cara Dune and the Mandalorian come running out of the mist and to within the defenses. They slide into cover. ]

Cara Duna: This is it! Once that thing steps in the pond it's going down!

Cara Duna: Weapons ready!

[ They all watch the AT-ST coming closer, breaking through the tree line. ]

Din Djarin: Just a few more steps.

[ The AT-ST hesitates to step in the water and stops on the bank instead. ]

Cara Dune: It stopped.

[ Cut to the AT-ST standing at the outer perimeter of the village, waiting. The villagers waiting in turn. The AT-ST turns on a blinding light. ]

Din Djarin: (forceful whisper) Get down! Get down!

[ The AT-ST's light sweeps the defenses, then opens fire on the huts. ]

Omera: Caben! Stay there!

Cara Dune: Hold your positions!

[ Klatooinians break out of the forest and flood through the AT-ST's legs towards the village. ]

Cara Dune: OPEN FIRE!!!

[ Blaster shots exchanged. ]

Din Djarin: We gotta get that thing to step forward.

Cara Dune: I'm thinking... (fighting continues all around) New plan.

Din Djarin: What do you have in mind.

Cara Dune: Gimme the pulse rifle.

[ The Mandalorian hands over his rifle (a clear sign of trust). ]

Din Djarin: I'll cover you.

[ Cara Dune storms out toward the AT-ST, jumping into cover in the pond before it. ]

Din Djarin: Come on. You got this.

Cara Dune: (aiming the rifle at the AT-ST) Come to mama.

[ She shoots at it and it steps forward but stops short of the pond. She tries again, but needs to remain in cover. ]

[ Cut to Omera. ]

Omera: This is it. It's now or never.

[ The villagers storm forward, fighting the Klatooinians head on. ]

Omera: CABEN, STOKE, GET OUT THERE!!!

[ The AT-ST shoots at where it suspects Cara Dune to hide, but doesn't step forward. ]

Din Djarin: Take the bait, you hunk of junk.

[ Cara Dune shoots into one of the cockpit windows, sending the AT-ST reeling to then finally step forward into the pond where it goes down hard. The Mandalorian activates a charge and runs toward the fallen AT-ST with it, throwing it into the cockpit window before sliding into cover with Cara Dune. The AT-ST blows up. The remaining Klatooinians flee. The villagers sigh with relief and celebrate their victory. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian and Cara Dune in the pond. ]

Din Djarin: Was that the plan?

Cara Dune: (laughing) Something like that.

[ Cut to the village on a new day. The Child is seen chasing and catching a frog, proceeding to eat it, watched by the village children who turn away in amused disgust. The Child spits out the frog, the children laugh and the frog hops away. ]

[ Cut to the barn, Cara Dune sitting out front, the Mandalorian leaning next to the door. Omera comes out and hands Cara Dune a drink. ]

Cara Dune: Thank you.

Omera: (turning to the Mandalorian) Can I set you something in the house?

Din Djarin: Uh...thank you. Maybe later.

Omera: (turning to watch the children) He's very happy here.

Din Djarin: He is.

Omera: Fits right in.

[ Omera walks away. Cara Dune smirks. ]

Cara Dune: So, what happens if you take that thing off? They come after you and kill you?

Din Djarin: No. You just can't ever put it back on again.

Cara Dune: (incredulous) That's it? So, you can slip off the helmet, settle down with that beautiful young widow and raise your kids sitting here sipping spotchka?

Din Djarin: You know, we raised some hell here a few weeks back. It's too much action for a backwater town like this. Word travels fast. You might wanna cycle the charts and move on.

Cara Dune: Wouldn't wanna be the one who's gotta tell him

[ Brief cut to the children playing with the Child with krill. ]

Din Djarin: I'm leaving him here. Travelling with me... that's no life for a kid. I did my job, he's safe. Better chance at a life.

[ Another brief cut to the children playing with the Child. ]

Cara Dune: It's gonna break his little heart.

Din Djarin: He'll get over it. We all do.

[ Cut to someone with a tracking fob walking through the woods. ]

[ Cut back to the village. The Mandalorian walks up behind Omera. ]

Din Djarin: Excuse me. Can I have a word?

Omera: Of course.

[ The Mandalorian leads her away from the others for privacy. ]

Din Djarin: It's very nice here.

Omera: Yes.

Din Djarin: I think it's clear he's... he's happy here.

Omera: What about you?

Din Djarin: Me?

Omera: Are you happy here? We want you to stay. The community is grateful. You can pack all this away in case there's ever trouble. You and your boy could have a good life. He could be a child for a while. Wouldn't that be nice?

Din Djarin: (voice breaking) It would.

[ Omera reaches up to his helmet, (and they are briefly seen through a targeting scope) but just before she can lift it, he stops her gently. ]

Din Djarin: (slowly lowering her hands) I don't belong here. But he does.

Omera: I understand. I will look after him as one of my own.

[ The targeting scope moves to the Child and zooms in. The bounty hunter is seen preparing for the shot. Then a shot rings out. The Mandalorian is startled into action. ]

Din Djarin: Go get the kids.

[ Omera complies immediately. ]

[ Cut to the bounty hunter crumpling to the floor, revealing Cara Dune with a smoking gun behind him. The Mandalorian comes running. With his foot he turns the smoldering body over to reveal the beeping tracking fob. He picks it up. ]

Cara Dune: Who is he tracking?

Din Djarin: The kid.

Cara Dune: They know he's here.

Din Djarin: Yes.

Cara Dune: Then they'll keep coming.

Din Djarin: Yes.

[ He destroys the tracking fob. ]

[ Cut to the Child sitting on the loaded cargo sled with the Mandalorian and a villager loading some more crates. The villagers surround the sled. Cara Dune walks up. ]

Cara Dune: Are you sure you don't want an escort?

Din Djarin: I appreciate the offer. But we're gonna bypass the town and head right to the Razor Crest.

Cara Dune: Well then. (she offers her hand) Until our paths cross.

Din Djarin: (taking her hand) Until our paths cross.

[ Winta runs forward to hug the Child. ]

Winta: I'll miss you so much.

[ Omera turns to the Mandalorian. ]

Omera: Thank you.

[ He just nods. Then he gets onto the sled, and they leave. ]

End.




Ep 5 - The Gunslinger

[ The Razor Crest is seen in space, shot at by a pursuing fighter. ]

Riot Mar: Hand over the Child, Mando.

[ One of the engines is hit. ]

Riot Mar: I might let you live.

[ The Razor Crest is hit again. Then one of the engines is hit again and bursts into flames, then goes out. ]

Din Djarin: Hold on. (he rolls the ship) Come on!

Riot Mar: I can bring you in warm... or I can bring you in cold.

[ The Mandalorian hits the brakes hard, and the fighter overshoots, ending up in the Razor Crests crosshairs. ]

Din Djarin: That's my line. (he shoots the fighter down)

Title Screen

[ Cut to the cockpit of the Razor Crest. ]

Din Djarin: Losing fuel.

[ The ship loses all power and the Child's happy squeal is heard in the background. The Mandalorian looks around, trying some switches, then gets up to turn on the emergency power. Then he powers the ship back up and the engines come on again. ]

Operator: This is Mos Eisley Tower. We are tracking you. Head for bay three-five. Over.

Din Djarin: Copy that. Locked in for three-five.

[ The Razor Crest approaches Tatooine, heads for Mos Eisley, and settles down in the bay. The Mandalorian locks the sleeping Child in a safe room and leaves the ship. Three DUM-series pit droids pop up and approach, but pop down with a screech when they're shot at. ]

Peli Motto: Hey! HEY!!! (she comes out of her office) You damage one of my droids, you pay for it.

Din Djarin: Just keep them away from my ship.

Peli Motto: Yeah? You think that's a good idea, do ya? Let's look at your ship. (she knocks on the hull, and things rattle and klonk inside) Oof... Look at that. Oh, you got a lot of carbon scoring building up top. Ya... If I didn't know better, I'd think you were in a shootout. Special tool for that one. Oh ya, I'm gonna have to rotate that... You got a fuel leak?! Look at that, this is a mess! How did you even land? That's gonna set you back.
