Din Djarin: I've got 500 Imperial Credits.

Peli Motto: That's all you got? Well (she turns to the pit droids) what do you guys think? That should at least cover the hangar.

Din Djarin: I'll get you your money.

Peli Motto: Hmm... I've heard that before.

Din Djarin: Just remember--

Peli Motto: (interrupting) Ya. No droids. I heard ya. You don't have to say it twice. (as he walks away) Jeez. Womp rat.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian leaving the hangar, walking through the sandy streets of Mos Eisley, past some stormtrooper helmets on pikes. ]

[ Cut to Peli Motto playing sabacc with the pit droids. ]

Peli Motto: I'm in.

[ The droids are seen cheating. ]

Peli Motto: And I'm gonna raise you three bolts and a motivator.

[ At sounds coming from the ship, they all turn, alarmed. ]

Peli Motto: Shhh! Quick, grab my blaster rifle.

[ Peli Motto approaches the ship, then takes the rifle the droid hands her. ]

Peli Motto: I'd stay in that ship if I were you!

[ She aims at the ramp - where the Child emerges and walks down the ramp, looking very sad. A confused Peli Motto hands the rifle back to the droid and approaches the Child. ]

Peli Motto: Now now. Well... (picking up the Child) Let Peli take a good look at you. All right. Here you go. Did that bounty hunter leave you all alone in that big nasty ship? (to the droid that squawked at her) Oh, how do I know what it is? Gimme a second. (smiling at the Child) All right. Would you like some food? Are you hungry? (to one of the droids) Fetch us something to eat! Quick! I don't know...something with bones in it. (to the Child) Shh... Now here's the plan: I am going to look after you until the Mandalorian gets back. And then I'm gonna charge him extra for watching you. You see how that works? Ya, bright eyes? We're a team.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian entering Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina. He walks up to the EV-series supervisor droid bartender. ]

Din Djarin: Hey, droid. I'm a hunter. I'm looking for some work.

Bartender: Unfortunately, the Bounty Guild no longer operates from Tatooine.

Din Djarin: I'm not looking for Guild work.

Bartender: I am afraid that does not improve your situation. (cut to a man listening in) At least by my calculation.

Toro Calican: Think again, tin can.

[ The Mandalorian turns to look at the man lounging in a booth, feet on the table. ]

Toro Calican: If you're looking for work, have a seat, my friend. Name's Toro. Toro Calican. (when the Mandalorian hesitates) Come on, relax.

[ He takes his feet off the table as the Mandalorian walks over to sit, then places a bounty puck on the table. The hologram pops up. ]

Toro Calican: Picked up this bounty puck before I left the Mid-Rim. Fennec Shand, an assassin. Heard she's been on the run ever since the New Republic put all her employers in lockdown.

Din Djarin: I know the name.

Toro Calican: Ya well, I followed this tracking fob here. Now the positional data suggests she'd headed out beyond the Dune Sea. Should be an easy job.

Din Djarin: Well... (getting up) good luck with that.

Toro Calican: Wait, wait, wait, hey, I thought you needed work.

Din Djarin: How long you been with the Guild?

Toro Calican: Long enough.

Din Djarin: Clearly not. Fennec Shand is an elite mercenary. She made her name killing for all the top crime syndicates, including the Hutts. If you go after her, you won't make it past sunrise.

[ The Mandalorian leaves. Quickly, Toro Calican goes after him, losing his confident facade. ]

Toro Calican: (pressing out) This is my first job. You can keep the money, all of it. I just need this job to get into the Guild. I can't do it alone.

[ The Mandalorian clearly considers the offer. ]

Din Djarin: Meet me at hangar three-five in half an hour. Bring two speeder bikes, and give me the tracking fob.

[ Toro Calican destroys the tracking gob instead of giving it to the Mandalorian. ]

Toro Calican: Don't worry. Got it all memorized.

Din Djarin: Half an hour.

Toro Calican: (looking after the leaving Mandalorian) Looks like you're stuck with me now, partner.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian entering the hangar. He enters his ship, suddenly seeing the safe room hatch open and the Child gone. He races back out of the ship. ]

Din Djarin: HEY!

Peli Motto: (startled) I'm awake! I'm awake!

Din Djarin: Where is he? (questioning a pit droid which folds up in fear instead of answering)

Peli Motto: Quiet! Oh... (rocking the now crying Child in her arms) Shh it's okay. You woke it up. Do you have any idea how long it took me to get it to sleep?

Din Djarin: Give him to me.

Peli Motto: Not so fast! You can't just leave a child all alone like that. You know... you've got an awful lot to learn about raising a young one.

[ The Child, quiet again now, looks at her sweetly. ]

Peli Motto: Anyway, I started the repair on the fuel leak. There you go. (punching the machine) I had a couple setbacks I wanna talk to you about. You know I didn't use any droids as requested, so it took me a lot longer than I expected. But I figured you were good for the money since you have an extra mouth to feed.

Din Djarin: Thank you.

Peli Motto: (surprised) Oh. (following the Mandalorian as he leaves the hangar) Oh I guess I was right. You got a job, didn't you. You know it's costing me a lot of money to keep these droids even powered up.

[ Toro Calican is waiting with two speeder bikes. ]

Toro Calican: Hey, Mando. Whaddya think? Not too shabby, huh?

[ The Mandalorian inspects the bike. ]

Toro Calican: Whaddya expect? This ain't Corellia. (looking at Peli Motta and the Child) Ma'am.

[ The men get on the bikes and speed off. They race over sand and dunes until the Mandalorian signs to hold. ]

Toro Calican: What's going on?

Din Djarin: (pointing ahead) Look. Up ahead.

[ Toro Calican gets off his bike and uses his binoculars seeing two banthas with their riders beside them. ]

Toro Calican: Tusken Raiders. I heard the locals talking about this filth.

Din Djarin: Tuskens think they are the locals. Everyone else is just trespassing.

Toro Calican: Well, whatever they call themselves, they best keep their distance.

Din Djarin: Yeah? Why don't you tell them yourself?

[ Toro Calican turns around to two Tusken Raides standing behind him. He reaches for his blaster. The Mandalorian intercepts. ]

Din Djarin: Relax.

[ The Mandalorian uses sign language to communicate with the Tuskens. ]

Toro Calican: What are you doing?

Din Djarin: Negotiating.

[ More signing. ]

Toro Calican: What's going on?

Din Djarin: We need passage across their land. (to Toro Calican after more signing from the Tuskens) Let me see the binocs.

Toro Calican: Why?

[ No reply, just an outstretched hand. Toro Calican hands the binocs over to the Mandalorian who in turn hands it over to the Tuskens. ]

Toro Calican: Hey! What...?

[ The Mandalorian turns to remount his bike. ]

Toro Calican: Those were brand new.

Din Djarin: Yeah. They were.

[ He leaves, with Toro Calican eventually following. Suddenly the Mandalorian stops again and gets off his bike. ]

Din Djarin: Get down.

Toro Calican: What? Oh...

[ He gets off his bike as well and follows the Mandalorian to take cover behind a dune ridge. ]

Din Djarin: All right. Tell me what you see.

Toro Calican: Dewback. Looks like the rider is still attached. Is that her? Is that the target?

Din Djarin: I don't know. I'll go. (drawing his blaster) You cover me. Stay down.

[ The Mandalorian rushes forward to the beast, approaching more carefully as he gets close. He turns over the body being dragged by the beast. A masked man. ]

Toro Calican: Is it her? Is she dead?

Din Djarin: It's another bounty hunter.

Toro Calican: Hey I hope you're not planning on keeping all that stuff for yourself. Can I at least have that blaster?

[ The Mandalorian finds a beeping tracking fob on the body. Suddenly he jumps up. ]

Din Djarin: Get down!

[ Just as a shot rings out, hitting him on the right pauldron as he turns to run. He goes down and the dewback runs off. ]

Toro Calican: Mando?!

[ Cut to a sniper adjusting the scope. Another shot just as the Mandalorian reaches the ridge, and he is thrown over the top by the hit. ]

Toro Calican: What happened?

Din Djarin: Sniper bolt. Only an MK-modified rifle could make that shot.

Toro Calican: Are you all right?

Din Djarin: Yeah. Hit me in the beskar. And at that range, beskar held up.

Toro Calican: Wait, I don't wear any beskar.

Din Djarin: Nope.

Toro Calican: So what do we do?

Din Djarin: You see where that shot came from?

Toro Calican: Yeah. Came from that ridge.

Din Djarin: Okay. We're gonna wait until dark.

Toro Calican: What if she escapes?

Din Djarin: She's got the high ground. She'll wait for us to make the first move. I'm gonna rest. You take the first watch. Stay low.

[ Cut to the sniper, who opens the visor and reveals that it is Fennec Shand. ]

[ Cut to night-time. ]

Toro Calican: All right, suns are down, (looking back at the Mandalorian) time to ride, Mando.

[ The Mandalorian is settled against the bike, not moving. ]

Toro Calican: (approaching the Mandalorian) Come on. Wake up. (standing in front of the Mandalorian) Look at you. Alseep on the job, old man.

[ He proceeds to play gunslinger in front of the unmoving Mandalorian, pointing his gun at him (and making an ass of himself). ]

Din Djarin: You done?

Toro Calican: Yep. (putting his gun away) Yeah yeah yeah. I was just, uh... ya know... just uh... waking you up. Come on!

Din Djarin: Get on your bike. Ride as fast as you can. Towards those rocks.

Toro Calican: That's your plan? She'll snipe us right off the bikes.

[ The Mandalorian tosses something over. ]

Din Djarin: It's a flash charge. We alternate shots. It'll blind any scope temporarily. Combine that with our speed and we got a chance.

Toro Calican: A chance?

Din Djarin: Hey, you wanted this. Get ready.

[ They start speeding across the valley. The sniper prepares, getting them into her sights, until she is blinded by the first flash from the Mandalorian. She takes her helmet off. She takes a shot, but it goes way wide. ]

Din Djarin: Now!

[ Toro Calican shoots the flash charge just as Fennec Shand shoot, causing her to miss again. Toro Calican's next flash charge misfires and runs across the sand, giving Fennec Shand a chance at a good shot, and she shoots out the bike from under the Mandalorian. He uses a flash charge to blind her again so that Toro Calican can finish getting across. Fennec Shand aims at the Mandalorian and hits him square in the breastplate, knocking him back. She takes aim again, aiming for the exposed underside of his helmet. ]

Toro Calican: Not so fast, Fennec.

[ She pulls out a hidden knife from her rifle and tosses it at Toro Calican, knocking the blaster out of his hand. They fight, she with her hands, he with a blaster, while the Mandalorian is slow to get up down below. Fennec Shand gives Toro Calican a thorough thrashing - until the Mandalorian shows up. ]

Din Djarin: Nice distraction.

[ Fennec Shand lets Toro Calican go, and he gets up under much groaning. ]

Toro Calican: Ow. Yeah. Good work, partner.

Din Djarin: (tossing cuffs to Fennec Shand) Cuff yourself. (to Toro Calican) Why don't you go and find your blaster.

Fennec Shand: A Mandalorian. It's been a long time since I've seen one of your kind. Ever been to Nevarro? I hear things didn't go so well there but... it looks like you got off easy.

Toro Calican: (finding his blaster and holstering it) You don't have to worry about getting to Nevarro or anywhere else once we turn you in. You know I really should thank you. You're my ticket into the Guild.

Fennec Shand: You're welcome.

[ They get down to where the single speeder bike is parked. ]

Fennec Shand: Uh oh... it looks like one of us has to walk.

Din Djarin: (pushing Fennec Shand down to sit) Or we could drag you.

[ The Mandalorian and Toro Calican walk away a short distance. ]

Toro Calican: All right, so... what is the plan?

Din Djarin: I need you to go and find that dewback we saw.

Toro Calican: And leave you here? With my bounty and my ride? Yeah... I don't think so, Mando.

Din Djarin: (after scanning around with his HUD, detecting a heat reading a couple ridges over) Okay. I'll do it. Watch her. And don't let her get near the bike. She's no good to us dead.

[ The Mandalorian walks away. Toro Calican and Fennec Shand wait through the night and into the morning. ]

Fennec Shand: (stretching) Uh... It's been a while. Oh look, the suns are coming up.

Toro Calican: Quiet.

Fennec Shand: Look, there's still time to make my rendezvous in Mos Espa. Take me to it, and I can pay you double the price on my head.

Toro Calican: I don't care about the money.

Fennec Shand: Oh. So the Mandalorian keeps all the money for himself.

Toro Calican: Only because I let him.

Fennec Shand: (laughs) Doesn't seem that way. I mean, it seems like he's calling all the shots.

Toro Calican: Shows what you know. I hired Mando. This is my job. Bringing you in will make me a full member of the Bounty Hunters' Guild.

Fennec Shand: You already something that the Guild values far more than me. You just don't see it.

Toro Calican: What?

Fennec Shand: The Mandalorian. His armour alone's worth more than my bounty.

Toro Calican: I already told you I don't care about the money.

Fennec Shand: Then think what it would do for your reputation. A Mandalorian shot up the Guild on Nevarro. Took some high value target and went rogue.

Toro Calican: That Mandalorian?

Fennec Shand: Like I said, you don't see many. You bring the Guild that traitor and they'll welcome you with open arms. Your name will be legendary.

Toro Calican: How can we be sure he's the one?

Fennec Shand: Word is he still has the target with him. Some say it's a child. Look. If you're afraid to take him on, fear not. I can help you with that. Take some advice, kid. You wanna be a bounty hunter? Make the best deal for yourself and survive.

[ Toro Calican is clearly thinking about the offer and information. He holsters his blaster and walks over to Fennec Shand who gets up, holding her cuffed hands out to him. Suddenly he draws and shoot her at point blank. She drops to the ground. ]

Toro Calican: That's good advice. (crouching down) But if I took those binders off you, I'd be a dead man. And if the Mandalorian's worth more than you are, well... Who wouldn't wanna be a legend? Thanks for the tip.

[ He mounts the bike and speeds off. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian returning on the dewback, finding Fennec Shand left for dead. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian arriving at night in Mos Eisley, riding the dewback. He ties up the beast at the hangar, spotting the speeder bike outside. Drawing his blaster, he enters the hangar. A pit droid runs past him into the office where all three droids fold up in fear. ]

Toro Calican: (unseen) Took you long enough, Mando. (appearing on the Razor Crest's ramp with the Child on his arm and Peli Motto at gunpoint) Looks like I'm calling the shots now, huh, partner? Drop your blaster and raise 'em.

[ The Mandalorian does as he's told. ]

Toro Calican: (shoving the barrel in Peli Motto's back) Cuff him. (raising the blaster to point at the Mandalorian) You're a Guild traitor, Mando.

[ Peli Motto moves to cuff the Mandalorian, she sees he's got a grenade in his hand. ]

Toro Calican: And I'm willing to bet that this here is the target you helped escape.

Peli Motto: (whispering) You're smarter than you look.

Toro Calican: Fennec was right. Bringing you in won't just make me a member of the Guild, it'll make me legendary.

[ As Toro Calican is about to shoot him, the Mandalorian sets off the grenade. It's a flash grenade, blinding Toro Calican, and his shot misses while the Mandalorian disappears. As Toro Calican still shoots at the spot the Mandalorian had been before, the Mandalorian shoots him from the side. Peli Motto comes out of hiding and both approach where Toro Calican has gone down. ]

Din Djarin: Stay back.

Peli Motto: We gotta get it.

[ The Mandalorian turns the body over, but the Child is gone. ]

Peli Motto: Where is it?

[ They look around, and finally Peli Motto spots the Child between some crates. ]

Peli Motto: There you are. Are you hiding from us? (picking the Child up) Look at you. It's alright. I know that was really loud for your big old ears, wasn't it.

[ The Mandalorian takes the coin purse off the body. ]

Peli Motto: (rocking the Child) It's okay. Shh shh shh (as the Mandalorian takes the Child from her) Be careful with him. So I...take it you didn't get paid.

[ The Mandalorian pulls out the purse and pours credit into her hands, which is obviously a lot judging by her expression. ]

Din Djarin: That cover me?

Peli Motto: (incredulous) Yeah... yeah this is gonna cover you.

[ The Mandalorian starts up the ramp to his ship. ]

Peli Motto: All right pit droids! Let's drag this outta here! (in reply to the droids' chittering) I don't know. Drag it to Beggar's Canyon.

[ The droids proceed to drag Toro Calican's body out of the hangar as the Razor Crest's ramp closes and the ship takes off. ]

[ Cut to the desert where Fennec Shand lies in the sand. A booted figure walks up to her body and kneels down next to her. ]

End.



Ep 6 - The Prisoner

[ The Razor Crest is seen landing in a space station hangar bay. The Mandalorian walks through the hangar, stared at by everyone around. ]

Ran: Mando.

[ The Mandalorian turns to find a bearded man. ]

Ran: Is that you under that bucket?

[ The Mandalorian takes the hand the bearded man offers in greeting. ]

Din Djarin: Ran.

Ran: Didn't really know if I'd ever see you in these part again. Good to see you. You know, to be honest, I was a little surprised when you reached out to me. You know, cuz I... I hear things. Like, maybe things between you and the Guild aren't working out.

Din Djarin: I'll be fine.

Ran: Hmm okay. Well, you know the policy. No questions. And you, you're welcome back here anytime.

[ They're walking across a catwalk in the hangar. ]

Din Djarin: So what's the job?

Ran: Yeah, one of our associates ran afoul of some competitors and got himself caught. So I'm putting together a crew to spring him. It's a five person job, I got four. All I need is the ride, and you brought it.

Din Djarin: The ship wasn't part of the deal.

Ran: Well, the Crest is the only reason I let you back in here.

[ The Mandalorian slowly turns to Ran. ]

Ran: What's the look? Is that gratitude? (laughs) Uh-huh, I think it is. (walks away laughing)

[ Ran and the Mandalorian walk into a different area of the hangar. ]

Ran: Hey, Mayfeld.

Mayfeld: (turning) Yeah.

Ran: This is Mando. The guy I was telling you about. We used to do jobs way back when.

Mayfeld: This is the guy?

Ran: Yeah, we were all young, trying to make a name for ourselves. Yeah, but running with a Mandalorian, that was... that brought us some reputation.

Mayfeld: Oh ya? What did he get out of it?

Ran: I asked him that one time. You remember what you said, Mando? Target practice. (laughs) Target practice. Man, we did some crazy stuff, didn't we?

Din Djarin: That was a long time ago.

Ran: Well... Well I don't go out anymore. You understand? So uh... Mayfeld, he's gonna run point on this job. If he says it, it's like it's coming from me. You good with that?

Din Djarin: You tell me.

Ran: (laughs) You haven't changed one bit.

Mayfeld: Ya, well, things have changed around here. (turns and walks away)

Ran: Ya, well, Mayfeld, he's, he's one of the best trigger men I've ever seen. Former Imperial sharpshooter.

Din Djarin: That's not saying much.

Mayfeld: I wasn't a Stormtrooper, wiseass!

Ran: Don't take long, does it? (laughs)

[ Cut to the Razor Crest sitting in the hangar. ]

Mayfeld: Razor Crest? I can't believe that thing can fly. Looks like a Canto Bight slot machine.

[ Mayfeld and the Mandalorian walk up to a group of people near the Razor Crest. ]

Mayfeld: Alright, the good looking fella there with the horns, that's Burg.

[ Burg drops a huge crate he is carrying. ]

Mayfeld: This may surprise you, but he's our muscle.

[ Burg comes to inspect the Mandalorian from up close. ]

Burg: So this is a Mandalorian. I thought they'd be bigger.

Mayfeld: Droid's name is Zero.

[ The droid Q9-0 aka Zero walks up to them. ]

Din Djarin: I thought you said you had four.

Xi'an: He does.

[ The Mandalorian turns slowly to find a purple skinned female Twi'lek walking up, playing with a knife. ]

Xi'an: Hello, Mando.

Din Djarin: Xi'an.

Xi'an: Tell me why I shouldn't cut you down where you stand?

[ Suddenly she attacks, the knife ending up at his throat. He does not flinch. ]

Din Djarin: Nice to see you too.

Xi'an: (laughs) I missed you. (clinking the knife against the beskar armour) This is shiny. You wear it well.

Mayfeld: Do we need to leave the room or something?

Ran: Well, Xi'an's been a little heartbroken since Mando left our group.

Mayfeld: Aawww...you gonna be okay, sweetheart?

Xi'an: I'm all business now. (pointing her knife at the Mandalorian) Learned from the best.

Ran: All right, lovebirds. Break it up till you get on the ship. Right now, we don't have much time.

[ They walk toward the Razor Crest. Xi'an turns back and winks at the Mandalorian. Burg steps in front of him again, looking him up and down. ]

Burg: Hnn.... Tiny. (laughs)

Title Screen

[ Cut to Zero in the Razor Crest cockpit. ]

Zero: Fuel. Navigation. Hyperdrive. Landing gear. Comms.

[ A distorted hologram message from Greef Karga pops up. ]

Zero: Hmm.

[ Cut to the outside. ]

Mayfeld: So, package is being moved on a fortified transport ship. (bringing up a hologram) Now, we got a limited window to board, find our friend, get'im outta there, before they make their jump.

Din Djarin: That's a New Republic prison ship. Your man wasn't taken by a rival syndicate, he was arrested.

Mayfeld: So what?

Ran: A job is a job.

Din Djarin: That's a max security transport, and I'm not looking for that kind of heat.

Ran: Well, neither are we. So just don't mess up.

Xi'an: The good news for you is the ship is manned by droids. Still hate the machines, Mando?

Zero: (coming down the ramp) Despite recent modifications the ship is still quite a mess. The power lines are leaking. The navigation is intermittent. And he hyperdrive is only operating at 67.3% efficiency. We have much better ships. Why are we using this one?

Ran: 'Cause the Razor Crest is off the old Imperial and the New Republic grid. It's a ghost.

Mayfeld: Yeah. And we need a ship that can get close enough to jam New Republic code. So, when we drop out of hyperspace here, if we immediately bank into this kinda attitude, we should be right in their blind spot, which should give us just enough time for your ship to scramble our signal.

Din Djarin: It's not possible. Even for the Crest.

Ran: That's why he's (nodding to Zero) flying.

[ Mayfeld laughs. ]

Ran: Mando, I know you're a pretty good pilot, but we need you on the trigger, not on the wheel.

Zero: Don't worry, Mandalorian, my response time is quicker than organics, and I'm smarter too.

Ran: Alright, ya, that's good. Forgive the programming. He's a little rough around the edges. But he is the best.

Din Djarin: How can you trust it?

Ran: You know me, man, I don't trust anybody. (watching the Mandalorian walking up the ramp) Just like the good old days, Mando, huh?

[ The Mandalorian doesn't reply, just closes the ramp. The Razor Crest takes off. ]

[ Cut to inside the Razor Crest, where Xi'an is balancing a knife point on her fingertip and Burg is pacing. ]

Xi'an: (exasperated) Will you sit. Down.

[ Burg hits something, Xi'an hisses at him. He laughs. ]

[ Cut to the cockpit with Zero at the wheel and the Mandalorian lingering in the background. ]

Zero: Calculations complete. Jumping to hyperspace...now. Feel free to join the others. I will handle it from here.

[ The Mandalorian leaves the cockpit. ]

[ Cut to down below. Burg opens the weapons vault and laughs in glee at the sight. The Mandalorian drops down from the cockpit and closes the vault on Burg. Mad, he reaches for the release of the safe room, which the Mandalorian stops with a heavy hand. They enter into a staring match. ]

Mayfeld: Hey, hey, hey. Okay. Okay. Okay, I get it. I'm a little particular about my personal space too. So let's just do this job. We get in, we get out, and you don't have to see our faces anymore.

Burg: Someone tell me why we even a Mandalorian.

Mayfeld: Well, apparently they're the greatest warriors in the galaxy. So they say.

Burg: Then why are they all dead?

[ Everyone (except the Mandalorian) laughs. ]

Mayfeld: Well, you flew with him, Xi'an. Is he as good as they say?

Xi'an: Ask him about the job on Alzoc III.

Din Djarin: I did what I had to.

Xi'an: Oh, but you liked it. See, I know who you really are.

Mayfeld: He never takes off the helmet?

Xi'an: (shaking her head with a chuckle, then mockingly) This is the way.

Mayfeld: Hmm... I wonder what you look like under there. Maybe he's a Gungan. Is that why...yousa don't wanna show your face?

[ Burg and Xi'an laugh. ]

Mayfeld: (to Xi'an) You ever seen his face?

Xi'an: A lady...never tells.

Mayfeld: Aw, come on, Mando. We all gotta trust each other here. You gotta show us something. Come on, just lift the helmet up. Come on. Let's all see your eyes.

[ Mayfeld nods at Burg who then moves in. ]

Burg: I'll do--

[ The Mandalorian grabs Burg's hand hard and twists his arm on his back, Burg fights back, the Mandalorian kicks him back, and as Burg grapples for something to hold on to, he hits the release button for the safe room, and the hatch opens, revealing the Child. ]

Mayfeld: Whoa! What is that? You get lonely up here, buddy? Huh? Wait a minute... (gesturing between the Mandalorian and Xi'an) did you two make that? Huh? What is it? Like...a pet or something?

Din Djarin: Yeah. Something like that.

Xi'an: Didn't take you for the type. Maybe that code of yours has made you soft.

Mayfeld: Me, I was never really into pets. Yeah, didn't have the temperament. Patience, you know. I mean, I tried but... never worked out. What I'm thinking... maybe... (picking the Child up) I'll try again with this little fella. Huh?

[ Mayfeld pretends to drop the Child and the Mandalorian flinches in response. Xi'an and Mayfeld laugh at him. ]

Zero: Dropping out of hyperspace...now.

[ Everybody fights for balance. ]

Zero: Commencing final approach...now. Cloaking signal...now.

[ The ship rolls and everybody is thrown around the cabin. Mayfeld drops the Child, the Mandalorian diving after it. ]

Zero: Engaging coupling...now.

[ The Razor Crest docks to the transport. The Mandalorian places the Child back in the safe room. ]

Zero: Coupling confirmed. We are down. And relax. Commence extraction...now.

Xi'an: That useless droid didn't even us a proper countdown.

[ Burg tosses some crates around. ]

Mayfeld: Zee...you sure they can't see us?

Zero: The Razor Crest is scrambling our signature, and I'm inside the prison system. It's impressive that this gunship has survived the Empire without being impounded.

Mayfeld: Alright, we got a job to do, Mando, you're up.

[ The crew watches as the Mandalorian hacks the opening mechanism of the prison ship's hatch. ]

Mayfeld: It's me?

Burg: Always you.

[ Mayfeld drops down into the halls of the prison ship, evading some droids. Next is Xi'an. ]

Mayfeld: Zero. Get is to the control room.

[ Next to drop in is Burg. In the cockpit, Zero searches the prison system. ]

Zero: Sub-level three. Disabling on-board surveillance.

[ The Mandalorian drops in last after another look at the closed safe room. ]

Mayfeld: All right, we're on the clock. Second we engage those droids they're gonna be all over us.

DIn Djarin: I know the drill.

Zero: Bio trackers activated. I've got eyes.

Mayfeld: All right, let's go.

[ They move through the corridors, looking into prison cells. ]

Din Djarin: I don't like this.

Xi'an: You always were paranoid.

Mayfeld: (mocking) Is that true, Mando? Are you always paranoid?

[ Mayfeld is startled by a prisoner slamming against his cell door. Xi'an and Burg laugh. ]

Zero: Approaching control room. Make a left at the next juncture.

[ A MSE-6 series repair droid rounds the corner, putting everyone on edge - except Burg. ]

Burg: What? It's just a little mousey. (drawing his blaster behind his back and approaching the droid) Come here, little mousey.

Mayfeld: (whispering in the background) Burg...

Burg: Mousey, come here. Come here.

Mayfeld: Burg!

[ When the droid tries to flee, Burg blasts it. ]

Mayfeld: No! Burg! What're you doing?

Burg: What?!

[ Security droids round the corner. ]

Droid: Intruder alert. Open fire.

[ A gunfight ensues. ]

Xi'an: We're too exposed here!

Mayfeld: They get a signal out it's not gonna matter! // Mando, let's go! You're supposed to be some special--

[ The Mandalorian has disappeared. ]

Mayfeld: I knew it! I knew it!

[ The Mandalorian appears behind the attacking droids taking them out in a melee fight while the others look on. ]

Mayfeld: (walking past the Mandalorian) Make sure you clean up your mess.

[ Burg shoulders past the Mandalorian as they all carry on. ]

Zero: It seems your presence has been detected. Redirecting security alert away from your position.

Mayfeld: Zee, open the door!

Zero: But I'm detecting an organic signature.

Mayfeld: Ya okay all right. Just open the door!

[ The door to the control room opens. There is one human guard inside. ]

Guard: (brandishing a blaster) Stop! Just...stop...right there! You put down the blasters right now.

Mayfeld: Nice shoes.

Guard: Put down your blasters.

Mayfeld: Matches his belt.

[ Burg laughs. ]

Din Djarin: There were only supposed to be droids on this ship.

Mayfeld: Hang on, hang on. See here uh...cell two-two-one. All right, now for our well dressed friend...

[ The guard pulls out a tracking beacon. ]

Mayfeld: Whoa whoa whoa whoa hey hey easy easy, egghead. Put that down. Put that down. Come on.

Din Djarin: Easy.

Mayfeld: Put it down. NOW! (drawing his weapon on the guard)

Din Djarin: Easy! Nobody has to get hurt here, just calm down.

Burg: What is that thing?

Din Djarin: It's a tracking beacon.

Mayfeld: He presses that thing and we're all done. A New Republic attack team will hone in on that signal and blow us all to hell. Put it down!

Xi'an: Are you serious?

Mayfeld: Yes, I'm serious.

Xi'an: You didn't think we needed to know that tiny little detail?

Mayfeld: I didn't think we'd get to this point!

Xi'an: Yet here we are.

Mayfeld: Are you questioning my managerial style, Xi'an?!

Xi'an: (mock saluting) No, sir.

Din Djarin: (addressing the frightened guard) Hey, listen to me. Hey hey hey, listen to me, okay. (holstering his blaster) Look. (addressing Mayfeld) Hey, put it down.

Mayfeld: Are you crazy?

Din Djarin: Put it down. (to the guard) What's your name?

Guard: It...'s...Davan.

Din Djarin: Davan. We're not here for you. We're here for a prisoner. If you let us go about our job you can walk away with your life.

Mayfeld: No he won't.

[ Mayfeld targets Davin again, the Mandalorian draws his blaster on Mayfeld and Mayfeld trains his second blaster on the Mandalorian. ]

Din Djarin: You realize what you're gonna bring down on us.

Mayfeld: You think I care about that?

Din Djarin: We're not killing anybody, you understand?

Mayfeld: Get that blaster out of my face, Mando.

Din Djarin: I can't do that.

Mayfeld: Get that blaster outta my face, Mando!

[ Mayfeld's third blaster on the droid arm engages to target the Mandalorian, as well Burg draws his weapon on him. The Mandalorian aims his vambrace weapon at Burg. ]

Din Djarin: Don't.

[ Suddenly, Davin is cut down by Xi'an's throwing knife. ]

Xi'an: Would you both just shut up.

Mayfeld: Crazy Twi'. I had it under control.

Xi'an: Yeah... Looked like it.

[ The tracking beacon starts blinking and softly beeping. ]

Mayfeld: Was that thing blinking before? Was it?

Zero: Zero to Mayfeld. Zero to Mayfeld.

Mayfeld: What?

Zero: I detected a New Republic distress signal homing in on your location. You have approximately 20 minutes.

Xi'an: (shrugs) We only need five.

Mayfeld: Let's go, let's go, move, move, move, move!

[ They leave the control room. In the corridors, Burg grabs and smashes a security droid, then throws it at another one, taking both down. At cell 221 Mayfeld plugs into the door mechanism. ]

Mayfeld: Zee, open it up.

Zero: You have 15 minutes remaining.

Mayfeld: (over comms) Open it up!

[ The cell door opens, revealing a man familiar to the Mandalorian. ]

Din Djarin: Qin...

Qin: Funny. The man who left me behind is now my saviour. (walking out) Mando.

[ Suddenly Burg punches Mando in the gut, catching him off guard, throwing him into the cell which is locked before he can get up. He fires his blaster, but the charge just ricochets around the cell. Qin and Xi'an embrace fiercely. ]

Xi'an: Brother!

Qin: Sister!

Mayfeld: Attack's on the way. He's already dead meat! Let's go!

Qin: Come on, it's better this way.

Xi'an: (at the Mandalorian in the cell) You deserve this!

Mayfeld: Let's go!

[ Cut to the cockpit where Zero is inspecting the garbled hologram message from Greef Karga, with which he is successful. ]

Greef Karga: (hologram) I received your transmission. Upon your return deliver the quarry directly to the client.

Zero: Interesting.

Mayfeld: (on comms) Zero, we got Qin.

Zero: I found some information on the Mandalorian from the Bounty Hunters' Guild.

Mayfeld: Yeah yeah, do whatever. Just get us off this ship.

Zero: You have 10 minutes remaining.

[ Cut to the Mandalorian in the cell. He grapples a passing security droid and reels him in against the cell door and manages to disable it, using it's arm to unlock his cell. In the cockpit of the Razor Crest, Zero sees the Mandalorian's bio tracker moving into the control room. ]

Zero: Zero to Mayfeld.

Mayfeld: Wait wait wait wait wait.

Zero: Zero to Mayfeld.

Mayfeld: Yeah.

Zero: You have a potential problem. He has escaped.

[ Xi'an cries out in frustration. ]

Xi'an: I told you we should have ended him!

Mayfeld: I know, I know, I know!

Xi'an: This is your fault!

[ They start screaming at each other when suddenly the lights go out. The red emergency lighting comes on, and the security doors around them lock down, except one. ]

Burg: Go go go go go go go!

[ They start running. One of the security doors locks down separating the team into Qin and Mayfeld on one side and Xi'an and Burg on the other. ]

Zero: (looking at an increasingly scrambled screen) Zero to Mayfeld. Mayfeld, do you copy? It seems comms are no longer functioning therefore you cannot hear me. You are on your own.

[ Baby noises are heard. Zero turns to see the Child entering the cockpit. ]

Zero: Curious.

[ Cut to the separated team. ]

Qin: It's all right! You and the Devaronian, split up. Find Mando and kill him! Then find a way back to the ship!

Xi'an: Zero! We need a path. (crackling but no response) ZERO! (frustrated scream)

[ In the cockpit, Zero turns to grab his rifle. When he turns back around, the Child is gone. ]

[ Cut to Mayfeld and Qin. ]

Qin: Do you have a name?

Mayfeld: Mayfeld.

Qin: (laughs) Well, Mr. Mayfeld, you're gonna get me the hell off this ship.

Mayfeld: Hey, wait. What about your sister?

Qin: What about her?

[ Qin grabs one of Mayfeld's blasters and leaves. ]

Mayfeld: (to himself) Nice family.

[ Burg and Xi'an are seen splitting up. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian in the control room, grabbing the tracking beacon. ]

[ Cut to Qin and Mayfeld coming across the droids destroyed earlier by the Mandalorian. ]

Qin: Mando always did hate droids.

Mayfeld: Zee... Zee...

Qin: Hey, hey. Whatever Ran promised, I'll see to it you get triple share. Just get him.

Mayfeld: Better be good for it.

[ They split up. ]

[ Cut to Xi'an. ]

Xi'an: (sing-songy) Mando...

[ Cut to Burg trying the comms, throwing the transmitter away in frustration. ]

[ Cut to Zero searching the Child in the ship. ]

[ Cut back to Burg entering the control room, a security door locking down behind him. ]

Burg: Where are you, little mouse?

[ He is caught by the Mandalorian's grappling cable from above, but he is able to pull the Mandalorian down from his hiding place. Burg proceeds to thrash the Mandalorian. Brief glimpse of Xi'an hearing the fighting noise and running up. ]

Burg: Let's see your face, Mandalorian.

[ He attempts to pull the helmet off, but gets thrown, and the Mandalorian locks down the security door on him - which he holds up with brutal strength, until the Mandalorian snaps shut a second security door. ]

[ Cut to a frustrated Xi'an. ]

Xi'an: Zero...where is he?

[ Cut to Zero still looking for the Child in the ship. ]

[ Cut to Mayfeld taking out three security patrol droids. ]

[ Cut to Xi'an, the Mandalorian appearing in the corridor behind her. One of her throwing knifes knocks the blaster out of his hand, others glance off his beskar, one buries between breastplate and pauldron. They enter close quarter combat and Xi'an ends up with a knife at her throat. ]

[ Cut to Mayfeld. Suddenly a locked down security raises in front of him. A maintenance droid runs past, startling him. ]

Mayfeld: What the f--

[ With every flashing light, the Mandalorian is seen coming closer behind him. Mayfeld turns around, but the Mandalorian has already passed him and is now behind him again. ]

Mayfeld: (turning) NO!

[ Cut to Zero still looking for the Child. He hears a door swish. ]

[ Cut to Qin arriving at the ladder leading up into the ship. ]

Din Djarin: Qin!

Qin: You killed the others.

Din Djarin: They got what they deserved.

[ They point their blasters at each other. ]

Qin: You kill me, you don't get your money. Whatever Ran promised, I make sure you get it, and more. Come on, Mando. Be reasonable, huh? (throwing his weapon down) You were hired to do a job, right? So do it. Isn't that your code? Aren't you a man of honour?

[ Cut to Zero still looking for the Child. He opens the safe room, revealing the Child. It raises its hand, and Zero raises his rifle. Suddenly a shot, Zero sparks out and falls over, revealing the Mandalorian behind him with a blaster. ]

[ Cut to the Razor Crest undocking from the prison ship, entering hyperspace and dropping out to approach Ran's space station. The Razor Crest lands in the hangar. The opening ramp reveals the Mandalorian and Qin. Qin and Ran embrace. ]

Ran: Where are the others?

Din Djarin: No questions asked. That's the policy, right?

Ran: Yeah. That is the policy.

Din Djarin: I did the job.

Ran: Yeah you did.

[ Ran tosses the Mandalorian a coin purse. ]

Din Djarin: Just like the good old days.

Ran: Yeah, just like the good old days.

[ The Mandalorian reenters his ship and the Razor Crest takes off. ]

Ran: (pressing a comms button) Kill him.

[ Ran and Qin laugh as a gunship rises to the flight deck. Then Qin notices a beeping and discovers a tracker on him. ]

Qin: What's this?

Ran: (taking the tracker) That bastard.

[ They look around to see three ships drop out of hyperspace. ]

[ Cut to the fighters. ]

Trapper Wolf: Yeah I got a clear signal on the tracking beacon.

Jib Dodger: Copy that

[ Cut to the hangar, where Ran gives the tracker back to Qin and runs off. ]

Qin: Are those X-wings?

[ Cut to the fighters. ]

Trapper Wolf: Yep, that's definitely a tracking beacon.

Jib Dodger: Looks like they're launching a gunship.

Sash Ketter: Copy. Going in.

[ The fighters open fire. The Razor Crest is seen flying away (as the fighters destroy the space station in the background) then jumping into hyperspace. The Mandalorian unscrews the knob from the lever. ]

Din Djarin: I told you that was a bad idea.

[ He gives the knob to the Child to play with. ]

[ Cut to Xi'an, Burg, and Mayfeld in a cell on board the prison ship. ]

End.



Ep 7 - The Reckoning
[ The Razor Crest is seen travelling in space. On board, the Child is sleeping. A hologram message pops up. ]

Greef Karga: My friend, if you are receiving this transmission that means you are alive. You might be surprised to hear this but I am alive too. I guess we can call it even. A lot has happened since we last saw each other. The man who hired you is still here, and his ranks of ex-Imperial guards have grown. They have imposed despotic rule over my city, which has impeded the livelihood of the Guild. We consider him an enemy but we cannot get close enough to take him out. If you would consider one last commission I will very much make it worth your while. You have been successful so far in staving off their hunters. But they will not stop until they have their prize. So here is my proposition: Return to Nevarro, bring the Child as bait. I will arrange an exchange and provide loyal Guild members as protection. Once we get near the client, you kill him, and we both get what we want. If you succeed, you keep the Child and I will have your name cleared with the Guild, for a man of honour should not be forced to live in exile. I await your arrival with optimism.

[ The Mandalorian looks back at the sleeping Child, then sets a course, and the Razor Crest jumps into hyperspace. ]

Title Screen

[ Cut to the Razor Crest flying over Sorgan, then landing in a clearing. ]

[ Cut to Cara Dune in a laser tethered boxing match against a male Zabrak in the common house, which she wins. ]

Cara Dune: Pay up, mudscuffers! Come on. (as patrons are paying her) That's mine, thank you. Thank you.

[ The Mandalorian walks in. ]

Din Djarin: Looking for some work?

[ Cut to them sitting at a table, spotchka being poured. ]

Din Djarin: It seems like a straightforward operation. They're providing the plan and firepower, I'm the snare.

Cara Dune: With the kid?

Din Djarin: That's why I'm coming to you.

Cara Dune: I don't know. I've been advised to lay low. If anybody runs my chain code I'll rot in a cell for the rest of my life.

Din Djarin: I thought you were a veteran.

[ The Zabrak boxer comes by and drops some coins on the table. ]

Cara Dune: (sweetly) Come back soon. (to the Mandalorian) I've been a lot things since, most of them carry a life sentence. If I so much as book passage on a ship registered to the New Republic I'm--

Din Djarin: I have a ship. I can bring you there and back with a handsome reward. You can live free of worry.

Cara Dune: I'm already free of worry. And I'm not in the mood to play soldier anymore. Especially fighting some local warlord.

Din Djarin: He's not a local warlord. He's Imperial.

Cara Dune: I'm in.

[ Cut to the Razor Crest travelling through space, then into the cockpit. ]

Cara Dune: Does your contact need to vet me?

Din Djarin: Doesn't know you're coming.

Cara Dune: Really? That can be a problem.

Din Djarin: It won't. But if it is, that's his problem.

[ He leaves the cockpit, and she follows. He opens the weapons vault down below. ]

Cara Dune: He all right up there alone?

Din Djarin: Yeah.

[ Cara ogles the weapons. ]

Din Djarin: Pick one.

Cara Dune: (inspecting the weapons) You trust the contact?

Din Djarin: Not particularly. He and I had a run-in last time I was there on some Guild business.

Cara Dune: So then why are we going?

Din Djarin: I don't have a choice. You saw what happened on Sorgan. They'll keep sending hunters. The kid'll never be safe until the Imp is dead.

Cara Dune: And you're okay with bringing him back there?

Din Djarin: Not really. That's why I'm bringing you.

[ Suddenly the ship shakes and banks. The Mandalorian climbs up into the cockpit to find the Child playing with the ship's controls. He grabs the Child, hands it to Cara and stabilises the ship. ]

Cara Dune: We're gonna need someone to watch that thing.

Din Djarin: Yeah...

Cara Dune: You got anyone you can trust?

[ Cut to the Razor Crest approaching Arvala-7 and landing near Kuiil's moisture farm. ]

Kuiil: Whoa! Easy, Whoa!

[ The Mandalorian and Cara enter Kuiil's residence with the Child in a floating crib. ]

Kuiil: It hasn't grown much.

Din Djarin: I think it might be a strand-cast.

Kuiil: I don't think it was engineered. I've worked in the gene farms. This one looks evolved. Too ugly. This one on the other hand (pointing at Cara) looks like she was farmed in the Cytocaves of Nora.

Din Djarin: This is Cara Dune. She was a shock-trooper.

Kuiil: You were a dropper?

Cara Dune: Did you serve?

Kuiil: On the other side, I'm afraid. But I'm proud to say that I paid out my clan's debt and now I serve no one but myself.

[ An IG unit enters the building with a tray. Both, the Mandalorian and Cara Dune jump up and draw their blasters on the droid. ]

IG-11: Would anyone care for some tea?

Kuiil: Please lower your blasters. He will not harm you.

Din Djarin: That thing is programmed to kill the baby.

Kuiil: Not anymore.

[ IG-11 places the tray on the table. Flashbacks to the aftermath of the Mandalorian's fight at the encampment where the Child had been held. ]

Kuiil: (flashback to bodies in the encampment, Kuiil atop a blurrg on the hillside above) It was left behind in the wake of your destruction. (Kuiil entering the room where IG-11 fell) I found it, laying where it fell, (cradling IG-11) devoid of all life. (transporting IG-11 on the blurrg) I recovered the flotsam and staked it as my own in accordance with the Charter of the New Republic. (working on the droid) Little remained of its neural harness. Reconstruction was quite difficult, but not impossible. (training the droid) It had to learn everything from scratch. This is something that cannot be taught with the twist of a spanner. It requires patience, repetition. I spent day after day reinforcing its development with patience and affirmation. It developed a personality as its experiences grew.

Din Djarin: Is it still a hunter?

Kuiil: No. But it will protect.

IG-11: (lifting a cup) Tea?

[ Cut to Kuiil tending to a blurrg. The Mandalorian approaches. ]

Din Djarin: I've run into some problems.

Kuiil: I figured as much. Why else would you return?

Din Djarin: I wanna hire your services.

Kuiil: I'm retired from service.

Din Djarin: I can pay you handsomely, Ugnaught.

Kuiil: I have a name. It is Kuiil.

Din Djarin: I need someone to protect the little one, Kuiil.

Kuiil: I'm not suited for such work. I can reprogram IG-11 for nursing and protocol.

Din Djarin: No! I don't want that droid anywhere near him.

Kuiil: Why are you so distrustful of droids?

Din Djarin: It tried to kill him.

Kuiil: It was programmed to do so. Droids are not good or bad. They are neutral reflections of those who imprint them.

Din Djarin: I've seen otherwise.

Kuiil: Do you trust me?

Din Djarin: From what I can tell, yes.

Kuiil: Then you will trust my work. IG-11 will join me. And we do it not for payment, but to protect the Child from Imperial slavery. None will be free until the old ways are gone. Forever.

Din Djarin: Okay.

Kuiil: And the blurrgs will join me as well.

Din Djarin: The blurrgs?

Kuiil: I have spoken.

[ Cut to the Razor Crest flying away from Arvala-7, then to inside the ship and the blurrg in the cargo hold. The Mandalorian and Cara are arm wrestling. ]

Cara Dune: I got you, Mando.

Din Djarin: Care to double the bet?

[ The Child looks on, worried. Then it raises its hand, and suddenly Cara is gasping for air. The Mandalorian notices the Child's face. ]

Din Djarin: (grabbing the Child) No! No no, stop! We're friends, we're friends! Cara is my friend!

Cara Dune: That is not okay!

Kuiil: Very curious.

Cara Dune: Curious?! It almost killed me!

Kuiil: The story you told me of the mudhorn now makes more sense.

Din Djarin: What is it?

Kuiil: What it is, I don't know. But what it does, this, this I've heard rumours of.

Cara Dune: What? When you worked for the Empire?

Kuiil: When I was sold to the Empire, in indentured servitude.

Cara Dune: Yet somehow, you walk free.

Kuiil: I bought my freedom through the skill of my hands and the labour of three of your human lifetimes. (IG-11 approaches in the background) Do not cast doubt upon that of what I am nor whom I shall serve.

[ Cara and IG-11 are in a staring match. ]

Din Djarin: Tell you what. I can really use your craftwork right now. Can you pad this container so the Child can sleep better?

Kuiil: I shall fabricate a better one. Then perhaps this dropper can see how one can win their freedom with the skill of one's hands.

[ Cut to Kuiil working on a new crib, the Child beside him, then into the cockpit to Cara and the Mandalorian. ]

Cara Dune: So we're going to Nevarro.

Din Djarin: Have you ever been?

Cara Dune: No. We lost all of our forces there. The city's dug in pretty deep. There's no cover when you drop in. Stayed in Empire control till the end of the war.

Din Djarin: The warlord we're taking out was an Imperial officer.

Cara Dune: What station?

Din Djarin: Hard to tell. No insignia anymore. I took out the safehouse when I snatched the kid. More Imps have reinforced since.

Cara Dune: There is something more going on.

Din Djarin: Maybe. We'll find out more when we land.

[ IG-11 enters the cockpit. ]

IG-11: I have prepared second meal. Would you care to be served here or below?

Din Djarin: I'm not hungry.

[ IG-11 leaves. ]

Din Djarin: Under no circumstances does that thing leave the ship.

Cara Dune: You got a real thing for droids, don't you.

Din Djarin: I got a real thing for that droid.

Cara Dune: The Ugnaught said he rewired it.

Din Djarin: That droid was designed to kill things. I don't care how much wiring he replaced, it goes against its nature.

Cara Dune: Well, shouldn't be a long job anyway. You take out the head Imp, the rest will run like rats.

[ Cara leaves the cockpit. ]

[ Cut to the Razor Crest approaching Nevarro. ]

[ Cut to Greef Karga and three associates awaiting the Razor Crest's arrival. The Mandalorian, Cara, and Kuiil exit mounted on blurrgs. ]

Greef Karga: Sorry for the remote rendezvous, Mando. But things have gotten complicated since you were last here. It appears that introductions are in order. It seems we've both provided a security detail. I recommend the shock-trooper guards the ship, these lava fields are lousy with Jawas.

Din Djarin: She's coming with me.

Greef Karga: But the town is now run by ex-Empire. If a rebel dropper is with us, they'll all get their hackles up.

Din Djarin: She's coming.

Greef Karga: Fine. Fine. At least cover your tattoo. No need to flaunt it. Now, where is the little one?

[ The Mandalorian has the floating crib move forward and open up so Greef Karga can see the Child. ]

Greef Karga: So... this little bogwing is what all the fuss was about. (taking the Child out of the crib) What a precious little creature. I can see why you didn't wanna harm a hair on its wrinkled little head. (placing the Child back in the crib) Well, I'm glad this matter will be put to rest once and for all.

[ The Mandalorian recalls the crib. ]

Greef Karga: The sun drops fast on Nevarro. We can walk for a spell and camp out on the river bank, then make our way into town at first light.

[ Cut to the group travelling across lava fields, then to a camp around a fire with meat on a spit. One of the bounty hunters scoops up some lava for the fire. Kuiil feeds the Child while the members of the groups eye each other suspiciously. ]

Greef Karga: I guess the little bugger's a carnivore. Never seen anything like it. They were ready to pay a king's ransom for that thing. Must be for some kind of highfalutin menagerie.

Din Djarin: Let's go over the plan again.

Greef Karga: We both enter the common house. We show the client the bait. We join him at the table, and you kill him.

Din Djarin: Tell me about his reinforcements.

Greef Karga: They're all ex-Empire. As soon as they lose their paycheck, psh... they'll all scatter.

Din Djarin: And what if they don't?

Greef Karga: They will.

Din Djarin: That's not good enough.

Greef Karga: If, for argument's sake, a few of them don't realise that I'm their best path to alternative employment, and they elect to react impulsively, then these three fine Guild hunters along with that battle hardened shock-trooper will cut down anyone who bucks.

Din Djarin: How many will there be?

Greef Karga: No more than four. (getting up) He travels with, at most, a fire team. Trust me, nothing could go wrong.

[ Suddenly a winged creature swoops in and grabs the meat from Greef's hands. Everybody starts shooting at a pack of dragons, the Mandalorian closes the crib. One of the dragons grabs a blurrg. ]

Kuiil: No! Let go of her! Drop her now!

[ Brief quiet, then one of the bounty hunters is grabbed. Another dragon grabs a second blurrg. ]

Kuiil: Drop her!

[ Both, dragon and blurrg are killed. Another dragon attacks the Mandalorian, who fights it off with fire. The dragons disappear. Greef Karga lies injured. ]

Kuiil: He's hurt badly.

Greef Karga: I'm fine. I'm fine. I'm fine. I'm fine. Ow!

Cara Dune: Hold still. They got you good.

Din Djarin: How bad?

Cara Dune: Bad. The poison is spreading fast.

Greef Karga: So this...this is how it happens.

Cara Dune: Don't be so dramatic. I need another medpack. Got any other medpacks? Anyone?

[ The Child is seen walking over. ]

Greef Karga: I'm guessing that's a "no".

Cara Dune: (scanning the arm) It's still spreading. This isn't working.

[ The Child is beside Greef Karga now. ]

Cara Dune: Get this thing outta here.

Kuiil: Wait.

[ The Child places its hand on Greef Karga's wound. ]

Greef Karga: He's trying to eat me.

[ His face relaxes, and everyone watches as the wound closes, and the Child sits back, spent. Everyone is in awe as the wound completely heals. ]

[ Cut to daytime and the group walking again. ]

Cara Dune: You think they're having second thoughts?

Din Djarin: Could be. I need your eyes.

Cara Dune: I'm watching.

[ Cut to the group halting a short distance from town. ]

Greef Karga: I guess this is it.

[ The remaining bounty hunters close in behind the Mandalorian and Cara, blasters drawn. Suddenly Greef spins, drawing two blasters, and shooting both hunters, then raising his blaster in capitulation. Both, the Mandalorian and Cara keep their blaster trained on him though. ]

Greef Karga: There's something you should know. The plan was to kill you and take the kid. But after what happened last night I couldn't go through with it. Go on, you can gun me down here and now, and it wouldn't violate the Code. But if you do, this child will never be safe.

Cara Dune: We'll take our chances.

Greef Karga: The Imperial client is obsessed with obtaining this asset. You tried to run, but where did it get you?

Cara Dune: This is ridiculous.

Kuiil: Perhaps you should let him speak.

Greef Karga: Listen. We both need the client to be eliminated. Let me take the Child to him, and then you two--

Din Djarin: No.

Cara Dune: Let's just kill him and get outta here.

Din Djarin: He's right.

Cara Dune: What are you doing?

Din Djarin: As long as the Imp lives he'll send hunters after the Child.

Cara Dune: It's a trap.

Din Djarin: Bring me.

Greef Karga: Bring you?

Din Djarin: Tell him you captured me. Get me close to him, and I'll kill him.

Greef Karga: That's a good idea. Gimme your blaster.

Cara Dune: This is insane!

Din Djarin: It's the only way.

Cara Dune: Well, I'm coming with you.

Greef Karga: No no no. That would make them suspicious.

Cara Dune: I don't care. I'm coming.

Din Djarin: Tell'em she caught me.

Greef Karga: Fine. Then she can bring the Child.

Din Djarin: No. The kid goes back in the ship.

Greef Karga: But without the Child none of this works.

Din Djarin: I have a plan. Kuiil, ride back to the Razor Crest with the Child and seal yourself in. When you're inside, engage ground security protocols, and nothing on this planet will breach those doors.

Kuiil: Here's a comlink. I will keep the Child safe. (to Cara) Don't forget to cover your stripes.

Din Djarin: Let's go.

[ The Mandalorian gives Greef Karga his handcuffs, and Greef places them on the Mandalorian, Cara covers her tattoo, and Kuiil takes the Child. Kuiil and the other three leave in opposite directions. ]

[ Cut to the Mandalorian, Greef Karga and Cara Dune arriving at the gate of the city where Stormtroopers stand guard. ]

Stormtrooper: Chain code.

Greef Karga: I have a gift for the boss.

Stormtrooper: Chain code!

[ Greef Karga produces his ID card. The Stormtrooper scans it. ]

Stormtrooper: I give you 20 credits for the helmet.

Greef Karga: Not a chance. That's going on my wall.

Din Djarin: (softly) On your wall...?

GreefKarga: Go with it.

Stormtrooper: Go ahead.

[ They move into town, seeing a lot of Stormtroopers. ]

Cara Dune: You said four. There are more than four troopers.

Greef Karga: Four guarding the client. Many more here in town. Things got really heated once Mando crashed the safehouse.

Cara Dune: Slip him his blaster.

Greef Karga: Not yet.

[ Cut to Kuiil riding fast across the lava fields, the Child in his arms. ]

[ Cut to Greef Karga, Cara Dune and the Mandalorian arriving at the common house. ]

Greef Karga: Here we are. (entering) You see...four.

[ They approach the client. ]

Greef Karga: Look what I brought you. As promised.

Client: (caressing the Mandalorian's beskar armour) What exquisit craftmanship. It is amazing how beautiful beskar can be when forged by its ancestral artisans. Can I offer you a libation to celebrate the closing of our shared narrative?

Greef Karga: I would be obliged.

Client: Please sit. (as Greef shoves Mando into the booth, and more Stormtroopers enter) It is a shame that your people suffered so. Just as in this situation, it was all avoidable. Why did Mandalore resist our expansion? The Empire improves every system it touches. Judge by any metric. Safety. Prosperity. Trade. Opportunity. Peace. Compare Imperial rule to what is happening now. Look outside. Is the world more peaceful since the revolution? I see nothing but death and chaos. I would like to see the baby.

Greef Karga: Uh...it is asleep.

Client: We all will be quiet. Open the pram.

[ A Stormtrooper comes over and whispers something to the client. ]

Client: (getting up) Don't think me to be rude. I must take this call.

[ The Mandalorian loosens the cuffs under the table as the client walks away to a portable comms pad. ]

Din Djarin: (whispering) Gimme the blaster.

Greef Karga: (whispering, passing the blaster) You get one shot.

Cara Dune: This is bad. You said four.

Greef Karga: Well...there are more. What can I tell you?

[ The client brings up hologram. ]

Client: Yes, Moff Gideon.

Moff Gideon: Have they brought the Child?

Client: Yes, they have. Currently it is sleeping.

Moff Gideon: You may wanna check again.

[ Moff Gideon gestures, and suddenly the client goes down, fatally hit as blaster shots are fired through the window to pepper the inside of the common house, killing everything in their path. Once the shooting stops, Cara and the Mandalorian move out of cover to both sides of the window. They see an Imperial firing squad outside with another transport full of Stormtroopers incoming. ]

Cara Dune: Four Stormtroopers?

[ Even more Stormtroopers are flooding in from the adjacent streets, surrounding the common house. ]

Cara Dune: This is bad.

Din Djarin: (into comms) Kuiil, are you back to the ship yet?

[ Cut to Kuiil riding. ]

Din Djarin: (over comms) Are you there? ( Stormtroopers listening in) Do you copy?

Kuiil: Yes!

Din Djarin: Are you back to the ship yet?

Kuiil: Not yet.

Din Djarin: Get back to the ship and bail! Get the kid out of here. We're pinned down!

[ Kuiil pushes the blurrg harder. -- Two Stormtroopers take up pursuit. -- Back in town, a TIE fighter arrives. -- Kuiil rides harder, the ship in sight. -- The man existing the TIE fighter moves to stand in front of the common house. ]

Moff Gideon: You have something I want.

Cara Dune: Who is this guy?

Moff Gideon: You may think you have some idea of what you are in possession of. But you do not.

Din Djarin: Kuiil, are you back to the ship yet? They're on to us.

[ Cut to Stormtroopers in pursuit, then to Kuiil. ]

Din Djarin: (over coms) Kuiil, come in!

[ Cut to town. ]

Moff Gideon: In a few moments, it will be mine.

[ Kuiil riding hard, the ship not far away. The Stormtroopers are closing in. ]

Din Djarin: Kuiil, do you copy?! Kuiil...

[ The ship's ramp is opening as Kuiil approaches. ]

Moff Gideon: It means more to me than you will ever know.

Din Djarin: Kuiil... Are you there?!

[ Cut to the Child lying on the ground. ]

Din Djarin: (over comms) Come in, Kuiil! Kuiil, come in!

[ A Stormtrooper approaches on his bike and scoops up the Child. ]

Din Djarin: (over comms during a pan from the comms link on the ground...) Kuiil! Are you there?! Do you copy?! (...to Kuiil lying dead on the ground and the Stormtroopers speeding away) Kuiil! Kuill!!

End.



Ep 8 - Redemption

[ Two Stormtroopers are seen speeding across the lava fields on their speeder bikes. One of them is carrying a bag with the Child in it. They stop on a ridge outside of town. ]

Trooper 1: Speeder bikes have arrived at the checkpoint with the asset. Awaiting confirmation. (punching the squealing Child) Knock it off! Waiting for confirmation to continue into town.

Operator: (over comms) That's a go to proceed, but I advise you to double-check. The Moff just touched down and already took out a squad of local troopers.

Trooper 1: Standing by.

Trooper 2: Did he just say that Gideon killed his own men?

Trooper 1: Oh, who knows? These guys like to lay down the law when they first arrive into town, y'know. You know how it is. (punching the Child again as it cries) I said, shut up. Yeesh.

Trooper 2: What is that thing, anyway?

Trooper 1: Uh, I don't know. Maybe Moff wants to eat it. I don't ask questions.

Trooper 2: Can I see it?

Trooper 1: Did you not just hear that Moff Gideon killed a dozen of his own troopers to make a point?

Trooper 2: Okay.

Trooper 1: I get that point. Do you get the point?

Trooper 2: Yes.

Trooper 1: Okay.

[ They sit and wait, bored. Trooper 2 starts shooting at some garbage, missing. Trooper 1 shakes his head, starts shooting too. Both keep missing. ]

Trooper 2: Should we offer that thing some water?

Trooper 1: You just wanna look at it.

Trooper 2: So what? You got to see it!

Trooper 1: Barely. I mean, I grabbed it up off the ground and I stuffed it in the sack.

Trooper 2: It's more than I got to see it.

Trooper 1: Look, I'm not taking it out of this bag until I deliver it to the Moff.

Trooper 2: Fine.

Trooper 1: Okay. Stop asking.

[ Trooper 1 gets off his bike. ]

Trooper 1: Let me check on this thing. This is crazy. (into comlink) Any update yet?

Operator: (over comms) That's a negative. Still waiting on confirmation. He just killed and officer for interrupting him, so this might take a while.

Trooper 1: (sighs) Thank you. Standing by still. Unbelievable.

Trooper 2: Hey, how long has it been since that thing moved?

Trooper 1: I don't know, like a minute or two. Don't worry.

Trooper 2: (getting off his bike) Uh, it's been way longer than a minute.

Trooper 1: Oh my God.

Trooper 2: Shouldn't we check and see if it's still alive? You hit it pretty hard.

Trooper 1: You just wanna see it.

Trooper 2: Well, we should check and see if it's hurt. The last thing that you want is to give Gideon a bag and have him open it up and find whatever is dead...

Trooper 1: Okay. Okay, look. (opens the bag) Here you go. See? Take a peek. Everything's fine.

Trooper 2: (looking and poking at the Child) What is that?

Trooper 1: I don't know. It's a pet or something.

Trooper 2: A pet? I thought you-- (the Child bites his finger) OW! (yelps, shaking his hand, then turning back and punching the bag hard)

Trooper 1: Serves you right.

[ A droid approaches. ]

Droid: Stop that.

[ The troopers draw their blasters. ]

Trooper 1: Identify yourself!

Droid: I am IG-11. I am this child's nurse droid and require that you remand him to me immediately.

Trooper 2: (chuckles) A nurse droid? I thought it was a hunter. Aren't IGs usually hunters?

Trooper 1: Yeah, well, evidently this one's a nurse.

[ IG-11 approaches. ]

Trooper 2: I'm sorry, nurse, but you're gonna have to get out of here. (giving a warning shot and stepping closer)

IG-11: Are you refusing my request?

Trooper 1: No. I'm telling you to get out of here.

[ IG-11 grabs the Trooper's arm and twists it until it snaps, then slams him down. Then he grabs the other Trooper's head and smashes him down on his bike repeatedly. Then he gets on the bike and powers it up. ]

IG-11: (to the squealing Child) That was unpleasant. I'm sorry you had to see that.

[ They speed off. ]

Title Screen

[ Cut to town where Stormtroopers, Death Troopers and Moff Gideon are surrounding and watching the shot up common house, then cut to inside the common house. ]

Cara Dune: Is there another way out?

Greed Karga: No, that's it.

Din Djarin: What about the sewers?

Greef Karga: Sewers?

Din Djarin: The Mandalorians have a covert down in the sewers. If we can get down there, they can help us escape.

Cara Dune: Yeah, sewers are good!

Din Djarin: Checking for access points.

Cara Dune: What the hell are they waiting for?

[ Stormtroopers unpack and bring forward weapons parts. ]

Cara Dune: Hold up.

[ The troopers are setting up a cannon. ]

Cara Dune: They're setting up an E-Web.

Greef Karga: It's over.

[ The Mandalorian's visor reveals a sewer access point behind a bench. ']]

Din Djarin: I found the sewer vent.

Cara Dune: Let's get the hell outta here.

[ They run to the back of the common house and pull the bench off the wall, while the troopers outside are setting up the cannon. They try to open the sewer grate; the troopers are powering up the weapon. ]

Din Djarin: It's assembled.

Greef Karga: How long until that thing's cleared?

Cara Dune: Blow it.

Din Djarin: I'm out of charges.

Cara Dune: (grabbing her blaster rifle) Get out of the way!

[ She tries to shoot the vent grate off while the enemy outside watches and listens. She tries to kick the vent in, but it doesn't budge. ]

Moff Gideon: Your astute panic suggests that you understand your situation. I would prefer to avoid any further violence, and encourage a moment of consideration. Members of my escort have completed assembly of an E-Web heavy repeating blaster. If you are unfamiliar with this weapon, I am sure that Republican Shock Trooper Carasynthia Dune of Alderaan will advise you that she has witnessed many of her ranks vaporize mid-descent facing the predecessor of this particular model. Or perhaps the decommissioned Mandalorian hunter, Din Djarin, has heard the songs of the Siege of Mandalore, when gunships outfitted with similar ordnance laid waste to fields of Mandalorian recruits in The Night of a Thousand Tears. I advise disgraced Magistrate Greef Karga to search the wisdom of his years and urge you to lay down your arms and come outside. The structure you are trapped in will be razed in short order and your storied lives will come to an unceremonious end. ]

Greef Karga: What do you propose?

Moff Gideon: Reasonable negotiation.

Greef Karga: What assurance do you offer?

Moff Gideon: If you're asking if you can trust me...you cannot. Just as you betrayed our business arrangement, I would gladly break any promise and watch you die at my hand. The assurance I give is this: I will act in my own self-interest, which at this time involves your cooperation and benefit. I will give you until nightfall, and then I will have the E-Web cannon open fire.

[ Gideon turns and walks away. ]

Greef Karga: I say we hear him out.

Cara Dune: The minute we open that door, we're dead.

Greef Karga: We're dead if we don't. At least out there we've got a shot.

Cara Dune: (as she is collecting weapons and ammo) That's easy for you to say. I'm a Rebel Shock Trooper. They'll upload me to a Mind Flayer.

Greef Karga: Those aren't real. That was just wartime propaganda.

Cara Dune: Well, I don't care to find out. I'm shooting my way outta here.

Greef Karga: What about you, Mando?

Din Djarin: I know who he is.

[ Both Cara and Greef look at him, shocked and/or surprised. ]

Din Djarin: It's Moff Gideon.

Cara Dune: No. Moff Gideon was executed for war crimes.

Din Djarin: It's him. He knew my name.

Greef Karga: So? What does that prove?

Din Djarin: I haven't heard that name spoken since I was a child.

Greef Karga: On Mandalore?

Din Djarin: I was not born on Mandalore.

Greef Karga: But you're a Mandalorian.

Cara Dune: Mandalorian isn't a race.

Din Djarin: It's a Creed.

[ Flashback to Din Djarin's childhood, where he is seen carried by his father, accompanied by his mother, as they flee from droids shooting everyone in sight. His parents put him in an underground storage and close the hatch. Then an explosion. A droid opens the hatch, but before it can kill him, it gets shot and destroyed. A Mandalorian pulls him out, and he watches a squad of Mandalorians fight the droids. Then the man who saved him, takes him away, leaving the fighting behind. ]

Din Djarin: I was a foundling. They raised me in the Fighting Corps. I was treated as one of their own. When I came of age, I was sworn to the Creed. The only record of my family name was in the registers of Mandalore. Moff Gideon was an ISB Officer during the purge. That's how I know it's him.

Cara Dune: That's how he knows who we all are.

Din Djarin: He says he needs us, which means the Child got away safely. I was worried when the Ugnaught didn't respond, but if they'd captured the kid, we'd already be dead.

Cara Dune: Hail them again.

Din Djarin: (into comlink) Come in, Kuiil. Kuiil! Nothing.

Cara Dune: They might have jammed the link.

[ The group hears the Child squeal over the comms. Cut to IG-11 on the speeder bike with the Child in a bag strapped to his chest. ]

IG-11: Kuiil has been terminated.

[ Cut to the common house. ]

Din Djarin: What did you do?

IG-11: (over comms) I am fulfilling my base function.

Din Djarin: Which is?

[ Cut to IG-11. ]

IG-11: To nurse and protect.

[ They are speeding toward town, approaching a Stormtrooper secured gate. ]

Trooper: What was that? Look alive.

[ The Troopers start shooting at the oncoming speeder, but IG-11 takes them out and continues into town, taking down Troopers along his way. Troopers around the common house start noticing and turn their attention. ]

Cara Dune: Look!

[ IG-11 comes speeding up the road, jumps off the bike to let the bike crash into the Troopers, then proceeds to shoot the Troopers around it. ]

Din Djarin: Cover me!

[ Cara shoots at the Troopers from inside the common house. The Mandalorian and Greef Karga leave the common house, taking out Troopers around them. Then the Mandalorian grabs the E-Web cannon off its base and decimates the Trooper ranks. A Death Trooper blasts the main entry, knocking Cara down, but she can take the intruders out. Moff Gideon shows up again, knocking the Mandalorian in the helmet with a blaster shot. Then he takes out the E-Web power unit, the resulting massive explosion taking the Mandalorian down. IG-11 keeps advancing, and under fire cover by IG-11 and Greef, Cara grabs the Mandalorian to drag him to relative safety back inside the common house. ]

Moff Gideon: Burn them out.

[ In the common house. ]

Cara Dune: Stay with me, buddy. We're gonna get you outta here.

Greef Karga: (to IG-11 and pointing to the sewer crate) This is our only way out. Can you clear it?

[ As Cara lays the Mandalorian down, IG-11 approaches the grate. ]

Cara Dune: Stay with me.

IG-11: (to Greef Karga) If you go near this Child, I will have no choice but to kill you.

Greef Karga: I understand. Can you do anything to move the grate?

IG-11: Yes, of course.

[ IG-11 gets to work on the grate. ]

Greef Karga: Oh, I love IG units.

Din Djarin: I'm not gonna make it. Go.

Cara Dune: Shut up. You just got your bell rung. You'll be fine.

Din Djarin: (weakly) Leave me.

[ Cara pulls her hand from under the Mandalorian's head, fingers full of blood. ]

Cara Dune: (reaching for the Mandalorian's helmet) I'm gonna need to take this thing off.

Din Djarin: (grabbing her hands) No. You leave me. (gasping) You make sure the Child is safe. Here. (pulling off a necklace, giving it to Cara) When you get to the Mandalorian covert, you show them that. You tell them it's from Din Djarin. You tell them the foundling was in my protection, and they'll help you.

Cara Dune: We can make it.

[ Outside, an Incinerator Stormtrooper walks up. ]

Cara Dune: (pushing and pulling at the Mandalorian) Come on! Let's go!

Din Djarin: (weakly) I'm not gonna make it, and you know it.

[ A blast of fire bursts through the window. Cara covers the Mandalorian with her body. IG-11 is still working on the vent grate. ]

Din Djarin: You protect the Child. I can hold them back long enough for you to escape. Let me have a warrior's death.

Cara Dune: (firmly) I won't leave you.

Din Djarin: This is the Way.

[ The Incinerator Stormtrooper blasts fire through the open door, the Child has crept out of the bag and is standing in the middle of the room. The Incinerator Stormtrooper enter the common house. Everyone looks on in horror as the Child is directly in the way of the flamethrower - holding off the flames, then pushing them out, throwing the Trooper out in an explosion, saving them all. The Child falls over, spent. IG-11 kicks in the vent crate. ]

Greef Karga: Come on! It's open, let's go!

Din Djarin: (gasping) Go. Go.

Greef Karga: We have to move. Now!

[ IG-11 grabs the Child. ]

Din Djarin: (rasping) Go.

[ Finally, Cara gets up. IG-11 shoves the Child in the bag into her arms. ]

IG-11: Escape and protect this child. I will stay with the Mandalorian.

Cara Dune: Promise me you'll bring him.

IG-11: You have my word.

[ She and Greef Karga leave with the Child. IG-11 kneels down by the Mandalorian. ]

Din Djarin: DO it.

IG-11: Do what?

Din Djarin: Just get it over with. I'd rather you kill me than some Imp.

IG-11: I told you, I am no longer a hunter. I am a nurse droid.

Din Djarin: IGs are all hunters.

IG-11: Not this one. I was reprogrammed. I need to remove your helmet if I am to save you.

[ IG-11 reaches to grab the helmet, and the Mandalorian raises a blaster in his face. ]

Din Djarin: Try it and I'll kill you. It is...forbidden. No living thing has seen me without my helmet since I...swore the Creed.

IG-11: I am not a living thing. (removing the helmet) This is a bacta spray. (applying the spray) It will heal you in a matter of hours. You have suffered damage to your central processing unit.

Din Djarin: You mean my brain?

IG-11: That was a joke. It is meant to put you at ease.

[ The Mandalorian gives a laboured chuckle. ]

[ Cut to the sewers. Cara and Greef turn as they hear footsteps behind them. It's IG-11 with the Mandalorian, helmet back in place. Cara passes the Child back to IG-11 and takes over helping the Mandalorian. ]

Cara Dune: I got you.

[ They move through the sewers. ]

Greef Karga: Do you know which way to go?

Din Djarin: No. I don't know these tunnels. I've only entered from the bazaar.

Greef Karga: Well, if we get the smell of sulfur and we follow it, it'll lead us up to the plains where the river flows.

Din Djarin: And the Imps will catch us before we make it to the ship. We need the Mandalorians to escort us to safety.

Cara Dune: Ugh, this place is a maze.

Din Djarin: Stop. I can stand.

IG-11: The bacta infusion is working.

Din Djarin: I'll try to find tracks. (after looking around, pointing) We're close. Turn here.

[ They come upon a pile of Mandalorian armour, mostly helmets. Djarin drops to his knee in front of it, taking one of the helmets, as the others look on. Cara steps closer. ]

Cara Dune: We should go.

Din Djarin: You go. Take the ship. I can't leave it this way. (to Greef) Did you know about this? Is this the work of your bounty hunters?

Greef Karga: No. When you left the system and took the prize, the fighting ended and the hunters just melted away. You know how it is. They're mercenaries. They're not zealots.

Din Djarin: (getting up and rounding on Greef) Did you do this? (getting in his face) Did you?!

Greef Karga: No!

Armorer: It was not his fault. We revealed ourselves. We knew what could happen if we left the covert. (taking a piece of armour from the pile and adding it to a floating cart) The Imperials arrived shortly thereafter. This is what resulted.

Din Djarin: Did any survive?

Armorer: I hope so. Some may have escaped off-world.

Din Djarin: Come with us.

Armorer: No. I will not abandon this place until I have salvaged what remains.

[ She leaves, and the others follow her into the forge where she continues to melt down armour pieces. ]

Armorer: Show me the one whose safety deemd such desruction.

Din Djarin: (as IG-11 reveals the Child) This is the one.

Armorer: This is the one you hunted, then saved?

Din Djarin: Yes. The one that saved me as well.

Armorer: From the mudhorn?

Din Djarin: Yes.

Armorer: It looks helpless.

Din Djarin: It's injured, but it is not helpless. Its species can move objects with its mind.

Armorer: I know of such things. The songs of eons past tell of battles between Mandalore the Great and an order of sorcerers called Jedi that fought with such powers.

Din Djarin: It is an enemy?

Armorer: No. Its kind were enemies, but this individual is not.

Din Djarin: What is it?

Armorer: It is a foundling. By Creed, it is in your care.

Din Djarin: You wish me to train this thing?

Armorer: It is too weak. It would die. You have no choice. You must reunite it with its own kind.

Din Djarin: Where?

Armorer: This, you must determine.

Din Djarin: You expect me to search the galaxy for the home of this creature and deliver it to a race of enemy sorcerers?

Armorer: This is the Way.

Cara Dune: Hey. These tunnels will be lousy with Imps in a matter of minutes. We should at least discuss an escape plan.

Armorer: If you follow the descending tunnel it will lead you to the underground river. It flows downstream toward the lava flats.

Greef Karga: I think we should go.

Din Djarin: I'm staying. I need to help her, and I need to heal.

Armorer: You must go. A foundling is in your care. By Creed, until it is of age or reunited with its own kind, you are as its father. This is the Way. You have earned your Signet.

[ The armorer attaches the signet she forged to the Mandalorian's pauldron. ]

Armorer: You are a clan of two.

Din Djarin: Thank you. I will wear this with honour.

[ Explosions startle the group. Stormtroopers are entering the tunnels. ]

Greef Karga: We should go.

Armorer: IG, please guard the outer hallway. A scouting party draws near.

Cara Dune: (being passed the Child) Hang on. I don't do the baby thing.

Armorer: I have one more gift for your journey. Have you trained in the Rising Phoenix?

Din Djarin: When I was a boy, yes.

Armorer: Then this (turning around with a jetpack in her hands) will make you complete.

Din Djarin: Thank you.

Armorer: When you have healed, you will begin your drills. Until you know it, it will not listen to your commands.

Din Djarin: I understand.

[ Blaster firing out in the hallways. Then quiet, and IG-11 returns. ]

IG-11: You are protected.

Armorer: More will come. You must go.

Din Djarin: Come with us.

Armorer: My place is here. Restock your munitions. IG, carry this for Din Djarin until he is well enough to wear it. (passing the jetpack to IG-11) Now, go! Down to the river and across the plains. Be safe on your journey,

Din Djarin: Thank you.
