[ They leave, the armorer staying behind. Stormtroopers close in and surround her. ]

Trooper: Hey, Mando! Where are they? (knocking against her helmet with his rifle) I said, where are they?

[ She explodes into action, taking down the Stormtroopers with her forging tools. ]

[ Cut to the others arriving at the underground lava river. ]

Greef Karga: This is the lava river.

Din Djarin: The ferry droid is fried.

Greef Karga: Yeah, but if we push the boat out we can get it to float downstream. Come on.

Din Djarin: Looks old. Will it take the heat?

Greef Karga: You got a better idea?

Din Djarin: Guess not.

[ They push at the boat, but it doesn't budge. ]

Greef Karga: Push!

[ Frustrated, the Mandalorian kicks at the boat. ]

Greef Karga: Come on! What're you doing?

Din Djarin: (grabbing a pole) Let's try this.

Greef Karga: Push!

Cara Dune: (unslinging her rifle) You guys mind getting out of the way?

Greef Karga: Oh!

[ Cara shoots at the cooled lava locking the boat in and it comes loose. ]

Greef Karga: Good job.

IG-11: Watch your feet. It's molten lava.

[ They get into the boat. ]

Cara Dune: No kidding.

[ The ferry droid comes to life and everyone turns to train their blaster on it. It gets up, beeping. ]

Din Djarin: I don't suppose anybody here speaks droid?

IG-11: I believe he is asking where we would like to go.

Greef Karga: Down river. To the lava flat.

[ The droid beeps and starts moving the boat along. Then Greef points to a light at the end of the tunnel. ]

Greef Karga: That's it. We're free!

Din Djarin: (scanning ahead with his visor) No. No, we're not. Stormtroopers. They're flanking the mouth of the tunnel. It looks like an entire platoon. Thye must know we're coming.

Cara Dune: Stop the boat. Hey, droid, I said stop the boat. Hey, I'm talking to you. I said stop!

[ She shoots its head off. ]

Greef Karga: We're still moving.

Cara Dune: Looks like we fight.

Din Djarin: There are too many.

Cara Dune: Well, then what do you suggest? Cuz I can't surrender.

IG-11: They will not be satisfied with anything less than the Child. This is unacceptable. I will eliminate the enemy, and you will escape.

Din Djarin: You don't have that kind of firepower, pal. You wouldn't even get to daylight.

IG-11: That is not my objective.

Cara Dune: We're getting close. Saddle up.

IG-11: I still have the security protocols from my manufacturer. If my designs are compromised, I must self-destruct.

Din Djarin: What are you talking about?

IG-11: I'm not permitted to be captured. I must be destroyed.

Greef Karga: Are we gonna keep talking or we gonna get outta here?

IG-11: (putting down the jetpack) I can no longer carry this for you. Nor can I watch over the child. (passing the Child to the Mandalorian)

Din Djarin: Wait. You can't self-destruct. Your base command is to watch the child. That supersedes your manufacturer's protocol, right? Right?

IG-11: This is correct.

Din Djarin: Good. Now grab a blaster and help us shoot our way out.

IG-11: Victory through combat is impossible. We will be captured. The child will be lost. Sadly, there is no scenario where the child is saved, in which I survive.

Din Djarin: Listen, you're not going anywhere. We need you. Let's just come with a--

IG-11: Please tell me the child will be safe in your care. If you do so, I can default to my secondary command.

Din Djarin: But you'll be destroyed.

IG-11: And you will live, and I will have served my purpose.

Din Djarin: (voice rough with emotion) No. We need you.

IG-11: There isnothing to be sad about. I have never been alive.

Din Djarin: I'm not sad.

IG-11: Yes you are. I'm a nurse droid. I've analyzed your voice. (caressing the Child in farewell)

Greef Karga: IG! (as the droid steps off the boat into the lava stream) What're you doing?!

[ IG-11 marches through the lava stream to the mouth of the tunnel where the Stormtroopers are lying in ambush. ]

IG-11: Manufacturer's protocol dictates I cannot be captured. (breastplate opening to reveal an active grenade) I must be destroyed.

[ IG-11 explodes, taking out all the Stormtroopers. As the boat emerges from the tunnel, a TIE fighter appears. ]

Cara Dune: Moff Gideon!

[ The TIE fighter opens fire on the group, and they shoot back. ]

Greef Karga: He missed!

Din Djarin: He won't next time.

Cara Dune: Our blasters are useless against him.

Greef Karga: Hey, let's make the baby do the magic hand thing. Come on, baby! Do the magic hand thing. (waving at the Child, the Child waves back) I'm out of ideas.

Din Djarin: I'm not.

Cara Dune: Here he comes!

[ Under grunts of pain, the Mandalorian attaches the jetpack and fires it up as the TIE fighter approaches again. He shoots up just before the TIE fighter passes above them, then turns and hooks on to the TIE fighter with his grappling hook. He mounts the fighter, nearly gets bucked and loses a charge, then manages to stick a couple of charges to the TIE fighter before letting go. The charges explode and the TIE fighter crashes. The Mandalorian falls...but manages to re-engage the jetpack to land safely. ]

Greef Karga: That was impressive, Mando. Very impressive. It looks like your Guild rates have just gone up.

Din Djarin: Any more stormtroopers?

Cara Dune: I think we cleaned up the town. I'm thinking of staying aorund just to be sure.

Din Djarin: You're staying here?

Greef Karga: Well, why not? Nevarro is a very fine planet. And now that the scum and villainy have been washed away, it's very respectable again.

Din Djarin: As a bounty hunter hive?

Greef Karga: Some of my favourite people are bounty hunters. And perhaps, this specimen of soldier might consider joining our ranks.

Cara Dune: Yeah... I've got some clerical concerns regarding my chain code.

[ The Child has waddled up to the Mandalorian and grabs onto his leg and coos up at him. ]

Greef Karga: And if you would agree to become my enforcer, clerical concerns would be the least of your worries. (turning to the Mandalorian) But you, my friend, you will be welcome back into the Guild with open arms. So, go off, enjoy yourself. And when you're ready to return, you will have the pick of all quarries.

[ The Mandalorian picks up the Child. ]

Din Djarin: I'm afraid I have more pressing matters at hand.

[ Cara steps forward and rubs the Child's ear. ]

Cara Dune: Take care of this little one.

[ As Cara steps back again, Greef Karga touches the Child's ear gently. ]

Greef Karga: Or maybe...it'll take care of you.

[ The Mandalorian engages the jetpack and takes off with the Child in his arms. Cut to him finishing up a burial mound for Kuiil, then walking away towards his ship. Cut into the cockpit, where he sets the Child down and powers up the ship. On a sound from the Child he turns around. ]

Din Djarin: What do you got there? (taking the pendant the Child was sucking on) I didn't think I'd see this again. Why don't you hang on to that? (giving the pendant back to the Child to suck on)

[ Cut to the ship taking off overhead of Cara and Greef. ]

[ Pan to the crash site of the TIE fighter where Jawas are picking the wreck apart. Suddenly the blade of a laser weapon cuts through the hull from inside, and Moff Gideon steps out wielding the Darksaber. He steps on top of the wreck, scanning the surroundings. ]

End.



Ep 9 - The Marshal
[ We open up to a dark, urban landscape. The Mandalorian, with the Child floating beside him in his pod, slowly emerges from the darkness, slowly walking along the dirt street. The building walls are coated in graffiti, and the entire place looks quite run-down. As they walk throughout the seedy town, the Child takes notice of numerous pairs of red eyes staring at them from the sides of the street, and lightly whimpers in fright. The two approach a door, which a sinister-looking Twi’lek doorman is guarding. ]

Din Djarin: I’m here to see Gor Koresh.

[ The doorman briefly glances at the Child, who coos, before moving aside and allowing the door to open. ]

Twi’lek Doorman: Enjoy the fights.

[ The Mandalorian and the Child descend some stairs down into a fighting area. Spectators surround an elevated platform, where two Gamorrean warriors are clashing with axes. Various flags with vibrant designs hang above the platform as well. The spectators cheer and shout in alien languages, as the Child looks around curiously. The Mandalorian settles into a seat next to a Gor Koresh, who is shown to be a chubby Abyssin, dressed in very fancy attire. ]

Gor Koresh: You know this is no place for a child.

Din Djarin: Wherever I go, he goes.

Gor Koresh: (chuckles) So I’ve heard.

Din Djarin: I’ve been quested to bring him to his kind. If I can locate other Mandalorians, they can help guide me. I’m told you know where to find them.

Gor Koresh: It’s uncouth to talk business immediately. Just enjoy the entertainment.

[ The Child coos in slight distress and surprise at the Gamorrean’s axes fiercely clanging together, as he observes the intense brawl. The opposing Gamorrean knocks Gor Koresh’s Gamorrean to the ground. ]

Gor Koresh: Bah! My Gamorrean’s not doing well. Kill him! Finish him!

[ The opposing Gamorrean slashes down with his axe, but Koresh’s warrior rolls out of the way just in time to dodge. ]

Gor Koresh: Do you gamble, Mando?

Din Djarin: Not when it can be avoided.

Gor Koresh: (chuckles) Well, I’ll bet you the information you seek that this Gamorrean’s going to die within the next minute and a half...and all you have to put up in exchange is your shiny beskar armor.

Din Djarin: I’m prepared to pay you for the information. I’m not leaving my fate up to chance.

Gor Koresh: Nor am I.

[ He pulls a blaster out of his coat and shoots the opposing Gamorrean, which falls onto the floor, dead. His axe clangs down next to his head. The spectators gasp in surprise, as Gor Koresh’s henchpeople rise from behind and beside him, drawing their guns to the Mandalorian’s head, along with Gor himself. The spectators flood out of the arena. Koresh’s Gamorrean rises up off the floor of the platform, recovering from his injuries. ]

Gor Koresh: (chuckles) Thank you for coming to me. Normally, I have to seek out remnants of you Mandalorians in your hidden hives to harvest your precious shiny shells. (chuckles again) Beskar’s value continues to rise. I’ve grown quite fond of it. Give it to me now or I will peel it off your corpse.

Din Djarin: Tell me where the Mandalorians are and I’ll walk outta here without killing you.

Gor Koresh: I thought you said you weren’t a gambler…

[ The Child looks on as the Mandalorian readies his whistling birds for attack, and he quickly closes himself within his crib. ]

Din Djarin: I’m not.

[ Quite suddenly, he releases the whistling birds. They shoot out, killing all four of Koresh’s henchmen. The Mandalorian kicks the Child’s crib out of the way of the fighting, and the Gamorrean jumps down from the platform to tackle him. As the Mandalorian shifts to the side, the Gamorrean smashes into the wooden spectator bench and is subsequently knocked out. The Twi’lek doorman grabs the Mandalorian from behind, but is quickly dispatched. Gor Koresh runs out of the arena, frightened. The Mandalorian briefly fights with two Zabraks and a Human warrior. The human is knocked out, as one Zabrak is stabbed. As the other Zabrak charges towards the Mandalorian, who throws a blade into his chest. The warrior falls. The Mandalorian sees Gor Koresh escaping out of an exit, and he quickly snatches up his pistol, which was dropped during the recent fighting, and begins following him. Gor Koresh flees outside, and the Mandalorian is quick to pursue, shooting out his grappling hook and catching him by the legs. Koresh falls into the dirt, as the Mandalorian pulls him in and slings the rope around one of the street lamps lining the dirt path, tying it to the bottom, and pulling Koresh upwards, so that he hangs upside-down, facing The Mandalorian. ]

Gor Koresh: All right, stop, stop! I’ll tell you where he is. But you must give me your word that you won’t kill me.

Din Djarin: I promise you will not die by my hand. Now, where is the Mandalorian you know of?

Gor Koresh: (groans) Tatooine.

Din Djarin: What?

Gor Koresh: (groans again) The Mando I know of is on Tatooine.

Din Djarin: I’ve spent much time on Tatooine. I’ve never seen a Mandalorian there.

Gor Koresh: My information is good, I tell you. The city of Mos Pelgo. I swear it by the Gotra! (groans again, more prominently this time.)

Din Djarin: Tatooine it is, then.

[ The Mandalorian begins to slowly walk away with the Child’s carriage in tow, leaving Gor Koresh hanging precariously from the old, grey street lamp. ]

Gor Koresh: Wait, Mando! You can’t leave me like this! Cut me down!

Din Djarin: That wasn’t part of the deal.

[ The Mandalorian turns around and shoots the street lamp, causing it to go out, and a shroud of darkness to fall upon the hanging, squirming, struggling body of Gor Koresh. ]

Gor Koresh: Wait, what? Wait, what are you doing? Mando! I can pay! Mando! Mando! (screams loudly.)

[ As the Mandalorian and the Child walk away, many ominous pairs of red eyes appear, surrounding Gor Koresh. He struggles more and begins screaming, as the Mandalorian walks into the camera. The main title comes onto the screen, followed by the chapter title (which is “Chapter Nine : The Marshal”.) We now cut to the Razor Crest flying into the planet of Tatooine. It flies through some canyons, and attracts the attention of a Tusken Raider who is mounted upon a Bantha. The Tusken Raider looks upwards at the ship as it passes, as the Bantha groans. The ship flies towards Mos Eisley Spaceport. Peli Motto, who is working on a podracer engine, glances up to the skies with an open mouth, as the Razor Crest lands in her hangar. She blows on a metal instrument and looks smugly upon it landing. Her pit droid crew pick up their tools, ready to work on the ship. The Mandalorian descends down from the ramp. ]

Peli Motto: Alright. (to pit droids) Hey, hey, hey! Sorry, gang. Come on! You know he doesn’t like droids!

Din Djarin: May as well let them have at it. The Crest needs a good once-over.

Peli Motto: Oh! So he likes droids now. Well, you heard him. Give it a once-over!

[ The pit droids walk up to the ship as the Mandalorian approaches Peli Motto. ]

Peli Motto: (chuckles) I guess a lot has changed since you were last in Mos...

[ She abruptly stops speaking as the Mandalorian reveals the Child, hanging in a pouch over his shoulder. Peli takes him out of the pouch, grinning. ]

Peli Motto: Oh! Thank the Force! This little thing has had me worried sick. Come here, you little womp rat. (chuckles) Looks like it remembers me. How much do you want for it? Just kidding. But not really. You know, if this thing ever divides or buds, I will gladly pay for the offspring. Hey!

[ She is distracted by the pit droids working on the Mandalorian’s ship, as one of them has let an air tube loose, causing a loud, unpleasant noise to emit from it. ]

Peli Motto: Oh, geez. Watch what you’re doing up there! He barely trusts your kind! What, you want to give all droids a bad name? Thank you!

[ One of the pit droids - the one who had messed up with the air tube - gets the tube sucked into its face, as the second one balances on top of the third one, examining the ship’s mechanics. ]

Din Djarin: I’m here on business. I need your help.

Peli Motto: Oh, then business you shall have. Care for me to watch this wrinkled critter while you seek out adventure?

Din Djarin: I’ve been quested to bring this one back to its kind.

Peli Motto: Oh, wow. (chuckles) I can’t help you there. I’ve never seen any like it. And trust me, I’ve seen all shapes and sizes in this town.

[ A Gonk (GNK) droid waddles around behind the two as they speak. ]

Din Djarin: A Mandalorian Armorer has set me on my path. If I can locate another of my kind, I can chart a path through the network of coverts.

Peli Motto: You’ve been the only Mando here for years from what I can tell.

Din Djarin: Where is Mos Pelgo? I’m told there’s one there.

Peli Motto: Oh. Boy, I haven’t heard that name in a while.

Din Djarin: It’s not on any of the maps.

Peli Motto: That’s ‘cause it was wiped out by bandits. Once the Empire fell, it was a free-for-all. I didn’t dare leave the city walls. Still don’t.

Din Djarin: Can you tell me where it used to be?

Peli Motto: Depends who’s asking. You want to see it? (now shouting quite loudly) R-five! Bring the map of Tatooine!

[ We pan over to see R5-D4, who slowly scoots over towards the two, beeping incessantly. One of his back head panels indicates that he once had a bad motivator that needed replaced. ]

Peli Motto: No, take your time. Seriously. You just can’t get good help anymore. I don’t even know who to complain to! Let’s go, let’s go. (scoffs) Waiting! Ok.

[ R5-D4 slowly, but surely, stops in front of them, projecting a yellow hologram map of Tatooine. Peli Motto walks over to it, and moves it around with her fingers, indicating certain locations as she speaks to the Mandalorian. ]

Peli Motto: This is a map of Tatooine before the war. You got Mos Eisley, Mos Espa, and up around this region, Mos Pelgo.

Din Djarin: I don’t see anything.

Peli Motto: Well, it’s there. Or at least it used to be. Not much to speak of. It’s an old mining settlement. They’re gonna see that big hunk o’ metal long before you land.

Din Djarin: You still have that speeder bike?

Peli Motto: Sure do. It’s a little rusty, but I got it.

[ We now cut to the Mandalorian riding throughout the sand dunes of Tatooine on the bike. The Child is on the side, sticking his head out in enjoyment of the rush of air, his ear flapping back like a dog’s would. The Mandalorian rides around a cliff, and we cut to him sitting around a campfire at night with a small group of Tusken Raiders, a bunch of Banthas standing around in the background of the shot. The group gesture with their hands to communicate, presumably telling stories to each other. We cut back to the daytime, as the Mandalorian rides throughout some more ridges, past a Bantha skeleton. A wide shot shows the vastness of the Tatooine desert, as his speeder approaches a very small settlement nestled in the middle of the vast, sandy landscape. As he slowly rides into town, he scares off a couple scurriers, who flee from the area. As he rides in, many villagers stare at him. Some are looking out of their doors, or out from their decks, and some are standing around doing various chores at the moisture-farming stations. The Mandalorian finally comes to a stop in front of a saloon, slowly getting up and walking inside. The Child looks up from his pouch as the Mandalorian leaves him and enters the small building. A Weequay bartender looks up to him from working on a drink mixture of some type. The Child slowly peeks around the corner of the door, watching as the Mandalorian approaches the proprietor. ]

Bartender: Can I help you?

Din Djarin: I’m looking for a Mandalorian.

Bartender: Well, we don’t get many visitors in these parts. Can you describe him?

Din Djarin: Someone who looks like me.

Bartender: Mmm...You mean the Marshal?

Din Djarin: Your Marshal wears Mandalorian armor?

Bartender: (grunts) See for yourself.

[ He gestures with his head over to the door of the saloon, where a figure is standing. The man is wearing the old, beaten-up helmet, torso-piece, wrist-cuffs, ankle-cuffs, kneepieces, jetpack, and other armor of a famed Tatooine-based bounty hunter - in other words, part of a set of Mandalorian armor. He slowly approaches the Mandalorian, his ankle-cuffs clicking. ]

Marshal: What brings you here, stranger?

Din Djarin: I’ve been searching for you for many parsecs.

Marshal: Well, now you found me. Weequay, two snorts of spotchka.

[ The Weequay bartender pulls out a flagon of blue liquid - a bottle adorned with a net-like rope, as well as two small cups. The Marshal grabs them and slowly walks over to a table in the seating area. ]

Marshal: Why don’t you join me for a drink?

[ He slowly sits down and removes his helmet, setting it upon the table. We pan up to reveal a smirking, middle-aged, grey-haired man. ]

Marshal: I’ve never met a real Mandalorian. (chuckles) Heard stories. I know you’re good at killing. And probably none too happy to see me wearing this hardware.

[ As he speaks, the Marshal pours the spotchka into the small cups, before eventually setting the flagon back on the table. The Child is cooing as it is examining and touching a spitoon. ]

Marshal: So...I figure only one of us is walking out of here. But then I see the little guy...and I think, maybe I pegged you wrong.

Din Djarin: Who are you?

Marshal: I’m Cobb Vanth, Marshal of Mos Pelgo.

Din Djarin: Where did you get the armor?

Cobb Vanth: Bought it off some Jawas.

Din Djarin: Hand it over.

Cobb Vanth: Look, pal, I’m sure you call the shots where you come from, but ‘round here, I’m the one tells folks what to do.

Din Djarin: Take it off. Or I will.

Cobb Vanth: We gonna do this in front o’ the kid?

[ The Child glances up from beside the spitoon, somewhat worriedly. ]

Din Djarin: He’s seen worse.

Cobb Vanth: Right here, then?

Din Djarin: Right here.

[ Cobb Vanth sighs and gets up, pushing his chair back. The two men wearing Mandalorian armor stare each other down for a while, in a tense moment. Their hands flit around their blaster holsters. The bartender watches with suspense. Suddenly, there is a loud rumbling sound. Cobb Vanth raises his finger to signal that he needs to check on it, and he and the Mandalorian exit the building, looking out onto the town, as the Child whimpers, and the Weequay bartender leaves from another exit. An alarm blares, a windmill gradually begins spinning faster, scurriers look up in alarm, a bantha groans, and citizens flee to the buildings. A large creature seems to be slithering through the sand towards the town center, making whooping noises. It reaches the town, and passes through it, down the center road, its back scales sticking up through the sand, as all the citizens look on. The creature approaches a tied-up Bantha, jumping out of the sand and consuming it, revealing the massive head of a Greater Krayt Dragon. It quickly flees. ]

Cobb Vanth: Maybe we can work something out.

[ The Child fearfully peeks out from inside the spitoon. As the Mandalorian and Vanth walk through the town in the wake of the Krayt Dragon, many villagers are seen repairing the buildings from the destruction of the beast - settling wooden planks down on the decks, hoisting up large tankards, and welding pieces of speeder bikes back together. ]

Cobb Vanth: That creature’s been terrorizing these parts since long before Mos Pelgo was established. Thanks to this armor, I’ve been able to protect this town from bandits and Sand People. They look to me to protect ‘em. But a Krayt Dragon is too much for me to take on alone. Help me kill it, I’ll give you the armor.

Din Djarin: Deal. I’ll ride back to the ship, blow it out of the sand from the sky, use the Bantha as bait.

Cobb Vanth: Not so simple. The ship passes above, it senses the vibrations, stays underground. But I know where it lives.

Din Djarin: How far?

Cobb Vanth: Not far.

[ We cut to the Mandalorian riding on his speeder bike through the Tatooine desert. Cobb Vanth comes up beside him on his speeder, which is the repurposed engine of a podracer. As they ride, Vanth begins a conversation. ]

Cobb Vanth: You don’t understand what it was like. The town was on its last legs. It started after we got news of the Death Star blowing up. The second one, that is.

[ Flashback with Cobb Vanth voiceover: People cheer at a hologram recording of the second Death Star blowing up, which repeats again and again. This is the saloon in Mos Pelgo, which is much more inhabited than we’ve previously seen it. Cobb Vanth and the Weequay bartender smile at each other, as a detachment of the Mining Collective marches in the doors. ]

Cobb Vanth (v/o): The Empire was pullin’ outta Tatooine. There was blaster fire over Mos Eisley. The occupation was over. We didn’t even have time to celebrate. That very night, the Mining Collective moved in.

[ Back to present. ]

Cobb Vanth: Power hates a vacuum, and Mos Pelgo became a slave camp overnight.

[ Back to flashback. The Mining Collective opens fire on the patrons in the saloon. Cobb Vanth ducks behind the bar, where the bartender is hiding as well, as people scream horribly in the background. ]

Cobb Vanth: Hey, you okay? Come on, let’s get you outta here. Let’s go!

[ Vanth grabs the bartender’s arm and safely gets him out of the building. ]

Cobb Vanth: Go! Go! Go! Go!

[ Vanth stumbles around the building as another fleeing man is shot by a member of the Mining Collective in the background. Before his adversary is able to see him, Vanth ducks behind the Mining Collective’s speeder. ]

Cobb Vanth (v/o): I lit out. Took what I could from the invaders. Grabbed a camtono. I had no idea it was full of silicax crystals.

[ During voiceover: Vanth looks out to see if any of the Mining Collective is nearby, before snatching up a camtono off the speeder and running away into the night. Back to present. ]

Cobb Vanth: I guess every once in a while, both suns shine on a womp rat’s tail.

[ Back to flashback. Cobb Vanth is stumbling through the desert, hardly able to stand. ]

Cobb Vanth (v/o): I wandered for days. No food, no water. And then...I was saved. The Jawas wanted the crystals. They offered their finest in exchange. And my treasure bought me more than a full waterskin. It bought my freedom.

[ During voiceover: Vanth finally stumbles and falls down into the sand, grumbling and panting. He is about to give up, before a shadow falls over him. He looks up to see a massive Sandcrawler, which quickly halts before him. Cut to him sitting amongst the chattering Jawas in the interior of the Sandcrawler, vigorously drinking a full canteen of water. The Jawas open the camtono full of the silicax crystals and gasp. They excitedly gather around the crystals, whispering and grabbing at them greedily. In exchange for the crystal, a Jawa comes over to Cobb Vanth and offers him a rifle. He declines. They then offer him a red, green, and white astromech droid. Vanth sighs as another Jawa offers him a protocol droid’s head. He glances up and sees the Mandalorian armor hanging on the wall, pointing to it. We cut to Cobb Vanth standing back in the town center of Mos Pelgo, adorned in the Mandalorian armor. He slowly walks into the saloon, and the Weequay bartender and members of the Mining Collective look to him in shock. The Mining Collective members seem to potentially recognize the armor from the past. They slowly lower their glasses and stand up from their seats. Vanth gestures with his head for the bartender to move out of the way. The bartender obliges, backing up. Suddenly, one of the Mining Collective members whips out a pistol sitting on the surface of the bar, but Vanth is too quick for him, pulling out his own gun as well. He quickly dispatches four adversaries, but another shoots him in the chestplate. He doubles back, but recovers quickly, shooting his assailant back. He walks out of the bar, as the Weequay bartender looks on in shock and awe. The Mining Collective run to their speeder, shouting “Go!” and “Let’s go!” in a panicked fashion. The speeder takes off, as Vanth pulls the targeting rangefinder down on the helmet, looking through it to the speeder. With that, he launches the rocket out of his jetpack, and it slowly flies over to the speeder, which it hits perfectly, blowing it up in a spectacular orange explosion. Vanth watches on as the smoke clears from it. Back to the present, Mando and Vanth continue to zoom through the desert on their speeders. We cut to them travelling through a rocky quarry, alongside some cliffs, quite slowly and cautiously. They hear the close-by growl/screech of something, and Vanth raises up his arm, motioning for the Mandalorian to stop. The two halt their speeders and jump off, whipping out their guns and taking defensive positions. The growls echo around the rocky, brown cliffs as Vanth nervously glances around the area. The growls and cries grow closer, and finally a Massif, a reptilian-doglike creature, walks out from behind a large rock. These dogs are often known to accompany Tusken Raiders. It opens its mouth wide and snarls, and the Mandalorian lowers his sniper rifle, while Vanth keys up to shoot the animal as more approach from the boulders. Soon a whole pack is approaching them, snarling loudly. Vanth stands his ground, keeping his gun steady. Suddenly, Mando calls out a Tusken cry, causing the creatures to immediately cease their hostile behavior. They look up to him as he walks forward towards them. ]

Cobb Vanth: What the hell you doin’?

[ The Mandalorian gestures for him to stay back and stay peaceful, and walks forward towards the vicious creatures, grunting in the Tusken language. Vanth slowly lowers his weapon, as the Mandalorian kneels down to pet an approaching Massif, who shakes in joy as the Mandalorian rubs them on the side. Vanth fully lowers his blaster pistol, as the Mandalorian continues petting the Massif under the chin. The two compatriots look up as a few Tusken Raiders come out from behind a rock. Vanth looks around nervously, as the Child peeks out from the sack he is in on the side of the Mandalorian’s speeder. The Mandalorian and the Tusken Raiders speak Tusken back and forth for a bit, using hand gestures as well. ]

Cobb Vanth: Hey, partner, you want to tell me what’s going on?

Din Djarin: They want to kill the Krayt Dragon, too.

[ We cut to the nightime in a Tusken Raider camp, where a Tusken is cleaning the teeth of a Bantha with a gaffi stick. We pan around the camp, and see many small tents set up. A Massif is following a Tusken Raider through the camp, as the Mandalorian and Cobb Vanth sit around a flickering campfire with several Tuskens, who are speaking to them in their Tusken language. As a Tusken stands up a higher rock and looks out, surveying the desert, while the Mandalorian speaks to the crowd around the fire in Tusken. The Child looks around, unsure about the conversation between the Mandalorian and the Tusken Raiders. A Massif looks at him and licks his lips, and the Child coos quite nervously. One of the Tuskens cracks open a black gourd, a type of fruit that plays an important role in Tusken society, with his thumbs, and hands it to Cobb Vanth. Black powder steams out of the top of it, as Vanth very reluctantly takes it. He smells it.

Cobb Vanth: What am I supposed to do with this?

Din Djarin: You drink it.

Cobb Vanth: It stinks.

Din Djarin: Do you want their help?

Cobb Vanth: Not if I have to drink this.

[ One of the Tuskens begins angrily shouting at Vanth. As the Mandalorian speaks, the Tusken continues angrily talking. ]

Din Djarin: He says your people steal their water and now you insult them by not drinking it. They know about Mos Pelgo. They know how many Sand People you killed.

Cobb Vanth: They raided our village. I defended the town.

Din Djarin: Lower your voice.

Cobb Vanth: I knew this was a bad idea.

[ The Tusken angrily stands up in a confrontational stance, screeching out even louder. ]

Din Djarin: You’re agitating them.

Cobb Vanth: These monsters can’t be reasoned with!

[ Vanth stands up himself to confront the Tusken. The Tusken continues arguing viciously in its native language, and Vanth quickly addresses it. ]

Cobb Vanth: Sit back down before I put a hole through you! I’m not going to say it-

[ Very suddenly, the Mandalorian activates his flamethrower, causing a spiral of flame to erupt next to the two arguing people. They both immediately cease their arguing, and the Mandalorian stands up. The Child looks at the fire from his seat on the ground, squinting his eyes. The Mandalorian turns off the flamethrower and both Vanth and the Tusken look at him in surprise. The Mandalorian quickly tells the Tusken Raider something in the Tusken language. ]

Cobb Vanth: What are you telling them?

Din Djarin: The same thing I’m telling you. If we fight amongst ourselves, the monster will kill us all.

[ The Tusken and Vanth slowly sit back down around the campfire. The Mandalorian addresses them both again, speaking in English, and gesturing in Tusken. ]

Din Djarin: Now, how do we kill it?

[ We cut to a single file line of Tusken Raiders riding atop Banthas in the Tatooine desert. It is now daytime. The Mandalorian and Vanth are accompanying them, riding on Banthas as well. The Child, hitched to the side of the Mandalorian’s Bantha in a tan pouch, looks out onto the Tatooine desert in awe. A group of six Banthas and their respective riders slowly walk atop a hill, and a canyon opens up below them. We cut to the view out of a set of macrobinoculars, watching a Tusken Raider slowly lead a Bantha on a rope towards the large cavern where the Krayt Dragon lives. Vanth, the Mandalorian, and the other three Tuskens are seen watching in suspense from the ridge above. One of the Tusken Raiders begins speaking to the Mandalorian in Tusken. He turns to Cobb Vanth to translate. ]

Din Djarin: They say it lives in there. They say it sleeps.

[ A Tusken Raider hands the Mandalorian the pair of macrobinoculars, which he looks through. He scans over the large opening on the side of the cliff. ]

Din Djarin: It lives in an abandoned Sarlacc pit.

Cobb Vanth: Lived on Tatooine my whole life. There’s no such thing as an abandoned Sarlacc pit.

Din Djarin: There is if you eat the Sarlacc.

[ Cobb Vanth looks confusedly towards the large pit, and the Mandalorian lowers the macrobinoculars, handing them back to one of the Tuskens. He continues to watch his fellow Tusken Raider lead the Bantha up to the large pit. ]

Din Djarin: They’re laying out a Bantha to protect the settlement. They’ve studied its digestive cycle for generations. They feed the dragon to make it sleep longer. Watch, the dragon will appear.

[ The Tusken hammers down a pole attached to Bantha’s rope into the ground. Vanth looks on, fascinated, as the Tusken calls out into the large cavern to get the Krayt Dragon’s attention. The Child looks on from the ridge as well, whimpering. The growling of the dragon is heard, and a low rumbling begins. Vanth looks up, incredibly alert, as the sand begins to give way as the beast travels out of its home. The Tusken turns around and runs as fast as it can away from the cavernous opening. The Krayt Dragon shoots out of the sand, missing the Bantha entirely, and swallowing up the poor Tusken Raider. The Child ducks behind the ridge, terrified. The Tusken with the macrobinoculars quickly lowers them in shock. The Krayt Dragon very quickly retreats back into the cave, leaving the Bantha alone by the entrance. ]

Din Djarin: They might be open to some new ideas.

[ The Child slowly raises his head, peeking back out from behind the cliffside. The Bantha at the cavernous opening groans a bit more. We cut to the Tusken Raiders back in their camp, speaking to each other in their language, and laying out a diorama with rock and bones to represent the Krayt Dragon and its cave, as well as the scale between the creature and the humanoids who intend to fight it. The model of the Krayt Dragon is far larger than the small stones that represent the others. ]

Cobb Vanth: What are the bones?

Din Djarin: That’s the Krayt Dragon.

Cobb Vanth: And those little rocks?

Din Djarin: That’s us.

Cobb Vanth: It’s not to scale.

Din Djarin: I think it is.

Cobb Vanth: Can’t be. That’s too big.

[ The Tuskens begin speaking to the Mandalorian, who speaks back to them for a moment, before turning back to Vanth. ]

Din Djarin: It’s to scale.

Cobb Vanth: I’ve only seen its head and neck. That’s a whole lot bigger than I guessed.

[ The Tuskens continue speaking amongst each other, clearly planning out a strategy to attack the Krayt Dragon in some way. ]

Cobb Vanth: Might be time to rethink our arrangement.

[ The Tuskens and the Mandalorian converse briefly, and the Mandalorian seems to suggest something. The Tuskens look at each other, and then one of them grabs another handful of rocks and sprinkles it around amongst the others in the model. ]

Cobb Vanth: That’s more like it. Where are they getting the reinforcements?

Din Djarin: I volunteered your village.

[ Vanth widens his eyes and looks a bit worried and confused. We cut to Vanth and The Mandalorian riding across the Tatooine desert again on their speeders. The pull back into the town center of Mos Pelgo. As they skid to a halt at the side of a building deck and Vanth dismounts his speeder, he begins another conversation. ]

Cobb Vanth: They attacked us less than a year ago. Killed half a dozen of us by the mining camp. I’d say I took down about twice as many Tuskens.

Din Djarin: The town respects you. My guess is, they’ll listen to reason.

Cobb Vanth: I wouldn’t be so sure.

[ The Mandalorian looks a bit contemplative as Vanth walks away, and then proceeds to get off his speeder and follow the Marshal into the saloon. Cut to the inside of the saloon, where the townspeople are gathered in the seating area. Vanth and the Mandalorian face them, standing right in front of the bar. Vanth addresses his citizens as they murmur amongst themselves. ]

Cobb Vanth: This here is a Mandalorian. You know what that means?

Bartender: Well, we’ve heard the stories.

Cobb Vanth: Then you know how good they are at killing. Now, this one’s got a problem. I got a suit o’ salvaged armor and the Mandalorian creed says it’s his to take.

[ The townspeople murmur in discontent. ]

Cobb Vanth: But I’ve got a problem, too. A Krayt Dragon has been peeling off our pack animals, and sometimes, taking our mining haul with it. It’s just a matter of time before it grows tired of Banthas and goes after a couple of you townsfolk, or even, so help us, the school.

[ At this assertion, the townsfolk murmur and chatter a bit more, shaking their heads at the implication that a Krayt Dragon could destroy their way of life even further than at present. ]

Cobb Vanth: As much as I’ve grown fond of the armor, I’m even more fond of this town. The Mandalorian is willing to help us slay the leviathan in exchange for returning the armor to its ancestral owners.

Bartender: Well, that settles it.

Cobb Vanth: There’s more. We can’t take on the Krayt alone. And the Sand People are willing to help.

[ Immediately, the crowd grows restless in protest of this. Some of them stand up and start shouting incredulously. ]

Male Townsperson: They raid our mines!

Bartender: They’re monsters!

Din Djarin: I’ve seen the size of that thing, it will swallow your entire town when the fancy hits it. You’re lucky Mos Pelgo isn’t a sand field already. I know these people. They are brutal. But so is the Dune Sea. They’ve survived for thousands of years in these sands and they know the Krayt Dragon better than anyone here. They are raiders, it’s true. But they also keep their word. We have struck a deal. If we are willing to leave them the carcass and its ichor, they will stand by our side in battle and vow never to raise a blaster against this town until one of you breaks the peace.

[ The townspeople contemplate this and slowly nod their heads, tap their fingers, and glance at each other, clearly coming to the realization that this is the best course of action to go with. We cut to the townspeople gathering supplies in a storage shed at the edge of town. The Mandalorian and Cobb Vanth stand in the entryway as people carry crates, boxes, and various other containers around them. ]

Cobb Vanth: Think it’ll work?

Din Djarin: It better. Joining forces is their only hope.

[ Some townspeople open a container and lift out some white explosive canisters of something, as the Mandalorian and Vanth walk outside to the deck. They look to their left to see a large, single file line of Tusken Raiders approaching on Banthas. The townspeople stand around and look in awe. One woman taps a younger man on the shoulder to get him to see this odd sight, and they look on, a bit frightened. Multiple Tuskens ride atop each Bantha, and they slowly approach the unsettled townsfolk of Mos Pelgo. They eventually come to a halt. We cut to the Tuskens helping the townspeople unload cargo and prepare for the journey ahead. One man hands a Tusken Raider an explosive canister of sorts. ]

Male Townsperson: Here. Grab this.

[ The townsperson keep handing the Tusken the white canisters, and they load them onto the side of a Bantha. The townsperson quite quickly hands the Tusken one, causing the Tusken to drop it onto the deck. The Mandalorian and Vanth look up, alert. ]

Male Townsperson: Hey, hey! What are you doin’? That’s an explosive! What, are you trying to blow the whole place up? What? Is that what you want?

[ The Tusken gets up in the townsperson’s face in a confrontational mode. Cobb Vanth quickly pushes past the Tusken and confronts the townsperson. ]

Cobb Vanth: Take it easy. It was an accident, okay?

Male Townsperson: What do you want to do?!

Cobb Vanth: It was an accident!

[ The townspeople and Tuskens continue to work together to load things up. Some male townspeople mumble things such as “Let’s go” and “It’s not gonna work out.” Cobb Vanth walks back over to the Mandalorian and looks at him, soon speaking in a sarcastic tone. ]

Cobb Vanth: It’s gonna be great.

[ We cut to a wide shot of the Banthas riding single file upon a sandy ridge in the Tatooine desert, Tuskens and townspeople mounted on their backs. Large expanses of desert stretch before the travellers as they slowly meander along. Cobb Vanth and the Mandalorian slowly ride their speeders alongside the Banthas. Several more wide shots of them travelling, before the line of Banthas finally approach the Krayt Dragon’s cavern. As they stop, a fair distance away from the cave, the Tuskens and townspeople dismount and chatter amongst themselves, running around in preparation. In a large crowd, everyone steps forward together towards the edge of a short ridge overlooking the cave, toolboxes and explosives on hand, watching as a single Tusken Raider steps towards the entrance of the den. The Tusken stops at the mouth of the cave, getting down on its knees and leaning its head towards the ground, and resting its hand on the sand. The Child gazes out of its pouch, nervous. After a moment, the Tusken looks up, and a low rumbling is heard from the cave. The Tusken turns back towards the crowd and signals something to them. ]

Cobb Vanth: What’d he say?

Din Djarin: He says it’s sleeping. If we listen carefully, we can hear it breathing.

[ A Tusken Raider hands Cobb Vanth another black gourd, which he begrudgingly accepts and takes a large drink from, sighing. ]

Din Djarin: Let’s get to work.

[ Tuskens begin running about and herding the Banthas around, townspeople carry small explosives. The Tuskens and townspeople work in unity, throwing ropes and weapons to each other to set up, showing that even very different, fighting cultures can become stronger together if they work to defeat something that plagues them both. ]

Din Djarin (v/o): The Tuskens say the belly is the only weak spot, so we have to hit it from below. First, we bury the charges at the opening of the cave. Then, we wake it up. We have to get it angry enough to charge. Once it’s far enough out, and the belly is above the explosives, you hit the detonator.

[ During voiceover: The townspeople hand white explosive canisters to each other, and begin to dig large trenches around the mouth of the cave. The Tusken Raiders set up large crossbow-like weapons in a line around the mouth of the cave to use against the creature. They turn wheels and pulleys, and position the large metal arrows so they are pointing in the direction of the cave. The workers continue to dig the trenches, lining them with the white explosive canisters. A townsperson powers up a detonator, readying it to be used at the push of a button. She slowly makes her way over to Cobb Vanth and the Mandalorian, who walk forward towards her. She hands the detonator to Vanth. ]

Jo: Careful, Marshal.

Cobb Vanth: Thank you, Jo. And you stay safe, huh.

[ Jo nods her head and walks back over to the other townspeople. Vanth and the Mandalorian walk forward, and look out on the line of Tuskens and townspeople facing along the mouth of the cave, with their weapons at the ready. It is eerily quiet as the workers stand along the mouth of the cave, and several Tuskens lead their Banthas away. Three Tusken Raiders walks straight forward, stopping right at the cavernous opening. They lean their weapons up against their sides, and put their hands to their mouths, screeching out into the large cave to wake the Krayt Dragon. The beast’s growling can soon be heard, and the Tuskens quickly turn and run back to the line of defenses. The aspect ratio changes to fit the entire screen, as the Krayt Dragon slowly reveals itself, shooting out of the sand, its mouth open and wide. Cobb Vanth looks petrified, coming to the realization of just how dangerous this could be. The Tusken Raiders yell and shoot the arrows from the crossbow-devices, however it barely affects the large beast. Two of the three Tuskens who summoned it reach the line of defenses, as the other trips, causing the Krayt Dragon to bite down on it, swallowing it. The Mandalorian looks through his spyglass, as the creature begins backing up into its cave. ]

Din Djarin: Dank farrik, it’s going back in.

[ Some of the Tusken Raiders frantically hold onto the ropes that are attached to the metal arrows that have been shot into the dragon’s head, however this merely pulls them along the sand towards the beast, and some of the arrows soon come loose. Many Tuskens run forward to save their brothers, as a few townspeople shoot at the Krayt Dragon, to no avail. ]

Din Djarin: It’s retreating.

[ Cobb Vanth looks down at the detonator in his hands. ]

Cobb Vanth: I’m going to hit it.

Din Djarin: No, wait. We only have one shot. We’ve gotta get it out.

[ The townspeople begin throwing small grenades at the Krayt Dragon to try and get it further out of the cave. The Weequay bartender shoots a rifle at it. Some Tuskens begin shooting as well, and the creature finally begins moving towards them again. The townspeople and Tuskens continue their barrage of shooting and grenade-throwing, to the extent that the massive Krayt Dragon opens its jaw very wide and charges right towards them with a new anger. People scream and run as it screeches, and shoves its head into the sand, missing the targeted townspeople it was going for. ]

Cobb Vanth: Now?

Din Djarin: Not yet. It’s gotta come out further.

[ The Mandalorian continues looking through his spyglass-like object, as the Tuskens shoot off more of the grappling-hook crossbows, holding tight onto the ropes and coaxing the dragon a bit more towards them. The giant beast roars and lifts its head, causing Tuskens to fly into the air. The Weequay bartender looks up at it in utter fear, as it roars loudly. The townspeople and Tuskens begin turning and retreating, as the Krayt Dragon suddenly begins spitting its green, slimy venom at them, inflicting very heavy casualties. It dives forward towards them, slamming its head into the sand again and closing its mouth. ]

Din Djarin: Almost, almost. Now!

[ Vanth clicks the detonator, and the explosives go off underneath the Krayt Dragon, causing it to roar out in pain. The townspeople and Tuskens fall backwards the duck for cover of flying sand. Vanth and the Mandalorian flinch, and the Child looks on, squinting at the explosion. The workers duck and cover their eyes, as the particles blow at them, and the dragon sinks down into the desert sand. They begin to look up again, as it becomes quieter, and help each other up. They slowly approach the place where the beast disappeared with curiosity. ]

Cobb Vanth: I don’t think it’s dead.

Din Djarin: Me either.

[ As the workers look around, a low rumbling is heard, and everyone looks up to the cliff face above the cavern. The Krayt Dragon bursts through the rock, roaring viciously, and begins shooting its venom down from its gaping maw, high above its attackers, again inflicting heavy casualties of Tuskens and townspeople. ]

Cobb Vanth: It’s picking us off like womp rats. Let’s get after it.

[ Vanth and the Mandalorian grab their rifles as the Child looks on from his pouch. Vanth puts his helmet on the two men in Mandalorian armor use their jetpacks to fly up towards the dragon. The Child angles its head upwards, looking curiously at them. They fly high into the sky, and land on the rocky ridge next to the Krayt Dragon, right beside its head. They ready their guns, and point them at the creature, shooting near its eye, which does absolutely nothing. ]

Cobb Vanth: This ain’t doing a thing!

Din Djarin: Just keep shooting.

[ They finally get the Krayt Dragon’s attention, and it turns its head towards them, opening its mouth wide. They fly away to safety just before the creature bites down on the rock they had landed on. Flying back to the ground, they get in defensive positions, pointing their guns towards the dragon on the ridge. The creature retreats back down into the rock face, and everyone looks on in suspense. Some of the Tuskens lower their rifles. An ominous cloud of grey dust travels down the rocky ridge-like hill, and the Krayt Dragon suddenly bursts out of the sand behind them. The Mandalorian and Vanth swiftly turn around, and the dragon glides through the sand towards them and their allies. ]

Din Djarin: There he is.

[ The dragon continues to burst through the sand, consuming a few townspeople and Tuskens. The Mandalorian looks over to a whining Bantha with a large amount of the white explosive canisters hitched to its side, and seemingly has an idea. ]

Din Djarin: I’ve got an idea. Get its attention.

[ Vanth obliges, swiftly using his targeting rangefinder to shoot his back rocket towards the beast, hitting it in the head and causing a large explosion. The Krayt Dragon screeches in pain, and angrily turns its head towards Vanth and the Mandalorian. Tuskens and townspeople yell “Go!” and “Run!”, scrambling off away from their large attacker. ]

Cobb Vanth: I got its attention! Now what?

Din Djarin: You still have that detonator?

[ Vanth quickly grabs the detonator and hands it to the Mandalorian, frantic to kill the beast. ]

Cobb Vanth: Take it! What’s the plan?

Din Djarin: You’re gonna take care of the Child.

Cobb Vanth: What are you gonna do?

Din Djarin: I don’t know, but wish me luck.

[ With that, the Mandalorian slams the back of his rifle into Vanth’s jetpack, causing Vanth to fly into the air in order to stay safe from the beast. The Mandalorian activates something on the detonator, causing the explosives on the Bantha to activate. As the Banthas moans, the Krayt Dragon swallows another Tusken Raider and moves straight towards the Mandalorian. The stake for the Bantha shoots out of the ground, and the Mandalorian scrambles to grab it again. ]

Din Djarin: No! No, no, no! Hold on! Hold on! Whoa, whoa, whoa!

[ He successfully secures the Bantha and turns back towards the Krayt Dragon. The beast charges right at him and opens its mouth wide, diving towards him and swallowing both him and the Bantha whole. It disappears into the sand, as the remaining Tusken Raiders and townspeople look on in shock. Vanth is able to secure his malfunctioned jetpack and land on the ground, his targeting rangefinder having been flicked down by accident in the chaos. It quickly flips itself up, and he begins panting. A few Tuskens slowly approach the place where the dragon leapt into the sand, and Vanth removes his helmet, looking on in shock. The Child whines from his pouch. Many of the townspeople start putting down their weapons. Suddenly, another loud rumbling is heard, and everyone looks around unsurely. The Krayt Dragon bursts out of the sand again, opening its mouth, out of which flies the Mandalorian, who had shocked the inside of its mouth with his rifle to let him out. With the Bantha still inside of the beast, he clicks the detonator, which causes a massive explosion from inside of the Krayt Dragon. Tuskens and townspeople duck and cover, as a shockwave shoots out in all directions. The foul creature screeches its loud, whooping call one last time, and falls into its wreckages. The Mandalorian lands and turns to see the fallen creature, his armor dripping with its venom. Cobb Vanth looks on and smiles, chuckling slightly, and getting up, along with the remaining townspeople and Tusken Raiders. Everyone begins cheering, and lifting up their weapons. ]

Bartender: Yeah!

[ Townspeople and Tuskens pat each other on the back, and Vanth smiles at the Mandalorian, grateful for his help. We cut to when the dust around the carcass has cleared. Half of the dragon’s innards are exposed, its ribs and meat sticking out of the sand. The Tuskens harvest the meat with their gaffi sticks and other tools. The Child examines a piece of Krayt Dragon meat that the Mandalorian had put onto the speeder. The Mandalorian covers it with a sheet, and turns to Cobb Vanth, who is approaching, holding his armor. He hands it over to the Mandalorian gratefully. ]

Din Djarin: Sorry, I didn’t have time to explain.

Cobb Vanth: No need. This was well-earned.

Din Djarin: It was my pleasure.

[ The Mandalorian and Cobb Vanth shake hands firmly. ]

Cobb Vanth: I hope our paths cross again.

Din Djarin: As do I.

Cobb Vanth: Oh, and you tell your people I wasn’t the one that broke that.

[ Vanth walks away over to his townspeople, and the Mandalorian slowly nods, with the Child cooing beside him. One of the Tusken Raiders, digging through the meat of the Krayt Dragon, discovers a large Krayt Dragon pearl, which is a prized treasure on Tatooine. He lifts it into the air to show the others of his kind, and they all begin cheering in triumph, lifting their weapons in the air in sheer celebration. The Mandalorian mounts his speeder and takes off from the area, the aspect ratio slowly changing back to normal size as he rides through the desert. It is dusk, and the twin suns are setting. As he rides, a bald figure in a black cloak watches him from a ridge - a rifle and a gaffi stick attached to his back. He slowly turns around and walks towards and past the camera, revealing a damaged and scarred face that looks a bit familiar. Cut to black, and the credits start to roll. ]




Ep 10 - The Passenger

[ We open with the sandy Tatooine desert on a wide shot. It seems to be morning, and the Mandalorian is shooting across the desert on his speeder, returning from his Mos Pelgo visit. The Child, hitched onto the side in his little tan pouch, squints as sand particles fly into his face. Meanwhile, close by, a Nikto is hammering a metal spike into some rock. He turns and looks over his shoulder, alert. Another of his accomplices - a human - looks up as well. The Nikto hears the roaring of the Mandalorian’s speeder, approaching the rock gully where he and his accomplices are laying out their trap, and looks back down, continuing to hammer in the spike. The old Mandalorian helmet that was given to Mando by Cobb Vanth bounces slightly on the side of his speeder, as the Mandalorian approaches the rock gully. He accelerates even more, going quite fast now. The Nikto and his accomplices loop a rope around the metal spike, and bury the rest of the rope in the sand. A metal rod is cranked down. The Mandalorian is nearly upon them now, and just before he passes them, the human pulls up the rope, causing it to block the Mandalorian’s path. He flies off of his speeder, the Child and the damaged Mandalorian helmet of Vanth’s rolling onto the ground. Quickly activating his jetpack, the Mandalorian stumbles and lands, as his speeder blows up, utterly destroyed. The bounty hunters reveal themselves and begin shooting the Mandalorian in his beskar armor. The Child sits helpless in the sand. ]

Human Bounty Hunter: Get the Child!

[ A small alien with a metallic-looking face, speaks something in his alien language and nods, as the Nikto and human approach the Mandalorian, shooting him. Another burly human comes from the rocks behind him and runs towards him with a metal rod. The small alien draws his small gun, and just before the burly human is able to hit the Mandalorian’s pistol out of his hand, the Mandalorian shoots the small alien, blowing him back, but not hurting him too badly. The burly human swings at the Mandalorian, hitting the rock and he dodges the vicious attacks. The small alien gets up and limps behind some short rocks, pulling open the case to a much larger gun - seemingly a rifle of some sort. The Mandalorian and the burly human continue to brawl, but the Mandalorian slices him in the neck and chest area, incapacitating him. Very quickly, the other human and the Nikto approach him. The small alien comes out of the rocks with the large gun, as the Mandalorian tussles with the other two. The small alien activates the rifle and points it at the three tussling people, and the Mandalorian grapples out the hook on his wrist, pulling the rifle out of the small alien’s hands and towards him. It slams into the heads of his two larger attackers, knocking them out, and to the sandy ground, as the Mandalorian ducks. He stumbles forward, but looks to see that the small alien has the Child in his arms, holding a knife to him. ]

Din Djarin: Wait! Don’t hurt the Child. If you put one mark on him, there’s no place you will be able to hide from me. We can strike a bargain. There’s a lot of value in this wreckage. Take your pick.

[ The Child coos, as the small alien looks around and contemplates this. The alien looks over and notices the Mandalorian helmet lying in the sand. ]

Din Djarin: But leave the Child.

[ The small alien gestures upwards, pointing his knife to the Mandalorian and saying something in his odd alien dialect. He gestures for the Mandalorian to put something on the ground. The Mandalorian grabs his jetpack and pulls it off his back. ]

Din Djarin: Okay. Here. It’s yours.

[ He slowly and cautiously sets the jetpack on the ground, stepping back. ]

Din Djarin: Take it.

[ The small alien points his knife towards the Mandalorian, gesturing for him to back up more. ]

Din Djarin: It’s okay.

[ The small alien finally sets the child down next to the jetpack, and picks the large metal device up, saying something to the Mandalorian in his alien language, and quickly running off into the desert with the jetpack. The Child runs to the Mandalorian, whimpering, and the Mandalorian goes down and picks him up, nestling him in his arms. ]

Din Djarin: You okay?

[ The Child coos in what is seemingly some sort of a response. The Mandalorian turns back to the small alien running away with his jetpack, and clicks some buttons on his wrist panel. The jetpack activates and shoots up, with the alien screaming out in surprise. He clicks the buttons a few more times, and the alien eventually falls from a great height into the sand, dead. A cloud of sand puffs up from the impact of his body. The Child slowly turns his head and looks up at the Mandalorian, snorting. The Mandalorian shrugs his shoulders and turns his head, pressing a few more things on his wrist panel. The jetpack slowly lowers itself out of the sky and lands in the sand, falling over onto its back with a clunk. The Mandalorian averts his eyes from the jetpack and looks up towards the wreckages of his speeder, the green, slimy Krayt Dragon acid still visible, dried on his helmet. The main title comes onto the screen, followed by the chapter title (which is “Chapter Ten : The Passenger”.) We cut to the Mandalorian travelling in the Tatooine desert, heat waves distorting the shots. He is carrying a large pack on his back, holding up his rifle with both hands as multiple bags and different things hang off of it. He walks along a ridge, and looks towards Mos Eisley Spaceport on the horizon. We cut to him at night, walking through the streets of Mos Eisley. The Child, nestled in his pouch on the side of the Mandalorian, chirps and coos, as strange aliens and vagabonds walk around them, and ships take off into the night sky from hangars across the city. The Mandalorian passes two Jawas arguing over a metal tube and enters the Mos Eisley Cantina. As denizens chatter, he walks to a booth at the back where Peli Motto is playing Sabacc with an insectoid creature. The Mandalorian approaches the booth and stops, Motto still focused on the game. ]

Peli Motto: I don’t know. Looks like someone’s gonna be goin’ home empty-handed.

[ The creature and Motto both stop and look over at the Mandalorian, and Motto notices the old Mandalorian helmet hanging from his traveling pack. ]

Peli Motto: You finally found a Mandalorian and you killed him?

Din Djarin: He wasn’t Mandalorian. I bought this armor off of him, though.

Peli Motto: What’d that set you back?

Din Djarin: Killed the Krayt Dragon for him.

Peli Motto: Oh. Is that all?

Din Djarin: He was my last lead on finding other Mandalorians.

[ The insectoid creature begins speaking to Motto in his alien language, to which she nods her head. She turns to the Mandalorian. ]

Peli Motto: Okay. Well, you might be in luck. Dr. Mandible here says he can connect you with someone who can help you, if you cover his call this round. It’s what he said.

Din Djarin: What’s the bet?

Peli Motto: Five hundred.

Din Djarin: That’s a high-stakes game.

Peli Motto: Hey, he’s on a hot streak.

[ The child coos, as Dr. Mandible says something else in his language. The Mandalorian sighs, grabbing some credits and throwing them on the table. ]

Peli Motto: Is the pot right?

[ Dr. Mandible says something in his language, and Peli Motto reveals her cards on the table - an Idiot’s Array. ]

Peli Motto: Ha! Idiot’s Array! Pay up, thorax!

[ Dr. Mandible speaks in his alien language, as Motto takes her winnings. ]

Din Djarin: I thought you said he was on a hot streak?

Peli Motto: Oh. Stop your cryin’. You’ll rust.

[ Dr. Mandible says something else to Motto, which she translates for the Mandalorian. ]

Peli Motto: All right. He says the contact will rendezvous at the hangar.

[ Dr. Mandible says something else. ]

Peli Motto: They’ll tell you where to find some Mandalorians. That’s what you wanted, right? All right, well, stop your mopin’. More importantly, did you bring back any of that dragon meat? Better not have any maggots on it. I don’t like maggots.

[ As the Mandalorian and Peli Motto walk away, followed by R5-D4, Dr. Mandible shakes his head at Motto’s comment. We cut to the Child watching the chunk of Krayt Dragon meat being cooked. The chunk of meat is beating heated intensely by a podracer engine in Motto’s hangar, dripping of juices, and it is held up by a Treadwell droid. The Child coos in excitement as he watches it cook. The Mandalorian and Pit Droids watch, as Peli Motto walks through the door, causing the Treadwell droid’s head to turn. ]

Peli Motto: Hey, don’t overcook it, Treadwell! I like it medium rare! I’m not some Rodian, for crying out loud.

[ Motto sighs, turning and addressing the Mandalorian, as a Gonk (GNK) droid meanders around behind them. ]

Peli Motto: All right, here’s the deal. A Mandalorian covert is close. It’s in this sector, one system trailing.

Din Djarin: Are they the ones that left Nevarro?

Peli Motto: Don’t know. All I know is that the contact will lead you to them.

Din Djarin: How much will it cost me?

Peli Motto: Well, that’s the great news. It’s free. Aside from a finder’s fee, of course.

Din Djarin: What’s the not-great news?

Peli Motto: Nothing. It’s all great.

Din Djarin: Okay.

[ The Mandalorian turns to leave, before Motto speaks up again. ]

Peli Motto: However, there is one small skank in the scud pie.

Din Djarin: Which is?

Peli Motto: The contact wants passage to the system.

Din Djarin: Do you vouch for them?

Peli Motto: On my life.

Din Djarin: Fine.

[ The Mandalorian again turns to leave, but Motto begins talking once more. ]

Peli Motto: And...no hyperdrive.

Din Djarin: You want me to travel sublight? Deal’s off.

Peli Motto: It’s one sector over.

Din Djarin: Moving fast is the only thing keeping me safe.

Peli Motto: These are mitigating circumstances.

Din Djarin: What do you mean “mitigating”?

[ Motto turns around, as a Frog Lady walks through the door to the hangar, croaking a bit. She is holding a pack on her back, which is a tank of many orange eggs. She croaks as she walks over to the two having a conversation. The Mandalorian puts his hands on his hips. ]

Din Djarin: I’m not a taxi service.

Peli Motto: I know, I know, I hear you. But I can vouch for her.

[ The Frog Lady comes up and stands next to Motto, speaking in her Frog language. The Child looks curiously at the eggs on her back in the blue tank. ]

Din Djarin: What’s the cargo?

[ Peli Motto asks the Frog Lady in her native language, to which the Frog Lady responds. Motto translates for the Mandalorian. ]

Peli Motto: It’s her spawn. She needs her eggs fertilized by the equinox or her line will end. If you jump into hyperspace, they’ll die. She said her husband has settled on the estuary moon of Trask in the system of the gas giant Kol Iben.

Din Djarin: She said all that?

Peli Motto: I paraphrased.

Din Djarin: Is she sure there are Mandalorians there?

[ Motto asks the Frog Lady, who responds in her language, and then turns back to the Mandalorian. ]

Peli Motto: She said her husband has seen them.

[ As the Frog Lady speaks in her language a bit more, the Child stares intently at the egg pack mounted on her back, cooing curiously. The Frog Lady turns and walks towards the Razor Crest, croaking a bit more. ]

Din Djarin: Do you know the husband?

Peli Motto: No. I just met her ten minutes before you walked in.

[ A Pit Droid walks up to Motto with a plate of Krayt Dragon meat. ]

Din Djarin: I thought you said you vouched for her on your life.

[ Peli Motto grabs a piece of the meat off the plate and takes a large bite, chomping into it. ]

Peli Motto: What can I say? I’m an excellent judge of character.

[ We cut to the Razor Crest flying through space, away from Tatooine. The Mandalorian is adjusting a few things in the cockpit of the ship. He addresses the Frog Lady. ]

Din Djarin: Now, I’m gonna ask you to stay strapped in whenever you’re seated. Traveling sublight is a bit dicey these days. Whether it’s pirates or warlords, someone either ends up with a nice chunk of change, or your ship.

[ The Frog Lady says something in her language. ]

Din Djarin: I don’t speak whatever language that is. You speak...Huttese?

[ The Mandalorian says something in Huttese (Mahala to havaka?), but the Frog Lady continues to stare at him, seemingly clueless. The Mandalorian turns away from her and flicks a switch, sighing. We cut to the Child peeking around a corner of the interior of the ship, looking towards the canister of eggs sitting on the floor. He coos as he walks slowly towards it, going up to it and looking into it, pressing his face and hands up against the glass. He quickly turns around to see if anyone is nearby, looking at the ladder up to the cockpit, and once he sees that no one is there, he turns back to the eggs, cooing as he puts his right hand on the glass, pulling the eggs around with the force closer to him. In the cockpit, the Mandalorian’s data pad shows the course, setting it on auto-pilot. The Mandalorian flicks a few more switches. ]

Din Djarin: So, I’m gonna hit the rack. I’ve set the nav for our course. It’s gonna take a while. I recommend you get some rest.

[ The Mandalorian gets up and walks out of the cockpit, the shiny grey door sliding open for him. The Frog Lady looks up to him as he exits, and then turns her head when he leaves, croaking. The Mandalorian swiftly slides/jumps down the ladder, and into the bottom part of the ship. He opens the sleeping rack to see that the Child is not there. ]

Din Djarin: Kid?

[ Slurping is heard as the Mandalorian turns around to find the Child with the egg container, the lid open. The Child is lifting an egg out of the gooey liquid. The Mandalorian quickly runs towards him. ]

Din Djarin: No, no, no, no, no!

[ The Child slurps the egg down before the Mandalorian can do anything about it, and quickly flips the lid closed, picking the Child up and facing him. ]

Din Djarin: That is not food. Don’t do that again.

[ The Child burps, and the Mandalorian turns to go over to the sleeping rack. ]

Din Djarin: Nap time.

[ The Mandalorian sets the Child in the small hammock-like pouch at the top of the rack, and the Child coos. The Mandalorian crawls in underneath him to sleep as well, closing the door. We briefly fade to black. Suddenly, beeping is heard, and we cut back to the door of the sleeping rack, which quickly zooms open as the Mandalorian crawls out. He swiftly climbs the ladder up to the cockpit, as some red lights flash around him. The door to the cockpit opens and he walks through, swiftly pushing his chair around so he can easily sit in it, and sitting down. The Frog Lady is sleeping in one of the passenger seats. He flicks a comm on, and the voice of an X-Wing pilot comes through it. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): Razor Crest, M-One Eleven. Come in, Razor Crest. Do you copy?

[ Two X-Wings are shown flying up to the ship, cruising along with it, one on each side. As the Frog Lady lightly snores in the background, the Mandalorian hesitantly speaks to the pilot. ]

Din Djarin: This is Razor Crest. Is there a problem?

Captain Carson Teva (comm): We noticed your transponder is not emitting.

Din Djarin: Yes, I’m pre-Empire surplus. I’m not required to run a beacon.

Captain Carson Teva (comm): That was before. This sector is under New Republic jurisdiction. All craft are required to run a beacon.

Din Djarin: Thank you for letting me know. I’ll get right on it.

Captain Carson Teva (comm): Not a problem. Safe travels.

Din Djarin: May the Force be with you.

Captain Carson Teva (comm): And also with you.

[ The Mandalorian sits quietly for a moment in the cockpit, before the pilot speaks again. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): Just one more thing.

Din Djarin: Yes?

Captain Carson Teva (comm): I’m gonna need you to send us a ping. We’re out here sweeping for Imperial holdouts.

Din Djarin: I’ll let you know if I see any.

Captain Carson Teva (comm): I’m still gonna need you to send us that ping.

Din Djarin: Well, I’m not sure I have that hardware online.

Captain Carson Teva (comm): We can wait.

[ The Mandalorian seems to be contemplating what to do. ]

Din Djarin: Yeah...I...I...doesn’t seem to be, uh, working.

Captain Carson Teva (comm): That’s too bad. If we can’t confirm you’re not Imperial, you’re gonna have to follow us to the outpost at Adelphi. They’ll run your tabs.

Din Djarin: Oh, wait. There it is. Transmitting now.

[ The Mandalorian flips the auto-pilot switch off, and the Frog Lady wakes up with a start, croaking loudly. ]

Din Djarin: (quietly) Be quiet!

Captain Carson Teva (comm): What’s that?

Din Djarin: Uh, nothing. The hypervac is drawing off the exhaust manifold.

[ The Frog Lady continues making some noise, prompting the Mandalorian to turn his head to her in annoyance. The other X-Wing pilot’s voice soon comes through the comm as the Frog Lady ceases her noise-making. ]

Trapper Wolf (comm): Carson, can you switch over to channel two?

Captain Carson Teva (comm): Copy.

[ The Mandalorian looks on as the two X-Wings set and lock their S-foils in attack position. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): Was your craft in the proximity of New Republic Correctional Transport, Bothan-Five?

[ The Mandalorian pauses for a moment, before hitting the accelerator and zooming off, away from the X-Wings. The Frog Lady is abruptly startled, and begins screaming in fear. We see the cockpit of Trapper Wolf. ]

Trapper Wolf: We got a runner.

[ Cut to the cockpit of Captain Carson Teva. ]

Captain Carson Teva: I’m on it.

[ The two X-Wings quickly zoom after the Razor Crest, which flies swiftly down to the nearby ice and glacier planet of Maldo Kreis. The Mandalorian’s ship just above the billowing clouds of the planet, pursued very quickly by the New Republic ships. The Razor Crest’s cockpit is shaking about, and the Frog Lady croaks a bit with anxiety. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): Razor Crest, stand down. We will fire. I repeat, we will fire.

[ The Razor Crest continues to zoom around the clouds, evading them. Cut to a view from Trapper Wolf’s X-Wing cockpit as he pursues the old ship. ]

Trapper Wolf: I don’t know where he thinks he’s goin’ in that thing.

[ The Mandalorian very suddenly pulls sharply around another corner of clouds. We cut back to Trapper Wolf’s cockpit view. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): That thing’s gonna break apart in this atmosphere.

[ The Mandalorian flips his ship around, and turns the power off of the engines, so the ship begins falling. The Frog Lady begins to scream loudly, very frightened at what’s going on, as the ship falls straight down. The ship continues tumbling down, and the Frog Lady continues screaming as it falls through the clouds. As the glacier-like surface of Maldo Kreis reveals itself, the Mandalorian puts his ship back into gear and begins flying down into an ice canyon. The X-Wings still trail after him. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): He’s headin’ down into that canyon.

[ We cut to Teva’s cockpit, where his targeting computer is lining up with the Razor Crest. ]

Captain Carson Teva: I got ‘im. Target computer active.

[ The Razor Crest continues to fly throughout the perilous ice canyon, where jagged spikes of ice stick up everywhere, the X-Wings still hot on its tail. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): Come on, Razor Crest, don’t make us do it.

[ The Mandalorian stays relentless, flying the Razor Crest around a bend and straight towards a narrow ice cavern on the side of a glacier. He grunts as he smashes the back end of his ship against the side of the glacier, zipping into the ice cavern. The two X-Wings pass him by, seemingly not noticing. Breathing heavily, the Mandalorian attempts to navigate through the icy caves. He turns to the Frog Lady. ]

Din Djarin: Hold on.

[ The Frog Lady grunts and croaks loudly in response. The Mandalorian smashes the sides of his ship up against some more glaciers, and the Razor Crest begins sliding uncontrollably along a large sheet of ice. It shoots up, and the Mandalorian activates its engines, however it hits the ice again, flying back under a small glacial overhang. The Mandalorian pants in relief as his ship stops, and settles down to a halt at last. The X-Wings pass by in the distance, not noticing him. His comm turns on, and Captain Carson Teva is speaking, however he is cutting out greatly. ]

Captain Carson Teva (comm): I’ve lost visual. He’s got to be around here somewhere. You head north. We’ll cover more ground.

[ The Frog Lady begins gasping and groaning, as the Mandalorian flicks a few switches off and on. The Frog Lady gets out of her seat straps, but only just before the ice underneath the Razor Crest begins to crack and break. Before the Mandalorian can do anything, the Razor Crest falls through the ice, the boxes and crates inside, including the canister of orange eggs, slide around and fall throughout the bulk of the ship. The Frog Lady screams as they fall, and the Razor Crest quickly lands in a small ice cavern, on a patch of snow, with a large thud. The Mandalorian is thrown forwards, up against the control consoles. The ship is clearly damaged - mostly covered in ice and snow, with electrical sparks going off on it. Shrouds of snow continue to fall from the recently-made hole, covering the ship. We cut to black, and then back to some time later - presumably a couple hours. The Mandalorian is still knocked out at the control console, and flecks of ice and snow cover his beskar armor. He wakes up and slowly sits up, grunting and groaning. He flicks a few switches in the cockpit, but to no avail. The Frog Lady is groaning on the floor, shivering from the cold. The Mandalorian quickly gets out of his seat and helps her up, as she is croaking at him in distress. ]

Din Djarin: I’ll find your eggs, don’t worry.

[ The Frog Lady continues to whimper nervously. ]

Din Djarin: Gotta get you some blankets, keep you warm.

[ The Mandalorian walks through the sliding doors of the cockpit, and jumps down the ladder. A large hole has been broken through on the side of the ship, through which a draft of cold, icy air is blowing snow flecks into the main cargo area. Electrical sparks emit around the bulk of the ship, and all of the crates of the Mandalorian’s cargo have coats of ice and snow on them. The Mandalorian looks at this in disbelief. ]

Din Djarin: Damn it.

[ The Mandalorian turns around and opens the sleeping rack, to find the Child not there. ]

Din Djarin: Where are you?

[ The Frog Lady croaks in distress from up in the cockpit. The Mandalorian turns up to her and yells in response. ]

Din Djarin: Hang on, I’m looking for your eggs!

[ The Mandalorian walks throughout his ship, carefully stepping over his crates and cargo. He pushes a few ropes aside and hears an odd noise coming from beneath a thick piece of cloth. He swiftly pulls it back, to reveal the Child, who has opened the egg canister again, and has one in his hand. The Child looks up to the Mandalorian. ]

Din Djarin: No! No...I told you not to do that.

[ The Mandalorian swiftly picks up the canister, closing it, as he’s speaking. He looks at the canister, as the Frog Lady is seen yelling down from the cockpit. The Mandalorian turns his head to her general direction. ]

Din Djarin: Found them!

[ The Mandalorian looks back down to the Child again, who slurps up one of the eggs, and then stares back at his guardian. ]

Din Djarin: How many did you eat?

[ The child gulps, swallowing the rest of the recently-eaten egg, and then burps. We cut to the Mandalorian working on a few things in the hull of the ship. The Frog Lady is there too, with her eggs, and huddled under some blankets. The Mandalorian turns back to her. ]

Din Djarin: If you hadn’t guessed, we’re in a tight spot.

[ The Frog Lady uses her tongue to eat something out of a metal canister. ]

Din Djarin: The main power drive is not responding, and the hull has lost its integrity. I suspect the temperature will drop significantly when night falls.

[ The Child, a small box of food in his hands, looks back up to the egg canister with longing. ]

Din Djarin: I’ll have a better idea of our prospects at that time.

[ The Mandalorian sits down and rests himself up against the wall of the ship. The Frog Lady turns to him, speaking in her own, difficult to understand, language. She gestures to her eggs, trying to tell the Mandalorian something, however he clearly cannot understand her. He shakes his head lightly at her speaking. ]

Din Djarin: I’m sorry, lady. I don’t understand Frog. Whatever it is, it can wait until morning. I recommend you get some sleep.

[ The Mandalorian crosses his arms and leans down, slumping up against the wall, as the Frog Lady whimpers and pulls her blanket off, looking at her eggs in worry. The Child crawls up to the Mandalorian and climbs up onto his thigh to sleep as well. The Frog Lady covers her egg canister with the blanket, patting it protectively.
