She looks up to the disassembled droid, Q9-0, who is mounted on the Mandalorian’s wall. The Frog Lady grunts and croaks a bit, and we cut to the Mandalorian sleeping against the wall a little while later. ]

Frog Lady (through Q9-0): Wake up, Mandalorian.

[ The Mandalorian swiftly draws his gun towards the droid. ]

Frog Lady (through Q9-0): This cannot wait until morning. Do not be alarmed. I bypassed the droid’s security protocols and accessed its vocabulator.

[ The Frog Lady is revealed to be speaking through a small vocabulator device, which translates her language through Q9-0. ]

Din Djarin: What the hell are you doing?

[ The Mandalorian slips his blaster back away in his holster, pointing up to the Frog Lady. ]

Din Djarin: That droid is a killer.

Frog Lady (through Q9-0): These eggs are the last brood of my life cycle. My husband has risked his life to carve out an existence for us on the only planet that is hospitable to our species. We fought too hard and suffered too much to resign ourselves to the extinction of our family line. I must demand that you hold true to the deal that you agreed to.

[ The Child looks on curiously. ]

Din Djarin: Look, lady, the deal is off. We’re lucky if we get off this frozen tomb with our lives.

Frog Lady (through Q9-0): I thought honoring one’s word was a part of the Mandalorian code. I guess those are just stories for children.

[ The Child looks up to the Mandalorian, cooing. The Mandalorian slowly glances down at him and then sighs. He looks back over to the Frog Lady and gets up, lifting the Child off of him before he stands. He swiftly grabs a toolbox, and leaves the ship to begin repairs. ]

Din Djarin: This was not a part of the deal.

[ The Mandalorian walks outside into the slowly atmosphere, the wind whistling and howling around him, as snow blows. Sparks emit from loose wires hanging down from his wrecked ship. The Mandalorian slowly walks around the damaged Razor Crest, examining the wreckage. He slowly walks up to the fuel tank, noticing that it is leaking badly. He looks up and examines the rest of the ice cavern, continuing to walk around his ship, as the camera pans up. A bright light blind the view, and we cut to a shot of the Mandalorian welding something on the ship. He looks over to see the Child, standing on the icy, cold ground, speaking in his gibberish language. He is pointing to something. ]

Din Djarin: How ‘bout you come over here, give me a hand? Make yourself useful.

[ The Mandalorian turns back to his broken ship, and continues to the weld on it. The Child slowly lowers his hand, and sighs with a coo. He begins walking away to get the Mandalorian’s attention, and the Mandalorian ceases his welding and looks over as the Child leaves. ]

Din Djarin: Hey, kid.

[ The Child continues to walk away, ignoring him, prompting the Mandalorian to set his welding gun down, and quickly follow him around the ship. ]

Din Djarin: I said hey! Where are you going? Come back here!

[ The Child has stopped at a small mound of snow, and the Mandalorian kneels down beside him, the two looking towards a trail of the Frog Lady’s footprints through the snow, leading away from the ship. ]

Din Djarin: When did she go?

[ The Child responds in his odd language, and the Mandalorian scans the footprints through the thermal scanner on his helmet, making it easier for him to see where they lead, which is in a large ice cave. The Mandalorian picks the Child up and begins following the footprints, walking slowly into and through the icy cave, where many sharp icicles hang down from the slick ceiling. He and the Child look around nervously as they walk, and they follow the footprints around another bend. The Mandalorian turns the thermal scanner back on on his helmet, seeing them lead to a place where, behind an ice wall, more heat is coming from. The Mandalorian quickly follows the footprints around to an ice cave, where the Frog Lady is wading in some hot springs, her eggs floating around her. ]

Din Djarin: There you are.

[ The Mandalorian quickly walks towards the edge of the pools, looking around and examining the rest of the small cave. ]

Din Djarin: You can’t leave the ship. It’s not safe out here.

[ The Frog Lady croaks, as the Mandalorian sets the Child down at the edge of the pool. He looks into the blue water at the floating eggs. The Mandalorian kneels down to the edge of the largest pool as well. ]

Din Djarin: Let’s gather these up.

[ The Frog Lady begins croaking in anxiety as the Mandalorian grabs her eggs and places them back into the blue canister. ]

Din Djarin: I know it’s warm. But night’s coming fast, and I can’t protect you out here.

[ The Mandalorian continues to gather up the eggs, and the Frog Lady speaks in her language yet again, croaking as she pushes an egg forward to help the Mandalorian. He grabs it, and the two continue to work to get all of the eggs back into the canister, as the Child flits his right hand in the water near the eggs. The Mandalorian blocks him from grabbing them with his hand, sticking his finger out. ]

Din Djarin: No. No!

[ The Child looks at him and whines, as the Mandalorian resumes gathering the eggs. The Child turns around and begins sniffing and cooing curiously, looking towards a large amount of blue eggs sticking out of the ground. He slowly walks over to them, as the Mandalorian and Frog Lady are still distracted by gathering the eggs. The Child walks through the snow amongst the field of blue eggs, and approaches one, sniffing it, and soon pulling away at its soft shell. The shell is quickly pulled apart, and the child grabs a bluish-white ice spider out from inside, sticky strands of a yellow-brown substance coating it. He quickly crunches it down. We cut back to the Mandalorian and the Frog Lady continuing to collect the rest of the eggs. As the Child finishes off his ice spider, the shot zooms out to reveal all of the other blue ice spider eggs shaking and cracking open, small spiders climbing out of them. The Frog Lady pushes the last of her eggs towards the Mandalorian, which he loads into the canister, but he is soon distracted by the cooing of the Child, who is running towards him through the field of hatching eggs. The Mandalorian stands up to see the eggs hatching, and quickly grabs the Child, as the Frog Lady croaks in nervousness. The Mandalorian closes the egg canister, and hoists it onto his back with the strap attached to it. The Frog Lady continues to swiftly look around, gasping. She grabs her clothes with her tongue, which were sitting folded on the edge of the pool she was swimming in. The Mandalorian looks around as hundreds of small spiders crawl towards him, and the Frog Lady runs up next to him, now dressed in her clothes. They look up to a large cavern, where larger spiders crawl out from, including ones nearly half the size of the Mandalorian. A growl emits from the cavern, and an absolutely massive ice spider reveals itself. It growls, and the Mandalorian frantically gestures to the Frog Lady, who begins running, and quickly gets past him. ]

Din Djarin: Go, go, go! Back to the ship!

[ The Mandalorian continues to look on, as the giant spider growls even louder, and begins advancing towards him, along with the other, smaller ones. The spiders seem to crawl out from everywhere, as the Mandalorian follows quickly behind the running Frog Lady. The giant spider, who is unable to fit through the ice tunnels that they are running through, nearly catches up with them before they reach the tunnels, growling viciously. It snaps at them, missing them, before crawling above the shiny ceilings of the tunnels, directly above them. Its legs smash through the ceiling, as the smaller spiders follow closely behind the companions throughout the tunnels. The Mandalorian begins blasting the ice spiders with his pistol, killing several of them, but still very few of the total number. The giant ice spider sticks its head through a hole in the ice caverns, and spids a web from its mouth, blocking off a possible exit for the Mandalorian and Frog Lady. They quickly run the other away, as the Mandalorian continues to shoot the spiders. The Frog Lady, who is falling behind, looks back and croaks in fear. She begins leaping clumsily, like her species does in their natural environment, throughout the tunnels, slipping and sliding around, and quickly passing in front of the Mandalorian. One of the giant ice spider’s legs spears down from the ceiling, and the Frog Lady dodges it, and begins running on her feet again. The Mandalorian prepares three detonators, and throws the charges on both sides of the icy walls and onto the ceiling. They blow up, causing the ceiling to shatter. The massive ice spider falls through with a large thud onto the ground, and the Mandalorian looks to see that it is seemingly defeated. Continuing to shoot spiders throughout the cavern, the Mandalorian and the Frog Lady - who is still croaking greatly in nervousness - stop, and the Mandalorian ignites his flamethrower on his wrist. We see a shot of another part of the cave, and the icy walls are lit up with orange, shimmering, flickering reflections. The Frog Lady hops around a bend, followed closely by the Mandalorian. Although the Mandalorian was able to subdue the spiders, many still follow not too far behind him and his companions. As they exit the cave, the Mandalorian continues to shoot the spiders, and swiftly retreats to his ship. The Frog Lady hops into the entrance of the ship, and the Mandalorian hands the Child to her, whom she sets down. The Child runs off into the ship in fright. The Mandalorian then hands the Frog Lady her canister of eggs, which she swiftly takes as well. One medium-sized spider swiftly shoots a web at the Mandalorian, sticking his blaster-holding arm to the side of the ship. A small spider jumps at him as he struggles, and he squishes it in his hand, green juices squeezing out of it, as he throws it on the ground to his side, hard. He quickly untraps his hand, pulling it away from the side of the ship, and continues shooting the vicious ice spiders. The spiders pursue him into his ship, as he continues shooting them. He hurriedly climbs up the ladder to the cockpit, shooting as many spiders who try to climb up after him as he can. Unable to handle them, he backs up into the cockpit, the doors sliding partially shut, however being held open by the ice spiders. He continues shooting them as they pile up to get through. The Child peeks around his leg, as several smaller spiders are able to get inside of the cockpit. One of the small spiders crawls onto the Child’s head, and he whimpers and screams, raising his arms up to get it off. A blaster bolt quickly shoots it, destroying it, and then shoots another two ice spiders approaching the Child. It is revealed that the very small blaster is being used by the Frog Lady, who is sitting with her eggs up against the main control console in the cockpit. The Mandalorian finally activates his flamethrower, and is able to burn enough ice spiders and hold the others off to get the doors of the cockpit closed. The Child looks up anxiously as he does this. The Mandalorian begins panting, and he and the Frog Lady look at each other. The ice spiders continue to crawl over the glass of the cockpit from the outside. The Mandalorian sits in his pilot’s chair and begins flipping and pressing several different things. ]

Din Djarin: Strap yourselves in. This better work.

[ The Frog Lady croaks and holds her egg canister to her body tightly, as the Mandalorian continues flipping things and pressing other things. The Child climbs to his lap. ]

Din Djarin: I’ve got limited visibility. It’s gonna be a bumpy ride.

[ The engines roar to life with the Mandalorian’s pull of a lever, and the Razor Crest slowly begins rising out of the ice and snow. However, before it can take off adequately, the giant ice spider falls on top of it, revealing itself to still be alive. The ship crashes back down to the cold, slick surface of the cavern. The giant ice spider smashes its leg through the glass and into the cockpit twice. It peers through the glass, and pushes its mouth up against it, sticking it to the window and rubbing along it in an attempt to eat it, seemingly. The Child looks up in fright. As the giant ice spider is suddenly about to strike down again, a few red blaster bolts from outside shoot it in the head, and it falls off of the ship. The Mandalorian and the Child look around in surprise, as more blaster fire emits outside, and the Mandalorian wheels his chair around, standing up and walking out of the cockpit. He sets the Child down, and arms himself with his blaster as the doors slide open. Closing the cockpit doors so the other will be safe, he advances on, as the Frog Lady nervously looks up through the window. The Mandalorian pushes and pulls a lot of webbing away as he walks slowly through the hull of his ship. A small ice spider is crawling off to the side, which he quickly shoots. He slowly approaches the side exit to the ship and walks outside. Many ice spiders are being shot off the side of his ship by the two X-Wing pilots, who have landed and are using their rifles, their cockpits open, and their headlights glaring brightly. They’re able to kill the rest of the spiders, and they quickly cease their shooting, lowering their guns, as the Mandalorian walks towards them reluctantly. ]

Captain Carson Teva: We ran the tabs on the Razor Crest.

[ The Mandalorian slowly lowers his pistol as well. ]

Captain Carson Teva: You have an arrest warrant, for the abduction of prisoner X-Six-Nine-Eleven. However, onboard security records show that you apprehended three priority culprits from the Wanted Register. Security records also show that you put your own life in harm’s way to try to protect that of Lieutenant Davan from the New Republic Correctional Corps. Is this true?

Din Djarin: Am I under arrest?

Captain Carson Teva: Technically, you should be. But these are trying times.

Din Djarin: What say I forego the bounties on these three criminals, and you two help me fuse my hull so I can get off this frozen rock?

[ Trapper Wolf smirks at this, and Captain Carson Teva looks a bit annoyed. ]

Captain Carson Teva: What say you fix that transponder, and we don’t vaporize that antique the next time we patrol the Rim?

[ The two pilots look at each other, and begin climbing back into their cockpits, which close. As the Mandalorian looks on, the two X-Wings slowly lift up and take off, out of the ice caverns, through a hole at the top. The Mandalorian turns back around to his ship, as the red light from their tail lights fades from reflecting on his helmet and other beskar armor. The Mandalorian walks back into his ship and addresses the Frog Lady and the Child, who are now down in the hull themselves. ]

Din Djarin: All right. I’m gonna repair the cockpit enough for us to limp to Trask. There’s nothing I can do about the main hull’s integrity, so we’re gonna have to get cozy in the cockpit. It’s the only thing I can pressurize. If you need to use the privy, do it now. It’s gonna be a long ride.

[ We now cut to the Child curiously watching the Mandalorian welding something inside of the cockpit of the ship, and we then cut to him welding something on the outside of the ship, seemingly a large metal plate to cover up one of the holes the giant ice spider broke through. The Child still continues to watch him through the glass of the cockpit. Finally, the doors slide shut, as the Mandalorian walks into the cockpit, holding the Child in his arms. He sits down in his chair. ]

Din Djarin: Okay, repair’s all done. Let’s see if we can get this thing going once and for all.

[ The Mandalorian begins flipping, pressing, and pushing various things in the cockpit. He pulls a lever to start up the engine, which works perfectly. The Razor Crest slowly rises out of the ice canyon, the large legs of the giant ice spiders sliding off of the cockpit. The Frog Lady squeals. Hitting a few ice walls along the way, the Razor Crest successfully rises fully out of the cavernous ice caves, and flies away from Maldo Kreis, out of the atmosphere, limping along throughout space. The Mandalorian flicks a few more things. ]

Din Djarin: Wake me up if someone shoots at us. Or that door gets sucked off its rails.

[ The Frog Lady says something in her own language. ]

Din Djarin: I’m kidding. If that happened, we’d all be dead. Sweet dreams.

[ The Mandalorian crosses his arms and lays his head back against the seat, as the Frog Lady croaks a little bit more. The Child turns to look and her and the canister of her eggs, grunting. The Frog Lady says something else in Frog, and holds the canister closer to her, protectively. The Child turns back towards the window out of the damaged cockpit, and coos, lifting an egg up and slurping it down, revealing that he somehow had already somehow gotten one. The quite damaged Razor Crest continues to float through space, slowly limping its way along, as the engines sputter indefinitely. As it travels into the vast sea of stars, we then cut to black, and the credit start to roll. ]


Ep 11 - The Heiress

[ We open on a shot of a large, green planet that is assumed to be the gas giant, Kol Iben. Just past it, a small, blue moon can be seen. The damaged Razor Crest comes into frame, slowly limping its way towards the blue moon - Trask. The engines are still flickering, and the back ramp hangs open, bouncing up and down as it drifts through space. Inside the cockpit, the Child is dozing in a chair, the Frog Lady is gripping tightly to her canister of eggs as she snores, and the Mandalorian has fallen asleep as well, slumped in the pilot’s chair. An alarm begins beeping, signifying the arrival to Trask, and the Mandalorian quickly wakes up, and looks at the alert on the navigational screen on the control console. The Child rubs his eyes and coos, as the Frog Lady wakes as well. ]

Din Djarin: Looks like we made it. Get ready for landing.

[ As they approach the estuary moon, the Mandalorian flicks a few switches and presses a few buttons. Something seems not to be working, and he hits the control console in frustration. ]

Din Djarin: Dank farrik! The landing array isn’t responding. Without the guidance system, it’ll be a manual re-entry. It might get a little choppy.

[ The Child whimpers as the Mandalorian continues pressing and switching things. ]

Din Djarin: Once we’re through the atmosphere, there should be just enough fuel to slow us down. If we don’t burn to a crisp.

[ The Mandalorian angles the ship upwards as it begins entering Trask’s atmosphere, falling at an increasingly fast pace. The bottom of the ship begins to heat rapidly, and soon bursts into flames. Alarms blare in the cockpit, and the Mandalorian hurriedly adjusts some things around it. ]

Din Djarin: Come up here, I need your hands!

[ The Frog Lady, who he was talking to, carefully sets her egg canister down and goes up to the Mandalorian, grunting nervously. She attempts to hold her eggs in place so they don’t fall. ]

Din Djarin: This lever needs to stay back. Can you do that?

[ The Frog Lady grunts in agreement, and grabs on to the lever, holding it back like she was asked to do. ]

Din Djarin: Keep it steady. Here we go.

[ The Frog Lady nervously glances back at her sloshing egg canister, and the ship gains more momentum, burning and zooming into the atmosphere even further. On the surface of the docks of Trask, specifically the one where the Mandalorian is intending on landing, a Mon Calamari dock worker looks up to the burning hunk of metal in the sky in great annoyance. The Razor Crest is nearly upon the docks now, and finally Trask Flight Control wires in. ]

Trask Flight Control (comm): Razor Crest, this is Trask flight control. Please reduce your speed to port protocol.

Din Djarin: I’m trying my best here. Engage reverse thrusters. Brace!

[ The Frog Lady, her hand still on the lever that she needs to keep back, turns to hold her egg canister in place as well, carefully pushing it up against the seat so it will be more secure. The Mandalorian pulls another lever, and the landing sequence begins. He is able to gain a bit more control of his ship, with begins to slow down as it approaches the landing dock. ]

Din Djarin: Hold on.

[ Metal pieces fly off of the Razor Crest as it grows ever closer, still travelling far too fast. ]

Trask Flight Control (comm): Razor Crest, do you copy? You have to reduce speed.

Din Djarin: Almost there, almost there.

Trask Flight Control (comm): Razor Crest, do you copy? Razor Crest, you’re coming in too fast, you have to re-

[ The Mandalorian shuts the comm off as red lights flash on the landing pad below him, and he positions his ship through the navigational computer to line up with the dock. He quickly brakes, and is able to slow his ship down enough to unsteadily land on the dock. He slowly lowers himself down to touch the ground, as the Mon Calamari dock worker continues to look on in sheer annoyance. ]

Din Djarin: Here we go. Nice and easy.

[ The landing computer is lining up, but before the Razor Crest is able to touch the ground, the right engine sputters and part of it blows up, causing the ship to fall over and topple into the water, making a great splash. The Mon Calamari dock worker shakes his head in disapproval. The main title comes onto the screen, followed by the chapter title (which is “Chapter Eleven : The Heiress”.) We cut to a large crane lifting the Razor Crest out of the bay, slowly. In the cockpit, the passengers shift around as the crane lifts them up. Covered in seaweed, and water draining out from practically everywhere, the ship is very slowly lowered onto the dock, where it finally settles with a metallic clang, as water pours out of the engines. The Mandalorian and the Frog Lady exit the ship, water dripping down onto them as they leave, and walk into the bustling crowd of the docks of Trask, which is primarily comprised of Mon Calamari and Quarren. The Mandalorian approaches the Mon Calamari dock worker. ]

Dock Worker: So, how can I help you?

Din Djarin: Can you fix it?

[ The dock worker looks over the ship a bit. ]

Dock Worker: Fix it? Nah. But I can make it fly.

Din Djarin: Do what you can.

[ The Mandalorian taps a payment button on the dock worker’s datapad, and walks away with the Frog Lady, who is glancing all around, looking for her husband. ]

Dock Worker: I’ll fuel it up. If it still holds fuel.

[ The Frog Lady continues to walk around the docks, and shouts out in her Frog language. After glancing around a bit, she hears the lower croaking call of her husband, and widens her eyes and mouth when she sees him looking for her on the other side of the dock. She runs to him happily, squealing, and they embrace. As the Mandalorian approaches with the Child in his pod by his side, the Frog Man lifts the egg canister off of his wife’s back, and looks at the eggs inside, as he converses intimately with his wife. The Child looks up to the Mandalorian, both of whom are watching the two, and coos at him longingly. ]

Din Djarin: I know you’re hungry. We’ll get you something to eat.

[ The Child looks back down at the eggs, whimpering. The Frog Man stands up and grabs the Mandalorian’s arm, sincerely thanking him for his help in transporting his wife. ]

Din Djarin: You’re welcome. I was told you could lead me to others of my kind.

[ The Frog Man nods and points over to a building offscreen, grunting in his odd language. ]

Din Djarin: The inn? Over there?

[ The Frog Man kneels back down to his wife and their eggs, as the Mandalorian looks over to see a mysterious woman in a cloak watching him from afar, amongst the crates on the dock. As several Trask inhabitants pass by her, she vanishes. The Mandalorian looks on suspiciously, and continues to follow the Frog Lady and the Frog Man across the docks and to the inn. We cut to inside of the inn, where a viscous soup is being sloshed into a bowl from a tube by a Mon Calamari server. The Quarren at the table pulls the bowl towards him once it has filled, and begins eating it. Other Mon Calamari, Quarren, and a few humans dot the cantina. The Frog Man enters first, waving to a Mon Calamari server, who waves back. The two Frog people point to the inside of the inn. ]

Din Djarin: Thank you.

Server: Have a seat over there.

[ The server gestures to a table, where the Mandalorian sits down. The Child is already at the table in his pod. The Mon Calamari server approaches the table slowly. ]

Server: What can I get you?

Din Djarin: Nothing for me. A bowl of chowder for my friend.

Server: These seats are scarce, buddy. Everyone seated needs to eat.

Din Djarin: I can buy something else.

[ The Mandalorian places three Calamari Flan on the table, sliding them forward. ]

Din Djarin: Information.

[ The server takes the money. ]

Din Djarin: Have you seen others that look like me?

[ The server looks over his shoulder and glances at another part of the room, before pulling down a tube and filling the Child’s bowl with the viscous soup. ]

Server: Others with beskar have been through here.

[ The server lifts the tube up and slides the bowl up to the Child. ]

Din Djarin: Who can take me to them?

Server: I know someone who might help.

[ The Mon Calamari server turns and walks over to another table to speak to a Quarren ferryman, as the Child pokes at his soup. ]

Server: (quietly) There’s a Mandalorian. Looking for others of his kind. He was askin’ about passage. He’s wearing beskar.

[ As the Child is poking at his food with his large wooden spoon, a small, tan squid-like creature jumps out of it, sticking to his face. He cries out, scared. As the Quarren ferryman walks over to the table, the Mandalorian looks over to the Child. ]

Din Djarin: Don’t play with your food.

[ The Mandalorian pokes the creature lightly with his knife, causing it to fall back into the bowl, and the Child to calm down. The Child looks back into the bowl and then back up at the Mandalorian, then back down to the bowl again, as the Quarren ferryman sits down at their table. ]

Ferryman: Hmm. You seek others of your kind?

Din Djarin: Have you seen them?

Ferryman: Aye. I can bring you to them. (chuckles)

Din Djarin: Where?

Ferryman: Only a few hours’ sail. It’ll cost you, though.

[ We cut to the large trawler traveling along the ocean, with a Quarren crew on board, handing over ropes to one another and unloading barrels, etc. The Mandalorian and the Child are at the side railing, looking out into the oceans of Trask. ]

Crewmate 1 (background): Coming around.

Crewmate 2 (background): Try the other side.

Crewmate 3 (background): Oh, give me! Yeah, thank you.

Crewmate 2 (background): Over the side!

[ The ferryman/trawler captain walks up to the Mandalorian and rest his hand on the railing of the ship, holding a large metal rod. ]

Ferryman: You ever see a Mamacore eat? Quite a sight. Child might take an interest.

[ The Child looks up to the Mandalorian, cooing. The Mandalorian looks at him in return. ]

Ferryman: You should take a look. Come on over here. Get a good view. Let the kid see.

[ The Quarren ferryman leads the Mandalorian and the Child over to a large pit in the middle of the trawler, covered by a gate of metal bars. As the ferryman pulls a rope to drop a next of fish into the pit, the Child’s pod goes up to the edge of the pit, and the Mandalorian blocks him from going any further. ]

Din Djarin: All right, close enough.

[ The Quarren ferryman grunts as he adjusts the rope, and the gate slides open. ]

Ferryman: There we go.

[ Another Quarren pulls a lever, and the next splits open, spilling the fish out into the watery pit. Everyone watches as bubbles emerge from the depths of the water. ]

Ferryman: She must be hungry. Oftentimes we’ll feed her in the early morning, but we missed that ‘cause we were goin’ out of port!

[ At this last word, the Quarren ferryman hits the Child’s pot into the watery pit with the large metal rod that he is holding. ]

Din Djarin: No!

[ The Child and his pod float right into the middle of the pit, and the very large, toothed mouth of the Mamacore soon emerges, eating the pod whole, just before the top part closes. The Mandalorian dives in hurriedly, and a Quarren crewmate quickly closes the gate. ]

Ferryman: Lock it up! Go, go! Now! Go! The beskar is ours! (laughing maniacally)

[ The Mandalorian quickly emerges from the underwater pit/tank, grabbing the bars at the top and coughing. ]

Ferryman: Drown him!

[ One of the Quarren crewmates sticks their metal pole through the bars, trying to push the poor Mandalorian back down into the watery depths. Multiple others do it as well. ]

Crewmate 1 (background): Get him! Get him! There we go!

Crewmate 2 (background): Drown him.

[ The Mandalorian coughs as one of the metal poles hits his helmet, disorienting him and submerging him back into the waters. The Quarrens look down into the pit, still laughing. ]

Ferryman: We’re rich, brothers!

[ The Mandalorian emerges yet again from the waters of the dark pit. Some Quarrens gasp. ]

Ferryman: He didn’t sink! Finish him! Keep him down!

[ The crewmates oblige, continuing to intensely jam their metal poles into the cage. The Mandalorian continues coughing as all of the Quarren continue jabbing their metal poles into him. Suddenly, he sees another Mandalorian rocket down from the sky and kick one of the Quarren down from through the bars. She shoots this Quarren in the head, and then proceeds to fight off two others. Another female Mandalorian appears, kicking one of the Quarren. The Mandalorian continues to cough in the pit, as the first Mandalorian who appeared fist-fights with a Quarren, stabbing him and then banging him up against a hard metal pole. The other female Mandalorian throws a Quarren overboard, and a male Mandalorian comes down with the help of his jetpack and fights three Quarren at the same time, knocking one out. The other two are grappled at the ankles by the other two Mandalorian, and thrown down. The male Mandalorian shoots both of them once they’ve been pulled down. As the Mandalorian coughs, the first female Mandalorian looks into the pit towards him. The barred gate is pulled back, presumably operated by one of the other Mandalorians. The female Mandalorian reaches her hand out to the Mandalorian. ]

Female Mandalorian #1: Take my hand.

[ The Mandalorian takes the female Mandalorian’s hand, and is slowly pulled out of the water. ]

Din Djarin: There’s a creature. It has the Child.

Female Mandalorian #2: On it!

[ The second female Mandalorian dives into the watery pit, as the other one helps the Mandalorian sit down on a tangled up pile of thick ropes. ]

Din Djarin: The Child. Help the Child.

Female Mandalorian #1: Don’t worry, brother. We’ve got this.

[ The other female Mandalorian walks up next to the male Mandalorian, and the two mysterious figures in blue, white, and black armor watch the water, as the protagonist Mandalorian stays back on the pile of ropes, still breathing very heavily. The Mamacore is screeching from underwater, and there is blaster fire heard. Yellowish-white flashes can be seen from the surface of the water. The screeching soon stops, and the water is still for a moment, before the female Mandalorian comes bursting out, going up in the air and then landing back on the trawler’s surface. She brings the bent pod of the Child to the Mandalorian, and tears off one side of the dented metal casing, grabbing the unharmed Child from inside and handing him to the Mandalorian. ]

Female Mandalorian #2: Here you go, little one.

[ The Mandalorian, still panting heavily and dripping wet, makes sure the Child is uninjured. The other three mysterious Mandalorians watch him as he does so. He looks up to them. ]

Din Djarin: Thank you. I’ve been searching for more of our kind.

Female Mandalorian #1: Well, lucky we found you first.

Din Djarin: I’ve been quested to deliver this Child. I was hoping that...

[ The Mandalorian stops speaking to the others, as the three remove their helmets. The Mandalorian stands up, as the Child looks to the three, and then back up at the Mandalorian. These three, by the way, are Bo-Katan Kryze (Female Mandalorian #1), Koska Reeves (Female Mandalorian #2, and Axe Woves (Male Mandalorian.) ]

Din Djarin: Where did you get that armor?

Bo-Katan Kryze: This armor has been in my family for three generations.

Din Djarin: You do not cover your face. You are not Mandalorian.

Axe Woves: He’s one of them.

Bo-Katan Kryze: Dank farrik.

Din Djarin: One of what?

Bo-Katan Kryze: I am Bo-Katan of Clan Kryze. I was born on Mandalore and fought in the Purge. I am the last of my line. And you are a Child of the Watch.

Din Djarin: The Watch?

Bo-Katan Kryze: Children of the Watch are a cult of religious zealots that broke away from Mandalorian society. Their goal was to re-establish the ancient way.

[ The Child looks up at the Mandalorian. ]

Din Djarin: There is only one way. The Way of the Mandalore.

[ The Mandalorian walks away from an annoyed-looking Bo-Katan Kryze, and quickly uses his jetpack to fly off of the old, ransacked trawler. Koska Reeves and Axe Woves look at each other, and Bo-Katan sighs. We cut to a shot of the sunset, the figures of the three Mandalorians led by Bo-Katan flying off of the ship. It soon explodes and sinks once they leave, as the Mandalorian watches from the docks. He turns around and walks away, as the shot blurs out a bit. We cut to him walking along the docks, and it is now nighttime. A large trawler with a huge tower on its back departs from the ports behind him. As he walks amongst the cargo on the dock, he hears some bizarre metal clanging. Suddenly, a Quarren’s voice calls out towards him. ]

Thug: Hey! You...

[ The tough-looking Quarren thug walks out from behind some cargo with a metal bar in his hand. He slowly approaches the Mandalorian, as do multiple other Quarren from various sides. The Mandalorian very slowly comes to a stop. ]

Thug: You killed my brother.

[ Many more Quarren begin to approach with metal bars and various different weapons for hurting the Mandalorian. ]

Din Djarin: Let me pass.

Thug: (chuckles) I don’t think you understand.

[ Another Quarren positions himself with a medium-sized rifle behind a large cargo bin. The Mandalorian looks over to him, as he prepares the rifle to fire, seemingly charging it up. ]

Thug: You killed my brother...and now, I’m gonna kill your pet.

[ The Child whimpers in nervously, his ears going down. The Quarren continue to approach the Mandalorian, before the three other Mandalorian suddenly and very quickly descend from the sky, flanking the Mandalorian. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: He didn’t kill your brother. I did.

[ The Quarren thug looks to her in confusion for a moment, before she and her two comrades very quickly pull their blasters out, shooting down all of the Quarren thugs on the dock, including the ones behind them. They slip their blasters back away in their holsters, and Bo-Katan turns to the Mandalorian. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: Can we at least buy you a drink?

[ We cut to the four Mandalorian and the Child gathered around a table in the back of the inn. The Mandalorian has not removed his helmet, but all of the others have in order to eat. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: Trask is a black market port. They’re staging weapons that have been bought and sold with the plunders of our planet. We’re seizing those weapons and using them to retake our home world. Once we’ve done that, we’ll seat a new Mandalore on the throne.

Din Djarin: That planet is cursed. Anyone who goes there dies. Once the Empire knew they couldn’t control it, they made sure no one else could either.

Bo-Katan Kryze: Don’t believe everything you hear. Our enemies wanna seperate us. But Mandalorians are stronger together.

Din Djarin: That’s not part of my plan. I’ve been quested with returning this Child to the Jedi.

Bo-Katan Kryze: What do you know of the Jedi?

Din Djarin: Nothing. I was hoping you would help me by Creed.

[ The Child looks on and whimpers from his seat at the table, as Koska Reeves sucks a tentacle up from her soup, which the Child looks very interested in. Bo-Katan and Axe Woves look at each other unsurely. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: I can lead you to one of their kind. But first, we need your help on our mission.

Din Djarin: Mission?

[ Bo-Katan looks to him, raising her eyebrows. We cut to the four Mandalorian on top of the Razor Crest, looking out at a large freighter floating above the Trask waters at the docks. It seems to be the early morning. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: You see that Imperial Gozanti freighter? It’s being loaded with weapons as we speak. According to the port’s manifest, it’s scheduled to depart at first light.

Din Djarin: So we stow away?

Koska Reeves: We’ve been hitting ‘em pretty hard. They scan for life forms as a precaution before pushing back.

Din Djarin: If you wanna do this with four, you’re gonna need the element of surprise.

Bo-Katan Kryze: Exactly. The freighter will maintain trawling speed while inside the shipping lanes and then ascend in orbit. We’ll jet up when they’re cruising at low speed in atmosphere. The tower won’t allow them to climb until they’ve left the port’s airspace.

Din Djarin: Troopers?

Bo-Katan Kryze: A squad at most.

Axe Woves: And they couldn’t hit the side of a Bantha.

[ Koska Reeves smirks as Bo-Katan turns around and looks at the Mandalorian, who nods. We cut to the Mandalorian knocking on a metal door. It opens up to reveal the Frog Lady and Frog Man, sitting at their table with their egg canister. ]

Din Djarin: Something’s come up. Can I leave him with you for a bit?

[ The Frog Lady responds, croaking a bit and agreeing. The Mandalorian walks through the door, and begins speaking to the Child. The door closes behind him. ]

Din Djarin: You are gonna stay here, so I want you to be respectful. And mind your manners.

[ The Mandalorian hands the Child to the Frog Lady, who takes him in her arms. ]

Din Djarin: You know what I’m talking about.

[ The Frog Lady says something else in Frog to the Mandalorian. ]

Din Djarin: Thanks.

[ The Frog Lady holds the Child up to the side of the egg tank so he can look in, as the Mandalorian exits the room. ]

Din Djarin: I’ll be back for him.

[ The Child touches the egg canister and looks inside curiously. A small baby frog hatches from one of the eggs, and the Child opens his mouth and coos in excitement, watching it swim. We cut to a shot of the large Imperial Gozanti freighter lifting up from the docks of Trask. It slowly begins travelling up above the water. It slowly lifts higher and higher up into the air, and the four Mandalorians can be seen flying above it, ready to land on it. They quickly fly above it and then down on it. On the outer rails, two Stormtroopers are stationed. Axe Woves lands first, knocking one of them off of the railing. The other Stormtrooper is quickly taken out by Bo-Katan. As the Mandalorian lands, another Stormtrooper exits the ship onto the railing, closing the door so they can’t get in. ]

Stormtrooper: Pirates.

[ The remaining singular Stormtrooper is quickly dispatched by Bo-Katan, as Koska Reeves lands. Grabbing around the Stormtrooper, Koska flies off on her jetpack, still holding him, as he screams. Inside of the ship, the signature Imperial alarm is blaring off, as the Imperial captain who runs it walks past two Stormtroopers and into the cockpit with the pilots, a freighter pilot and a security officer. ]

Security Officer: Pirates again.

[ Suddenly, the Stormtrooper’s body that Koska Reeves has been carrying, is thrown up against the windshield of the ship’s cockpit. He sticks for a moment, grunts and groans a bit, before being pulled off again, screaming, by the force of the wind as the freighter moves. The security officer widens his eyes, and turns around to look at the Imperial captain. The captain turns around to his Stormtroopers nearby. ]

Captain: Guard that hall.

[ He turns back to his officers in the cockpit. ]

Captain: Seal the hatch.

Pilot: Yes, sir.

[ The pilot obliges, pressing a button that closes the door into the cockpit. The captain looks very resolute. We now cut to Axe Woves opening the door to get inside of the ship with a device that extends from his wrist cuffs. The door is opened, and the Mandalorians draw their weapons, with Bo-Katan extending a knife from her wrist. Two large doors open and three Stormtroopers run out from somewhere inside of the ship. ]

Stormtrooper: A breach in security. Check the exterior door.

[ Suddenly, Bo-Katan enters the ship, very quickly dispatching the three Stormtroopers, shooting and stabbing them. The others enter behind her, and they begin to walk along the inside hallway. More doors open, and multiple Stormtroopers exit. All of the Mandalorians draw their weapons, as a large barrage of blaster fire comes at them, doing no damage, as they’re all wearing very resilient beskar armor. On one side of the hallway, Bo-Katan and Axe Woves stand behind a console up against the wall, Koska Reeves and the Mandalorian doing the same on the other side. The Mandalorian grunts as he shoots out at the Stormtroopers. Quickly, Bo-Katan exits the hiding place, and the others flank her. They are able to quickly shoot down many other Stormtroopers. They duck in hiding again. After a moment, Koska nods to Axe and Bo-Katan, who emerge from their hiding place and begin shooting, followed by the others. Soon, all of the Stormtroopers have been shot down. The three Trask-based Mandalorians continue to confidently walk along the hallway, shooting control consoles and other things. The Mandalorian reluctantly follows behind them. We cut back to the cockpit. ]

Captain: What’s going on? How many of them are there?

[ Through a comlink, a Stormtrooper speaks to him. ]

Stormtrooper (comm): Hard to say. At least ten, maybe more.

Security Officer: Sir, there are only four life forms.

Stormtrooper (comm): Wait, they’re Mandalorian. We’ve- (screams)

[ Blaster fire is heard through the comlink as the Stormtrooper is presumably shot down. The security officer turns his head back around and looks at the Imperial captain. The captain says nothing, just continues to stare forward out of the window. The security officer turns back to the control console in front of him. ]

Security Officer: They’re headed towards the cargo bay.

Captain: How long until we clear the atmosphere and can make the jump to hyperspace?

Pilot: We can’t climb until we leave the harbor zone, sir.

[ The Captain puts his hands on both of the pilot’s seats. ]

Captain: Climb now.

[ The two Imperials piloting the ship hesitate. ]

Captain: (loudly) Climb now.

[ The two pilots accelerate the engines of the transport, and it begins raising higher and higher as they pull back gradually on the levers. The engines surge, causing the water of the seas of Trask below them to be pushed back and spray out. The ship is now rapidly climbing upwards. We cut to the Mandalorians exiting out of two sliding doors. At the end of the corridor, there is a large contingent of Stormtroopers. ]

Stormtrooper: Look! Over there! Stop them!

[ The two parties begin shooting at each other, and the four Mandalorians hide behind some metal doors that are mostly opened, on either side of the corridor. The Mandalorian quickly rolls a beeping smoke bomb into the hallway towards the feet of the Stormtroopers. As the Stormtroopers continue advancing and shooting, the bomb explodes, leaving a shroud of grey smoke in the hallway, greatly obscuring the Stormtrooper’s views. Looking through their thermal scanners on their helmets, the Mandalorians walk out into the smoke and blast the Stormtroopers, who scream. They soon have all of them down, and continue moving through the ship. In another part of the ship, Stormtroopers are handing large guns to each other to prepare for their arrival. ]

Stormtrooper: Go, go, go!

[ The Stormtroopers begin advancing down the halls. Two of them run into the cargo bay, where a deck officer is stationed with multiple other Stormtroopers. The deck officer quickly speaks to the cockpit through his comlink. ]

Deck Officer: What’s happening?

Security Officer (comm): The intruders are heading your way.

[ Back in the cockpit, the Imperial captain addresses the deck officer through comlink. ]

Captain: Just hold them off long enough until we can make the jump to hyperspace...

[ Cut back to the cargo bay. ]

Captain (comm): ...and rendezvous with the fleet.

Deck Officer: Copy.

[ The nervous deck officer lowers the comlink, and soon raises his blaster, speaking to all of the Stormtroopers stationed all around him. ]

Deck Officer: We need to hold them off until we can make the jump to hyperspace.

[ The Imperials nervously watch the elevator doors, seeing three white hexagons lighting up in succession. It is tense, and the Stormtroopers ready their weapons. Soon after the third hexagon lights up, the Mandalorians exit the elevator, shooting and demolishing the Stormtroopers in the hallway before them. ]

Deck Officer: Close the doors.

Stormtrooper: Sir?

Deck Officer: Close the doors!

[ The officer runs to hide behind a cargo crate in a panic, as the Mandalorians continue blasting through the other Stormtroopers. ]

Stormtrooper: Which one?

Deck Officer: All of them! All of them!

[ One of the Stormtroopers presses a button on a control panel, closing one of the doors. ]

Deck Officer: Close all of them!

[ Cut back to the cockpit, where the captain and the other two Imperial officers look confused. ]

Deck Officer (comm): Close all the doors!

[ Back with the others, Bo-Katan is able to shoot a few more Stormtroopers before the last doors close the Mandalorians out from the cargo bay. The Imperial deck officer sighs in immense relief, getting up from behind the crates of cargo and speaking back into the comlink. ]

Deck Officer: I think we have them trapped, sir.

[ Cut back to the cockpit. ]

Captain: Trapped them where?

[ Cut back to the cargo bay. ]

Deck Officer: In the cargo control area.

[ Cut back to the cockpit, where the Captain widens his eyes. ]

Captain: Where?

Deck Officer (comm): In the cargo control area-

[ We cut back to the cargo bay, as the deck officer and Stormtroopers are soon shot out of the back of the large freighter, flying down to the seas, screaming. As the alarms blare and the people scream through the comlinks, the two pilots in the cockpit look shocked, and the captain looks extremely annoyed. The security officer reluctantly turns on one of the comlinks. ]

Security Officer: Come in. Do you copy?

[ We cut to the cargo bay, where the Mandalorians are removing the lids off of large cargo bins, where there are sets of guns and other various weapons packed up tightly. ]

Security Officer (comm): Do you copy?

[ Bo-Katan, who has since take off her helmet, speaks through the comlink to the cockpit. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: I copy. Thanks for packing up all this gear so nicely.

[ Cut back to the cockpit. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze (comm): Imagine what a division of us can do...

[ Cut back to cargo bay. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: ...when we get our hands on what’s inside these shiny little boxes.

[ Koska Reeves takes a large gun out of a box and looks it over. ]

Captain (comm): If you think you’re going to escape with those weapons, you are sadly mistaken. Even if you’ve managed to jettison a few of those…

[ Cut back to cockpit. ]

Captain: ...crates, we will comb the entire area until you are hunted down and killed.

[ Cut back to cargo bay. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: Oh, we’re not jettisoning anything. We’re taking the entire ship.

Din Djarin: What?

[ Koska Reeves looks back at the Mandalorian as she’s examining a large rifle-like gun. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: Put some tea on. We’ll be up in a minute.

[ Bo-Katan switches the comlink off, as the Mandalorian approaches her. ]

Din Djarin: This is more than I signed up for.

Bo-Katan Kryze: There is something I need, if I am to rule Mandalore. Something that was once mine. They know where it is, and soon, so will I. Regardless, we are taking the ship for the battles ahead.

Din Djarin: I got you your weapons. I have to return to my ship with the foundling.

Bo-Katan Kryze: If you want my help finding the Jedi, you will help me take this ship.

Din Djarin: You’re changing the terms of the deal.

Bo-Katan Kryze: This is the Way.

[ Bo-Katan smugly walks away from the Mandalorian. Axe Woves and Koska Reeves follow her, all three of them placing their helmets on as they walk off. The Mandalorian reluctantly walks after them. Back in the cockpit, a hologram is projected, however we can’t see the person’s face. ]

Man In Hologram: What is it, Captain?

Captain: Another pirate hijacking.

Man In Hologram : Were you able to eliminate them?

Captain: No. We need backup immediately.

Man In Hologram: Are these the same “pirates” that have attacked our other vessels?

Captain: They appear to be, sir.

Man In Hologram: How far have they gotten?

Captain: They’ve breached the cargo hold and taken everything but the bridge. We require immediate backup.

Man In Hologram: If they’ve taken that much of the ship, I’m afraid that’s no longer an option. You know what to do.

[ The main Imperial pilot looks nervous, glancing over at his security officer comrade. The hologram is revealed to be of Moff Gideon, the nefarious man who is looking for the Child. ]

Moff Gideon: Long live the Empire.

Captain: Long live the Empire.

[ The Imperial captain quickly takes his blaster off of his belt and shoots the two piloting officers. They scream out in pain and fall to the ground, as the captain takes the security officer’s pilot chair, pushing the rest of his slumped body out of the way. The captain grabs the steering mechanism of the vessel, and flicks a few switches, soon pushing the steering mechanism forward. The ship begins to go downwards towards the sea. We cut to the Mandalorians inside stumbling around unsteadily, Bo-Katan grunting in frustration. The ship continues to rapidly fly down to the sea. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: They’re taking the ship down. Let’s move!

[ The other Mandalorians follow her, their guns drawn, and they come to the final hallway leading up to the bridge. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: There’s the bridge. Come on!

[ A relatively large contingent of Stormtroopers reveal themselves in front of the Mandalorians. ]

Stormtrooper: Blast them!

[ The Stormtroopers quickly begin shooting, and the four Mandalorians duck for cover on either side of the hallway. The red blaster fire is shooting out rapidly. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: How many troopers?

Axe Woves: Six to ten. Two with heavy repeating blasters.

Koska Reeves: We’re losing altitude fast.

Bo-Katan Kryze: We need to move now.

Axe Woves: They have too much firepower!

Koska Reeves: Still dropping. Ten thousand.

[ The ship continues going down more and more towards the sea, and through the clouds. ]

Axe Woves: We’ll never make it to the bridge in time!

Koska Reeves: Nine thousand.

[ The Mandalorian looks over at the troopers at the end of the hallway with his thermal vision. ]

Koska Reeves: Eight thousand.

[ The Mandalorian quickly tucks his blaster away and activates two thermal detonators. ]

Koska Reeves: Seven thousand.

Din Djarin: Cover me.

[ The Mandalorian quickly runs out into the hallway, his beskar armor being hit constantly with the immense firepower. He stumbles around as he runs. The other Mandalorians begin to shoot after him at the Stormtroopers as well. The Mandalorian eventually falls to the ground, but is able to throw the two thermal detonators into the corridor with the Stormtroopers. They blow up quite quickly. The explosions shoot out through the corridors towards the Mandalorian. He ducks and covers as the flames shoot past him and soon dissipate. The other Mandalorians quickly run out as the Mandalorian hurriedly gets up. Axe Woves stays somewhat behind the others to guard them from behind. ]

Din Djarin: Come on!

[ As the Imperial captain continues driving the freighter towards the sea, the cockpit doors slide open, and the Mandalorian stumbles in. The captain is hurriedly pulled out of his seat by the Mandalorian, a seat which is soon occupied by the Mandalorian himself, while Koska Reeves gets in the other seat. Bo-Katan grabs the captain and pushes him up against the wall, holding the knife on her wrist to him. The Mandalorian and Koska strain to stabilize the ship. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: Where is it?

Captain: Where’s what?

Bo-Katan Kryze: The Darksaber. Does he have it?

Captain: If you’re asking, you already know.

[ The Mandalorian and Koska Reeves continue to try to stabilize the freighter. ]

Din Djarin: Easy. Easy.

[ They’re able to set the freighter stabilized just before it hits the water, nearly crashing into another boat on the water with a large metal part sticking up from it. The transport begins to ascend higher into the air again. The Mandalorian and Koska Reeves begin panting, as the Mandalorian flicks a few switches. We cut back to Bo-Katan confronting the Imperial captain. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: I’ll let you live. But you will take me to him.

Captain: You might let me live, but he won’t.

[ The Imperial captain quickly bites down on a capsule in his mouth that electrocutes him, and he falls to the floor, dead. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: No!

Koska Reeves: We have to go. He sent a distress signal.

Bo-Katan Kryze: Clear the atmosphere and prepare to jump.

[ The Mandalorian exits from his seat and prepares to leave the giant freighter. Bo-Katan confronts him. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: Are you sure you won’t join us?

Din Djarin: There’s something I need to do.

Bo-Katan Kryze: The offer stands if you change your mind.

Din Djarin: Where can I find the Jedi?

[ Bo-Katan removes her helmet and looks up at the Mandalorian. ]

Bo-Katan Kryze: Take the foundling to the city of Calodan on the forest planet of Corvus. There you will find Ahsoka Tano. Tell her you were sent by Bo-Katan. And thank you. Your bravery will not be forgotten. This is the Way.

Din Djarin: This is the Way.

[ The Mandalorian turns around and walks out of the cockpit, the doors sliding closed behind him. We cut to him exiting on the side rail, where he quickly jumps off, then proceeding to activate his jetpack and fly back to the Trask docks. We cut to back with the Child in the Frog Lady and Frog Man’s residency. One of the couple’s tadpoles is in a small wooden bowl of water, and the Child is curiously playing with it, cooing. Three sharp knocks are heard on the door, and the Mandalorian comes in. ]

Din Djarin: Thank you for watching him. Okay, kid. Come on. It’s time to go.

[ The Mandalorian picks up the Child, who begins squealing and crying, still wanting to stay with the tadpole. ]

Din Djarin: Let go. Come on, kid. (to Frog couple) Congratulations.

[ The Frog Man says something in Frog in response, as the Mandalorian exits with the Child. ]

Din Djarin: No, I have enough pets.

[ The door closes behind the Mandalorian and the Child as they exit. Once it is closed, the Frog Lady and the Frog Man bump noses lovingly and continue to play with their newborn child. Back at the docks, the Mandalorian approaches the Razor Crest, which has clearly been very poorly fixed up. Odd ropes and panels wrap around it, and are stuck to it. The Mon Calamari dock worker walks up next to the Mandalorian, his hands on his hips, as the Mandalorian looks at his ship in a bit of disbelief. ]

Din Djarin: I gave you a thousand credits, this was the best you could do?

[ Without a word, the dock worker holds out the data pad for the Mandalorian to pay. He reluctantly clicks two things, and the dock worker lowers the pad. The Mandalorian slowly approaches his ship. We cut to him walking into the cockpit, the doors sliding open. Fishnets are draped around, seemingly holding everything together. There is also rope and seaweed scattered around, tying various things together. The Mandalorian pushes a piece of netting aside as he steps into the cockpit. The doors close behind him, and he sets the Child in the passenger’s seat, sitting in the pilot’s one himself. He continues to look around in annoyance. ]

Din Djarin: Mon Calamari.

[ The Mandalorian flicks a few things to start up the ship, as the Child coos. ]

Din Djarin: Unbelievable.

[ The ship begins shakily leaving the docks, and it bounces around unpleasantly. The Mandalorian flips a few more switches as the ship takes off and he bounces a bit around. The Child notices a tan tentacled creature crawling up the ropes towards him. He watches it as it begins to descend down a rope right down to him. We see the odd view from the creature’s multiple eyes, showing a pattern of the Child. The Mandalorian quickly wheels around and grabs the creature. The Child giggles and laughs a bit, as the landing gear of the ship is tucked away, and it is able to properly leave Trask’s atmosphere. Small metal pieces fly off of it as it flies away. ]

Din Djarin: I finally know where I’m taking you. But it’s gonna be a bumpy ride.

[ The Child sucks down the tentacle of the odd creature that the Mandalorian had just caught, as the Razor Crest flies out of Trask’s atmosphere and back into space. It flies off into hyperspace, a sheet of metal detaching from it as it does, and spinning around in space for a bit after the ship has left. We then cut to black, and the credits start to roll. ]



Ep 12 - The Siege

Released on Disney+ on November 20, 2020

Plot:

The Mandalorian and the Child head to Nevarro for repairs for his ship, the Razor Crest, after the Mon Calamari repairs proved inadequate. They reunite with Greef Karga and Cara Dune there, who have since turned the planet around. Cara has assumed the position of Marshall, Greef has taken on the role of magistrate, assisted by Mythrol. In return for the repairs, The Mandalorian agrees to help destroy an old Imperial base on the other side of the planet. The Child is placed in new school built on Nevarro, and endeavours to steal macaron treats from a student.

The base, turns out to have more than just a skeleton crew and stormtroopers patrol the corridors. They deactivate the lava cooling system, so that the natural lava flows will destroy the base. During their escape, they come across a chamber filled with vats of what appear to be cloned bodies. The scientists in the chamber attempt to destroy the evidence. Mythrol uncovers a recording from Dr. Pershing that reveals he was using the blood of the Child, which contains a large ‘Mcount’ to harvest the clones. Stormtroopers soon swarm the team and they are forced to escape before the lava overheats and destroys the base.

The Mandalorian flies from the base to retrieve his ship, using his jetpack, whilst Karga, Dune and Mythrol steal a stormtrooper transport. A chase ensues between the transport, driven by Dune, and speeder bikes manned by scout troopers. Greef Karga kills the last scout trooper, but TIE fighters launched from the base chase after them, disabling the transport’s cannon. The base soon explodes due to the overheating of the lava. As the TIEFighters close in on Dune, Karga and Mythrol, the Razor Crest appears and destroys the Imperials, Mando and the Child at the helm.

With his ship repaired and Nevarro secured, Mando heads for Corvus to track down Ahsoka Tano. The New Republic visit Karga to investigate the incident, with Captain Carson Teva noting “something is brewing and we need to put a stop to it”. Teva speaks with Dune, who reveals she was from Alderaan and lost everything after its destruction. An Imperial officer receives confirmation from one of the mechanics working for Greef Karga, that a tracking beacon has been placed on the Razor Crest. Moff Gideon is informed, and declares that they will be ready.

Chapter 14: The Tragedy

Released on Disney+ on December 4, 2020

Plot:

The Mandalorian arrives with Grogu on Tython, and finds the ancient temple on top of a mountain. He seats Grogu at the center so that he may choose his path. Grogu meditates, and a protective Force field appears around him. Boba Fett arrives with the mercenary Fennec Shand, whose life he saved on Tatooine, and demands the return of his Mandalorian armor.[a] Following a tense confrontation, the Mandalorian agrees to trade the armor for the safety of Grogu. Two Imperial troop carriers arrive, disgorging stormtroopers who attempt to capture Grogu. Honoring their agreement, Fett, Shand, and the Mandalorian join forces to harry the advancing stormtroopers, inflicting heavy casualties.

Boba Fett retrieves his armor using it to wipe out many stormtroopers before firing a rocket that destroys the fleeing troop ships. Moff Gideon arrives in an Imperial light cruiser and destroys the Mandalorian’s ship Razor Crest from high overhead. Gideon sends out four Dark Troopers, who fly down and capture Grogu and take back to the cruiser. Fett and Shand agree to help the Mandalorian save Grogu to honor their debt. The Mandalorian seeks the now New Republic Marshal Cara Dune’s help in breaking out the criminal Mayfeld in order to track Gideon and rescue Grogu. Impressed with Grogu’s Force powers, Moff Gideon shows Grogu the Darksaber and has a stormtrooper stun and shackle him. After, Gideon informs Dr. Pershing that they have the donor.

Give me the kid. The kid is just fine where he is. Mesmerizing, isn't it? Used to belong to Bo-Katan. Yes. I know you've been traveling with Bo-Katan. A friendly piece of advice, assume that I know everything. Like the fact that your wrist launcher has fired its one and only salvo. Where is this going? This is where it's going. I'm guessing that Bo-Katan and her boarding party have arrived at the bridge, seeking me or, more accurately, this. But I'm not there. And I imagine that they've killed everyone on the bridge, being the murderous savages that they are. And now, they're beginning to panic. You see, she wants this. Do you know why? Because it brings power. Whoever wields this sword... has the right to lay claim to the Mandalorian throne. You keep it. I just want the kid. Very well. I've already got what I want from him. His blood. All I wanted was to study his blood. This Child is extremely gifted... and has been blessed with rare properties that have the potential to bring order back to the galaxy. I see your bond with him. Take him, but you will leave my ship immediately and we will go our separate ways. (BOTH GRUNTING) You're sparing my life? Well, this should be interesting. (DOOR CLOSES) What happened? CARA: He brought him in alive, that's what happened. And now the New Republic's gonna have to double the payment. That's not what she's talking about. Why don't you kill him now and take it? It's yours now. THE MANDALORIAN: What is? The Darksaber. It belongs to you. THE MANDALORIAN: Now... it belongs to her. She can't take it. It must be won in battle. In order for her to wield the Darksaber again, she would need to defeat you in combat. I yield. It's yours. Oh, no. (CHUCKLING) It doesn't work that way. The Darksaber doesn't have power. The story does. Without that blade, she's a pretender to the throne. He's right. THE MANDALORIAN: Come on, just take it. (ALARM BEEPING) Well, perhaps she'll get another crack at it. FENNEC SHAND: The ray shields have been breached. We're being boarded. How many life forms? None. You're about to face off with the dark troopers. You had your hands full with one. Let's see how you do against a platoon. BO-KATAN: They're headed this way. Don't worry, kid. I'm gonna get you out of here. Seal the blast doors! They're here. (POUNDING ON DOOR) You have an impressive fire team protecting you.
